Glad I did this tour. This tour was included free when you purchased a tour of the colosseum. I hadn't intended visiting Palatine Hill, but it was one of the most interesting and enjoyable tours in Rome. I would recommend it.

A WONDERFUL SITE FOR THOSE WITH STAMINA. This huge site is shared with the Forum and certainly in summer takes some stamina to circumnavigate. Best explored with a guide or an audio guide there is much to see and wonder at. Unlike the Colosseum you are permitted to take drinks into the site and I'd advise you do as there are no cafes or restaurants inside, just the very occasional vending machine if you can find it. The audio guides and maps are a must if not accompanied by a professional guide but be prepared to be frustrated as they can sometimes be frustrating and the use of English over complicated.
Very interesting . Nice place to visit. But for some locations you need to be prepared for a steep climb. Take 2 days if you really want see all and Combine it with the forum

Amazing views. The Palatine Hill was included as part of our Colosseum/Roman Forum ticket. It's well worth putting aside some time to check it out for the hilltop views alone. The view of the Roman Forum and Rome itself is stunning. Be prepared to take some info such as a guidebook with you to have any chance of understanding what you are looking at when walking amongs the ruins and sites as there is scant explanation provided. The ruins aren't as impressive as those at the Roman Forum, but are still interesting.

An amazing area to explore!. We spent two full days in the area of Palatine Hill and Ancient Rome. We took two guided tours of Palatine Hill and learned so much. There is so much history in this area and it's amazing to learn about everything. I strongly recommend learning everything possible about this seat of Roman power - both from reading before and from local tours. It's well worth all the time spent.

Great Views of the Forum and Augustus' Palace. The Palatine hill overlooks the forum and offers some of the best views of the ruins. The best thing about it though is learning about the first emperor August's house and the museum that is that as well. Look for the ancient graffiti in the museum that may be the first depiction of Christ ever.

Too much to see. Be prepared for a lot of learning, walking and a lot of rock sights. It is way better to tour with a guide - If you are on your budget, try dowloading an app like Rick Steve's tour guide. This way, you will add context to the tour and everything will be a lot more interesting! Comfortable shoes are a must and, even in the summer, a jacket might come in handy!

The climb is worth it. The ruins of the palaces are still visibible despite the centuries and Musollini. You have to use your imagination a bit but to see the size of the place, the remains of the palaces etc is worthwhile visiting

Cool scented relief on a hot September day. That's why they built the palaces up here and surrounded them with gardens. The history of the place is fascinating and it's worth visiting for the views of the Forum and Colosseum alone.

Def must. Do not see the Colosseum without seeing this. Mind blowing Roman history lesson. We walked along on a tour and had a great guide, a history major from California living in Rome. Find him! Take the time to do this. Worth every penny and second
Stunning!. Do not miss seeing this. It was included in a tour we booked and we are so glad we got to see this. To stand here and take in the history that happened long before us gave us gooesbumps

Glorious. This was one of my "must do" places. Bought our tickets online, Palatine & Forum and entered through the side entrance closest to the Circus Maximus, virtually no other people going in here at 10 in the morning. Just stunning, wandering through the palaces where so much history has taken place, seeing travertine floors still in place and the early round huts dating back into pre-history. The houses of Livia and Augustus, just fascinating to this history buff. So glad I managed to get there. It is a bit of a hike, a few steps and dusty paths but worth it.

Palaces of the roman emporers. the scale of the construction for the times it was built in is truly awe inspiring. The Romans built on a gargantuan scale tat never fails to impress. worth taking a guided tour for the wealth of background detail and information they provide
Surrounded by history. Take the hike to the top, one of the best city views you will find. Look around the fountains. Lots of surprises. They have a promising archeological dig underway at present
Walking. Walking around these sublime hills really brings home the sheer volume of history Rome has. Of all the attractions I saw in Rome this visit, this place I liked the most.

Mesmerizing!. So much to see. Would never had known what to really focus on had it not been for our tour guide. The day was hot, so make sure to bring a water bottle. You can refill it at a couple of fountains inside the venue.

SIMPLY AMAZING HISTORY!!. Amazing place and history - we had a guide and it was worth every penny as you learn so much more about the history rather than just looking at ruins. Where Rome was first started so a must when you visit Rome!
Interesting and Well looked after. We visited here as my other half really wanted to. I was pleasantly surprised by it and had a lovely time walking around. Make sure you take your own water bottle!

Amazing views. We had an historical guided tour of Palatine Hill along with the colosseum and the Forum. We bought our tickets in the morning for €30pp while queueing for the colosseum and it was definitely worth it. Our guide was brilliant and gave us an in depth historical tour, information we wouldn't have had by ourselves. The views from the top are brilliant, and it is a short walk across the road from the Colosseum. It is uphill, but it doesn't take long to get to the top!

Amazing visit. We did a self guided walk about after touring the coliseum. it's all included in the same ticket price and honestly palatine hill was way more impressive for us. The amount of history and sheer expanse of the site made it well worth the visit. We had no expectations going in but were very impressed.
History . The most historical view of Roma , must visit with guide to get the stories and facts ... 1 of the 7 hills of Rome
Go all the way up. Awesome panoramic view going all the way up. Make sure you go there and take very nice photos. It worth the effort.
Stunning. Take your time but just do it. Wonderful. Steeped in history. Feel it! The seat of our parliamentary system. Stories abound here!

Palatine Hill - difficult to understand. Went to the hill prior to seeing the Roman Forum quite difficult to navigate even with the audio guide. Tip - get some maps before visiting as the directions inside are not great.

Don't miss this place. The incredible size of this place is unbelievable. Definitely worth visiting and getting at least an audio tour. Our guide pointed out to us some of the features and they were fascinating.
Great views. Palatine Hill is near Colosseum and easy walk up to excellent view of forum. There are gardens as well and makes you feel part of ancient Rome.

Combo ticket with Colosseum and Roman Forum. Best to do combo-ed with the Colosseum. We did a combo tour, booked on the spot, with the Colosseum for a total of 17 euros per person, as we had already purchased the entrance fee. This enable us to skip the lines. Our guide was good and gave a quick explanation that allowed plenty of time to walk around on our own. It really is nice to have someone summarize what you need to know.
Must see. Take a bottle of water and sturdy footwear, go early morning before the heat sets in.Amazing place to understand the history of Ancient Rome, linked to the Forum.
amazing. if you pay for a guide at the coloseum they take you around this as well and give you lots of info on the area

Beautiful ruins and view . Gorgeous views. So many ruins to look at it would take a full day. Really enjoyed it but we only stayed an hour as it was too hot. Water fountains everywhere so bring a bottle!

One of the most ancient parts of Rome!. I would highly suggest buying a collective ticket for entrance into Palatine Hill and the Roman Forum rather than buying on the day (go to the official ticketing website 'coopculture [dot] it' for your options). The line for entering these significant ancient grounds is long enough with a pre-bought ticket (with security scans being the main reason for delay into the site), so you can imagine how long it might take if you also need to line up to purchase a ticket as well!Many significant mythology stories are said to have happened on Palatine Hill, as well as the location of many historical moments in Rome's history. The ruins that you see as you walk through and explore the site will probably not mean much to the uninformed visitor as there are few detailed signs around the site, but if you are sincerely interested in what the remains of each ginormous building used to be, their purpose and significance, then there are audio and guidebooks that you are able to purchase to guide you through. While you only see what remains of a great and powerful ancient empire today, it is not hard to imagine how incredible Palatine Hill must've been at its peak and what a sight to behold it must have been. Palatine Hill together with the Roman Forum covers an enormous amount of ground, so make sure you bring water to keep fully hydrated, a hat and sunscreen to protect yourself from the sun and good walking shoes!

ancient history at its best. The palatine hill, and forum, much of the ruins are still standing Can take the best part of the day to see this , but well worth it , Buy a combined ticket to this and the forum and colosseum. to skip the queues. Or buy a ticket online this is a must.visit
Rich in history!. Awesome place to walk around for some hours and learn more about the history of the city. There are also some good views from up there.
Breathtaking. Fabulous views over the city from the hill and situated next to the Roman forum would highly recommend this tour
A must see location. Well worth the effort after busting the Colosseum, possibly even better. Wonderfully preserved artefacts and Some of which are almost 2000 years old.
Must see venue to understand ancient Rome. Took a tour with Crown tours that really brought the whole visit to life. Don't understand why more people don't visit here it's amazing
An amazing view of ancient rome from the hill. The view of the Roman forum is amazing up here. Most visitors do not explore all of what Palatine hill has to offer. Don't miss out on it.

Favourite place. Amazing to get closer to the ruins and be able to walk and imagine how this place used to be. Take a guidebook with details so you can understand what you're looking at. The audio guide would probably help!
Beautiful area, great view. Roman Forum and Palatine Hill - well worth a wander. Big area, loads of old buildings to explore and read about - good information provided. Loved it!

A beautiful walk! Totally awestruck!. Along with the Colosseum and the Roman Form, the Palatine Hill is a site not to be missed - the modern art installations mixed with the ancient ruins is definitely an added bonus!

Worth the queue. If this was in England this would be three times the cost highly recommended and make sure you give it a enough to time to go round it to give it justice. Don't forget to take some bottles of water with you as you will need them and also a spare camera battery and card

Palantine Hill. This was the third and last section of our tour after the Colosseum and the Forum. Good leg stretching walk up. An aqueduct brought their water in and there were ponds, fountains etc.. buildings were obviously on a very grand scale. There are two exits. One straight out and the other via the Circo Massimus one of the main chariot racing venues.

A nice walk around. It's nice to walk around this area, see the arena and stadium etc. But don't expect to much in the way of information on signs etc. You really need to know your stuff or get one of the guided tours.

Great. My wife and I did this on our own without any guides so we could do it on our own pace.Good walking shoes are a must as I saw quite a few people suffering with sore feet.I also saw a lot of exhausted people around who either did not have water or fail to bring a empty bottle through security because they have places around where you can fill up with beautiful cold water you need quite a few hours to see everything .Great interesting place to visit a must see if in Rome.
Visited on Segway. Worth seeing with a guide. We were with a guide so was well explained. Well preserved and worth seeing.

So much history in one gaze!. Make sure you have good walking shoes on (not that that stopped many around me). Wonderful views sending the imagination back to history classes as the imagination travels back to days long gone.

Great Views!. This was part of our skip the line tour comprising of The Colosseum, The Roman Forum and ending at The Palatine Hill.As stated on my previous reviews, the Skip The Line tickets are a must! It was so busy even first thing in the morning, that this ticket was well worth the extra cash. The tour guide was really informative and the 3 hour tour was just right for getting a snap shot of all the areas. Another must see site when in Rome.

historic. loved it! after the colosseo u go here.pls take a guide or it will jst be ruins for you. this was the centre of rome for years and part of the 7 hills that made up the city. at the end you reach one of the major roads that take you to one of the best piazzas in rome.

Coluseum, Forum. you could spend most of the day with just the Colosseum, Forum and this (Palantine hill) area. Lot's of history packed into a few hundred meters. Try to do this when the weather is nice. Make sure to check out the Imperial Palace. Ware good shoes as it's not all paved.

Stunning scenery, unhelpful staff. Palatine Hill and all the ruins makes for an interesting, educational and beautiful walk. You need good walking shoes and take a bottle of water (there are fountains dotted around to fill up). It's not too busy in September so you can really take your time. The guards and staff at the office understand a little bit of English but not very much or very well and unfortunately are not very helpful at all. My partner lost his wallet and apart from telling us it wasn't at the office they didn't try to help. As you can imagine it was a sensitive panicked time and the women at the desk were laughing, not what you want when worried. Overall amazing place, unhelpful staff.
Go early!. No line at 930am for entrance. 15 mins in line for ticket. Way less people before 10am so it was very nice. Huge area - so much to see!'
History!. The wife and I visited this place right after seeing the Colosseum. There is so much history on this hill! Be prepared to bring your walking shoes! Well worth it!
Great view of the Forum. It's a bit of a climb to get here, but the view of the Forum and the city is really beautiful. There are water taps at the top, also, so you won't get thirsty.
Excellent activity for half a day. Really liked the remains of buildings on the hill. You can't really get theirs enormous sizes from pictures. Prepare for a lot of walking and stairs climbing.
Glorious place. This is a perfect place to sit and read as well as explore. It was so relaxing walking around the ruins and reading up on the history of rome. I greatly recommend
Don't do this on your own. Most of this landmark is gone. Make sure you visit a guild or you won't know what your looking at. The history is interesting.
So much to see. do plan your route in advance. We only saw a fraction of it in the 2+ hours we were there. Great insight into the past.

Wear Comfy Shoes. This place was way bigger than I thought it would be and if I could give anyone one tip it would be to wear comfy shoes because you will want to see the whole place- and bring some water to stay hydrated! It is right next to the Colosseum and offers great views while exploring the fascinating history of Rome!
Visit with a guide!. You can certainly visit by yourself but without our Dark Rome (City Wonders) tour guide, we wouldn't have understood anything...
Interesting Piece of History. We toured with Through Eternity. I highly recommend them to get a more in depth understanding of the place and it's history.

Danger of exhaustion . Once you start walking, you fall into the charm of the hill, covered entirely by the palaces, private stadium, gardens, houses, fish farm and temples. Watch for the step-count, you could walk for miles only to take a glimpse at another perspective or another photo. Also, keep the empty bottle, since Rome has many fresh water fountains, where you can refill.Also, take time for the exhibition of unconventional art, it is great.

visited the day after the colosseum and enjoyed it better x. didn't know what to expect but this place was our favourite- went early and started at the top- views of Rome were amazing and loved how peaceful it was. so much history it blew our minds- loved it.
A must see. The colosseum ticket also gives you access to here. I enjoyed it more than the colosseum. Head in. From the colosseum exit and go to the top first then work your way down

Hill of Power in the Roman Empire. My family and I visited the Palatine Hill as part of a Special Quality Tour combination guide package after our group tour from the Colosseum. After our first tour guide Fleurella or Flo was complete with our group, she transitioned us to meet our second tour guide Millichap, who is also a member of the Special Quality Rome Tours outside of the Colosseum in order to go into the Palatine Hill which is right across the street from the Arch of Constantine. During the Roman Empire's reign, many of Rome's most powerful and wealthiest citizens lived and worked on the Palatine Hill in sumptuous and luxurious estate properties and temples. There were about 15 royal families who fought amongst one other over land, resources, power, money and family members. The Palatine Hill overlooks much of the Roman Forum and Roman Senate House to the north side. The south side consists of house ruins, and a large courtyard. The ancient ruins of the Palatine Hill also overlook important surrounding structures of power such as the: Colosseum, Circus Maximus, the Imperial Forum, and Trajan's Market. The terrain of the Palatine Hill is mostly dirt and rocks, making it challenging (not impossible) for people in wheelchairs and babies in strollers travel throughout the hill. We also visited the Palatine Hill Museum, which displays many of the recovered artifacts from both the era of the Roman Empire and even a civilization dating back to 8th Century B.C. The Palatine Hill is also a major archaeological site for historians and it even have some works of art and sculptures finished by several artists on the south side of the Palatine Hill. The entire Palatine Hill and Colosseum guide by Special Quality Rome Tours was an amazing educational experience that strongly helps to understand the proper historical context of the Roman Empire

Roman heritage and beautiful history . This actually alongwith roman forum and colosseum are sold common tickets. So if ur buying tickets at any of 1 attraction it is valid at all 3. Palatine Hill is worth going and you get such a beautiful view of the city and colosseum that's it should not be missed especially during evening.

A good climb with wonderful views of Rome such as the emperors enjoyedd. We took the walk up from the Forum on a very hot day. It was a bit arduous but worth it. The views of Rome are amazing and it is easy to see why the emperor wanted to live here. This is part of the Forum tour and does not require a separate ticket.

Stepping back in time. Walking through the Palantine Hill let you feel as if you are walking back in time. The ancient sites are really amazing and you start to appreciate how old things are in Rome. Definitely worth a visit.

all about rome. This hill captures centuries and centuries of history, you are able to see different civilizations build on top of each other, it is an impressive site and describes the history of Romans!

Easy to spend ALL day!. Went with a tour guide who was practicing after getting his master's in roman history and he was great! The price is really inexpensive for how much you get to see and it's really easy to spend all day looking around. It's much bigger inside than it looks from the street!
excellant free attraction. this was an excellent site with lots to see ...fair amount of walking but well worth it. make sure you go into the places as there are a lot to see too and its cooler

Nice holiday. This place is near by Colosseum. The space is huge. You can see amazing view from the top of the hill. If you came to visit Rome for a couple of days then you must go there. It's worth of your time. :)
Roman History. Next to Roman Forum. It ooozes of Roman History. Get your encyclopedia out if you wanna learn moreee.
Offers great views over Rome. Not only can you gaze of historical monuments and its remains, but the Palatine Hill offers great views!
FANTASTIC VIEWS!. We took a guided tour and we were brought to some major overlooks and all the ruins were explained to us. Definitely a site to see!

Visited as part of colosseum package. By the time we visited here (day 7) we had seen what for us were the highlights of Roman Rome- Ostia, Pantheon and Colosseum so might have appreciated it more had it been the first thing we saw- also what didn't help was it had a modern art installation in it which took away" the ancient feeling" (quote 10 year old son)

Breathtaking . Me and my partner visited yesterday and WOW what a place. I have never been so took back by anything more amazing and breathtaking. It honestly is worth every penny. This is one of my favourite places I saw on our trip to Rome. We bought our tickets combined with colosseum tickets from the ticket office out the front. Both were €12 pp. It took us almost half a day to see this 1 place there is so much to get around but luckily the tickets are valid for 2 consecutive days. Absolutely loved it highly recommended.

Trip Back in Time. Whoa, it is mind blowing how much of the ruins are intact. The signage makes it easy to picture what this area looked like in ancient Rome. We had a guide, and we got so much more out of the visit than we would have on our own. This is a great site to visit if you have kiddos who are into ancient civilizations.
Interesting tour. Didn't expect much from the tour and the place itself dint have too much left but the tour guide gave an interesting historical view.
Great. Would definitely recommend seeing Palatine Hill, even more than the Colosseum or Forum. A great way to experience Rome's history.

Worth visiting. . We did a double tour with the Colosseum. The tour went for 3 hours. The guide was excellent and had loads of background information.We booked through I love Rome. They were a little dearer than other companies and their bus system on pick up is far less often than say the Red City Bus tours. So I suggest you go with them.

Recommend a tour guide.... This area is so steeped in ancient Roman history that a guide is almost a "must"....we did not hire a guide or take a tour and we regretted the decision. A long walk on a hot day so give yourself lots of time...the museum at the top offers a cool break.

Third choice. After Colloseum and Roman Forum , Palatine Hill didn't leave me big impression. However, there is a nice view on the hill.I would definitely recommend to take a guide to Roman Forum, Colloseum and Palatine Hill - it will broaden your imagination.

Wonderful view over Foro Romano. If you enter the area on the Foro Palatino, we avoid the longer queue at Foro Romano. You get a great view over Foro Romano and you can descend directly there after looking from above. Have a look at a guide or a site plan to understand what is what.
Hill of historical significance. Provided in the combined ticket for the Colosseum and the Roman forum; it is a small walk up the hill where one get a great view of the city

Such a big place!! . We did the colosseum before the Palatine Hill. There's so much walking involved more in the Palatine Hill! Lovely place to walk around however not good for hot weather!The security checks are nice and quick. ** Great place to take shots of yourself with the colosseum in the background! **
Amazing place. A truly stunning place. A real thrill to see so much preserved and how the site was developed over the centuries.

Great views after a hot climb!. On very hot day in August, we ended our Colosseum 3 hr guided tour with a climb up to the top of Palatine Hill. Not a difficult climb on a normal day but at noon in the direct sun of August, it was a little tough. Our tour guide took his time and we learned some interesting historic tidbits on the way up. After reaching the top though, the view of the Forum below and even the Colosseum is really awesome. Worth the hike up the hill, just take your time, and enjoy the view after you get there.
Great views. Please visit Rome and go here. The views are beautiful and well worth the visit. Legend has it Romulus and Remus were found here .... we all love a legend. But seriously, do visit.

Foundations of Rome. Much like the forum, if you approach here without a good guide book and site plan it can seem to be a jumble of ruins, but prepare for your visit and it becomes a whole new experience. The garden side of the hill offers superb views over the forum and Colosseum, whilst the opposite side has a panoramic view of the remains of Circus Maximus. Be sure also not to miss the small museum.

Posh end. This is the Beverly hills of the ancient Roman world where all the rich folk lived in opulence in the beautiful villas and gardens. I love filling up my water bottle from th taps with safe drinking water from the mountains it's always so cold even on the hottest days in august .

Great view of ancient rome section . Went here as part of tour - not a bad climb and there is drinkable water. Nice view of the area and Colosseum. Some historical significance of this site. Worth the effort but not for a long visit
A must see. I actually went here with coty wonders on a tour, very detailed, so much history as all of Rome is, a must do ...

Fabulous. Having visited Rome on cruises and done the normal tours which only include the Colosseum and the Forum. The Palatine hill was a must as we had a few days in town.We weren't disappointed the architecture on the hill was amazing. It must have looked incredible at its peak. The Museum provided valuable insight into the development of the palaces on the hill from prehistoric times.Only down side was a modern art display that was dotted around it sort of ruined the experience. The classical environment polluted by the incomprehensible modern movement.
Amazing!. Its amazing that we can see these historical features and building almost 2000 years later! The history in each part can be felt!

Very Interesting. We hired an audio guide and decided to wander at our leisure around the site, but didn't realise just how big it was when you include Palatine Hill together with the Roman Forum! Make sure you're in comfortable footwear and bring plenty fluids with you if you plan to visit - we went with the short audio tour (est. 1.5 hours) on the audio device and we were still there 3 hours later! Very interesting though.

Ancient Roman site - don't miss if you are interested in Ancient Roman history. This is included in the ticket for the Coloseum (along with the Roman Gorum) don't miss if you are interested in Ancient Roman history. It's a long walk so wear comfortable shoes. Could be a long and hot day in the summer - bring water. There is interesting museum on top of the hill (free) so be sure to stop there.
Very interesting. Entry to this along with pre bought ticket for colloseum. Very interesting and very old. On route around other sight seeing venues

Must do . We did the Colosseum followed by the Roman Forum and Palatine Hill, it was an extraordinary day for us.
Just take your time and admire where you are!
It is a lovely place and I am sure you will enjoy yourself if you choose to go here.

Old. The whole place is falling apart. Could be due to air pollution or number of tourists. Glad I came. A few years from now it will look worse unless they rebuild it. But then it will not be authentic.
Palatine Hill was the famous of the seven hills of Rome in Imperial Rome.. Today only ruins remain but during the Imperial era, the hill was completely built up with large palaces.
Ing.. Pretty nice place to see in a Rome..when you use your roma pass, colloseum, Forum Romanum and Palatino are counted as a one entry
Beautiful.. This was included on a tour we was on and it is worth seeing and a great place to take photos with a lot of history here.

palatine hill. this place has great historical importance but nothing remains on the hill anymore. the only thing to see on the hill is a garden (not very well maintained) and a terrace from which you can see an amazing view of the city. this place is totally worth a visit.the ticket to palatine hill is the same as the one used for colosseum.in our case, palatine hill was the last part of a 3.5 hour tour ( in really hot weather and on foot ). so the view was not as enjoyable as it should have been.
A true sight to behold. I could not get enough of this area. The history contained in this area is amazing and you get a sense of what life was like in the days of the Roman Empire.

Seventh Hill Of Rome. Palatine Hill is the seventh hill of Rome right besides The Roman Forum once inside you walk through the area and look down at the Forum on one side and the Circus Maximus on the other. It is believed that the Imperial Palace of the Emperors was built in the hill overlooking the arena of the Circus Maximus and the Emperors could see the Chariot races perfectly. Also because of the amount of tress and how they were planted it has a constant breeze which makes it very pleasant dropping a few degrees even in the hot summer. You still could see and walk through parts of Imperial Palace.

sprawling remanence of roman buildings. there is an awful lot here to see and we made the mistake of visiting the coliseum and the forum and the palatine hill at the same time and on a very hot day - the answer is don't do it on a hot day each one is enough and there is little shade and no cafes - just take your own water bottle to fill - also like the rest of these roman remains the paths are very uneven - best to read a good guide book before you visit
Stunning!!!. I truly enjoyed seeing all the sculptures and ruins in this area! It was surreal standing on such historical land!
Interesting. So much information and so many sites in this location. It is really worth having a guided tour who can bring the story to life for you.
Incredible. How could Caesar's home not be amazing for history buffs? Be sure to hire a good tour guide and wear comfortable shoes. You will not be disappointed

Yet again, amazing. As the final part of the overall tour with the Colosseum and Forum, this was a stunning way to finish. The views from the top are incredible and you get a complete picture of the Forum from the top of the hill. Very hot in summer but worth the trip.
Free with the Colosseum ticket and free for kids!. Nice museum up there. Read up, get a guide or take a tour to understand whatt you are looking at.however, it is a magical place!

Wonderful and nice. If you are going to Roma, you can not missed to visit the forum.
The place is beautiful. You can also paid the entrance and visit it inside . But you can also see All without paid it.

Fantastic. The Palantine Hil is next to the Roman Forum, and forms a joint entrance ticket. It is fantastic to walk amongst the history of the ancient Roman ruins, as well as on the very same stone pathways as those ancients. A must for Rome! Tips: (1) Enter the Palantine from the southern end (close to the Hippodrome) - it is a nice ramp-walk along those ancient roads, instead of steep steps from the Forum (2) Don't miss the amazing view from one of the terraces of the Palantine that overlooks the Forum and Colisseum (see photo)!

Amazing apart from the modern art. This is an amazing collection of buildings, unfortunately right now it is littered with a modern art exhibition which was awful, pretentious and a waste of time. Leave the monuments to speak for themselves please.
Walk through Roman History. Having read some books on Cicero recently, this was a real treat. Need to expect to do some walking. It was not that busy, but very exposed, so needed water and a sun hat.

Go Back In time. This was part of my package tour. We really enjoyed walking in this park, it a spectacular and breath taking view everywhere you walk including the view of Coliseum from a far distance. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and explained the history on every section of the park and that made it so much fun. 1-2 hours here will be plenty. We loved it!!!
Simply Spectacular. For some of the most spectacular views of Rome it is hard to think of a better place. Take advantage of the various attraction offers or travel passes and entrance could be free.

Very Hot Very Beautiful. If you're a photo junkie like me, this is an ideal place to go on a photo safari with friends or family. Great lighting, angles, contrast between old and new. Being surrounded by history really made up for how hot it was. Bring a parasol, sunscreen, and sunglasses.

Must see with the Roman Forum. This place should be combined with the visit of the Roman Forum as those places are connected anyway. From the hill their is a wonderful view over the Forum and parts of Rome. And don't miss out on the view of Stadio palatino and Circus Maximus. Give this place alone (Palatine Hill) at least an hour to enjoy the beauty of it.

Haunting beauty. There is a timeless air to the Palatine, which you can only experience properly as a lone traveller, or as half of a couple. It is a place to wander and reflect or take a guide-book or map and reference the different remains within it. The Palatine has a haunting quality - it is a place indifferent to the centuries and it makes your own life - your little pocket of time in this world - seem small indeed. You experience it and walk within it as you might within an ordinary park, but in this this uniquely historic park you will find the villa of Livia - the great Augustus's Empress who Robert Graves made so notorious in his novels I Claudius and Claudius the God. You have the vast sunken remains of Domitian's Stadium - an extraordinary sight in the fading late afternoon light; and the remains of Nero's Golden House. The Palatine is a place of beauty and mystery, not thrills and excitement; better suited to the contemplative traveller than the rubberneck or sensation-seeking tourist. I'm putting here the latest date I can, but the unchanging quality of the Palatine makes any review relevant - even an old one. And I have been there many times - both alone and as part of a couple.

Huge and interesting. The Palantine Hill complex was a bit like the Tardis - way bigger on the inside! We ended up doing the thing that all the guide books say not to do, heading into it in the midday heat. For all that, while it was roasting, we survived with plenty of water.The highlights are probably the views of Rome from the various high points and just imagining how Ancient Rome would have looked from the remains.I would recommend taking in water (as it is roasting) but there is a vending machine selling cold drinks if you need liquid while you are in there. Wear decent shoes, the ground can be uneven and there is a bit of a hill to climb if you want to see all of it. We also didn't have more of a guide than the guidebook I had in my bag but that was fine for us.
Glorious Past visited. A walk in the times of roman empire is what you will get when to visit this place. Pleas do take a guide or hire a audio guide ,it is too many details in too small a place.
Stunning - allow yourself time to make the most of it!. Went late in the day on a booked tour, wish I had left myself more time to just wander. If I ever went again, I would do just that!

One of Rome's seven hills. This is part of the same 'complex' as the Roman Forum.The views from the top of the hill are worth seeing. Not a lot to do here other than walk up the hill and look at the ruins.
Walk into History. Felt like you were walking in the ruins of buildings from the great Roman era. Wear comfortable walking shoes as the ground is uneven.

Bring Water and Enjoy!. One thing I learned early on in our trek was to bring water, or at least a water bottle, everywhere. There are public water fountains to fill up bottles and there are a few vending machines in Palatine Hill/Roman Forum. Walking around here will drain you if you're here in the summer, so stock up. After that, have fun and take your time! There's a ton to see here and it might be to your advantage to have a tour guide or at least some form of audio guide because there's a lot here. It was spacious enough to not be super crowded, so that was a plus. The admission is included in the Colosseum and Forum ticket, if you use the Rome Pass, all three are included as a "free admission".

A must see that is included in your colosseum and forum ticket price. Amazing views.
Didn't have a book or a guide, just ambled through this vast area enjoying the scenery.
Could easliy take a day to do all three, but I had 3 hours.
Still do-able.
Don't wear silly shoes, some did and paid the price.
It's not a fashion show.......
lots to see. do this the same time as the forum and colessum if possible . one ticket admits you to all. get a skip the line pass.

Make time to visit this. Right next to the Colosseum and Roman forum, I would recommend to go up the palentine hill (it isn't a difficult climb and is just an easy walk), well maintained and gives you picture perfect frames to capture the Roman forum beautifully. If you have time you can walk around here finding more and more about the Roman history. I had taken a guide tour which just concluded at this place, giving me ample time to roam around by myself. Be ready to walk a lot though if you want to explore here.
Ancient history.. Use your imagination when walking up Palatine Hill. As with the Colosseum this place has seen some horrific sights

Fantastic lasagna views. Yes, I know that sounds a funny heading however these ruins are building upon each other, layer on layer. Really suggest you use a guide as many interesting facts are then uncovered. If you are a history person, this is a great visit however be aware there are hills to climb and cobble stone stairs to come down so dress appropriately.Number of water fountains throughout the ruins, it will take you about 1-2 hours for the full tour.Security was stronger here than the Colosseum , full X-ray machine but allowed full bottles of water and backpacks? May have been due to the guided tour Company?

A lot of walking. Must wear sneakers! You're walking in dirt. Its beautiful and you get to see a great view of the city. I don't think we walked everywhere here and we were there for over 2 hours. Its huge!
Family Sight seeing visit. This was part of a multi tour we purchased including the Colosseum, The Forum and Palatine Hill. A magnificent monument to the greatness of Rome.
Booked through City Wonders with combined Colosseum tour. Booked this tour as part of the Colosseum tour. Advise going early as it gets very hot and busy. We booked the 3 hour tour

Ruins with an incredible view. Rich in historical finds and history this is the place of living. I say that because you literally had historical figures bathe and lay their heads in that very spot. The grounds are maintained and the structures are as well as you could expect for the age.A special note I would throw out there is visit Palatine Hill first. Why?!?!Because your ticket will get you entry into the Colosseum. This means you skip the ticket que all together at the Colosseum and pay one low price instead of two. Huge time savor especially when your standing in long lines directly out in the sun.
Very interesting, Lots to see. If you want to see fully you need a whole day or more and you would be better off having a proper guide.

A Must See. We had a very good guide to take us round this sprawling area. There is so much to see and the guide explained and described so much, so do get the conducted tour. It's well worth it, but have your walking shoes on.
Great views of Forum and Colosseum. Worth a walk up the hill to get great view over Forum ruins and also a great overview of Colosseum from distance.

Amazing. Another amazing place is the Palatine Hill with a museum on top of it. I thought Forum was big, but with Palatine Hill everything becomes bigger! Beautiful view from above as well as shades to enjoy.

Outstanding views to imagine ancient Rome. One of the many places in Rome where you can easily feel the eternal Rome. Outstanding views all over. A must to every visitor. No services around area, so take enough to drink with you when visiting. Takes easily several hours.

Not as known as Roman Forum. I hadnt even heard of this until i bought tickets. Worth while, very interesting. Its part of your colloseum ticket anyway. You need probably 4 hours to look at this with the Roman Forum and colloseum. For only 12 euro its great value tourism. Some water vending machines would be good as there is a long way to walk back to beginning.

Historic but only of limited impact. Area with obvious history. But most buildings are not accessable. We did not use a guide. Maybe the experiance might be better with a guide due to the large area to be covered.

Holiday. Wonderful , inspiring place you can feel the history seeping through every inch of the whole area. A short queue to get in but loads of space and no rush to see everything . Allow a full day for this and colleseum properly

Favourite place in Rome . One of my favourite places in Rome , you don't have to be a history buff to enjoy it , does have an audio guide but has lots of boards with the info on them which I personally prefer , ticket costs 12 euros which lasts 2 days and gets you into the colosseum as well which is why I always go here before the colosseum, deserves more time than most give it , very open stock up with water

Colosuuem Package. Part of package tour but worth seeing as being one of the 7 hills of Rome. Nice to be able to walk around and see the buildings on a good sunny day as it also gives a bit of tranquility from the hustle of the city itself.
Love!! . Old Rome with views, trees and wonderful sights definitely recommend to visit very hot though security annoying but necessary
History live!. It's one of the monuments you can't miss when you travel to Rome. You need at least one morning to visit it but it's worthwhile. History in front of you!

One of my favorite places. May be it is not for everyone. Some people say it just ruins and you do not understand what is there. People, please take a guided tour it is mandatory to enjoy and understand the importance of this place in the World History. You will definitely benefit a lot, especially family with teens. It is not easy to walk in a hot weather, take some cold water and umbrellas, light closing. Lots of green areas to sit and observe and read or listened audio guide. This is a history of our modern architecture, history of construction materials each Emperor tried to improve, water supply, housing layout, sports activities, everything we use up to now.

Overwhelming historical site. To witness this site in person is a must when coming to Rome. Being the 25th Jubilee year most of the big attractions had been cleaned and were sparkling clean, but when finding this site, it was a bolt of lighting taking you right back to those days of Roman rule. The excavation site is fantastic and although ruins one can just imagine the Roman life in those days. An amazing find and historically rich site. We loved this probably the best out of all of the other sites.
Amazing!. Lots to look at! However, there is lots of shade and places to sit and enjoy a picnic if you have a young family.

Back in time!. I would recommend taking a tour with a guide for this, as it helps you think what it was like back in time! The various ruins are from so long ago but it gives you a great insight to what it must've been like! The amount of work to get to this stage is amazing as the whole area was buried.

Great tour. Definitely recommend a visit to here. The view of Rome was incredible and the history was intriguing. Its worth paying a little extra for a guide as you go to all the most important places and get all the information you need.Dont forget good walking shoes...you WILL need them

Cross section of civilization. A tour guide once pointed out to us that from the Palatine hill you can see buildings from almost every century of the city's existence. It's a transcendent experience. On a more practical note, it's a shame that they've closed the entry to the forum from the Palatino, because it made for a good access point.

Great Place to visit. As other reviewers have mentioned, you can obtain a ticket which provides access to the Roman Forum, The Colosseum and the Palatine Hill. A key tip is to purchase the tickets at the Palatine Hill entrance. We queued for only a few minutes rather than a wait time of 45 mins at the Forum.The Palatine Hill itself is well worth a visit and covers a surprisingly large area once you have walked up the gently sloping path. You get great views over the Forum itself plus other Roman Landmarks.The only downside I would currently flag is a series of modern sculptures which, quite candidly, add nothing and detract from the surroundings. I'm sure that others may have differing views given Art is always in the eye of the beholder but some are jarringly out of place (the best example being the word LOSER in eight foot high letters sitting in the middle of an otherwise impressive square thereby ruining what would otherwise be a decent photo!!)
Historical. The Palatine Hil is really beautiful. I would advise travellers take a tour, in order to really apprieciate the story behind this wonderful place.

Historic area with great views. This is a very pleasant area looking over the Roman Forum (joint ticket). This is where legend has it that Romulus founded the cityin 753 BC and where the Emperors lived in luxury. This area is greener and has more shade than the Forum although I have to say I prefered the Forum.

Educational. Great tour we got it as part of the colluseum tour the tour guide is really knowledgeable and can answer any questions you have, i found out quite a few things history has miswritten the opportunitys for amazing pictures on this tour are plenty u get to walk on the first Road ever built amongst many other things if your going to Rome take in this tour and walk where the King's walked...

Really beautiful ancient scene. Palatine Hill is nice and peaceful place, it's worth a visit if you want to leave the bustle and hustle of Rome in a short time. The tour will take about one hours. The place is suitable for history lover and photographer. I think, everyone will agree with me that Palatine Hill is great view about ancient town scene even you wander at here in a sunshine or raining day.
Great history. Wonderful site and history. I would strongly encourage to visit the site and is not far from other main attractions.

interesting. This again was very interesting to see and to explore, unlike my partner i am not very good with history whereas he is very into it and me being here i learnt a lot about things that i didn't know before that were very interesting.
Amazing. This place just seems to go on and on, it is spectacular and I would recommend a good pair of walking shoes!

The best place to visit in Rome!. Nothing can prepare you for the breathtaking views from the Palatine Hill. You can see the ancient ruins along with modern Rome and all things between from the top. The Palatine Hill was by far my favorite place to see in Rome. Be sure to wear comfortable shoes and plan on getting them dirty as there are many areas that are literally dirt trails. Words cannot express the beauty and history that you will experience here

Excellent history. Amazing piece of history well worth visiting. Be sure to take suncream on a hot day nd it would also be more interesting to get a guided tour or audio guide. There is a huge amount to see!

dont forget your camera and comfortable shoes are a must. Lots to look at and see, the fountains with fresh drinking water were a God send. It was 91 degrees the day we did this and about 98% humidity. HOT HOT HOT. We were there over 3 hours and took it all in - exquisite archeologic remains and picturesque colosseums - worth the heat.

Beautiful view of Rome. Make sure to get one of the colosseum passes which comes with Palatine Hill and the Forum included as this is a don't miss. The views from the top of Palatine Hill are spectacular and the surrounding gardens beautiful.
Worth the Visit. I love the architecture of Rome, so I love Palatine Hill. It is a wonderful area to just wander, enjoying the sights and basking in history.
Get ready to walk. We took a tour that ended up the hill. Get ready to walk. Beautiful view, ridiculous water bottle restrictions, but gorgeous!

Mr Reaper . Palatine Hill is a large area of ruins, gardens adjacent to the Roman Forum & a mere 10 minutes away from the Colosseum. There are quite a few steep walking paths to walk up aswell as some steep steps in certain parts of the site to overcome but no problem for the average person wearing suitable footwear. There is lots to see & its spread over a large area so please allow at least 2- 2.5 hrs to see the whole sight. There are some stunning views over the Roman Forum below along with some great ruins to look at of past Roman life & how & where they used to live. There are some lovely examples of the ancient ornate Roman gardens & a fine onside museum with different video shows explaining the history of the site & also displaying some fine artifacts found on the site from past archaeological digs, definitely worth a visit
Excellent views of the city. Wow the history is just amazing. the views are fantastic. Good idea to have a guide or head phones you can hire otherwise you won't have a clue.

Go Here First. It was recommended that we visit Palatine Hill first so that we include tickets for Roman Forum and the Colosseum in the 1 ticket price. There is modern art items splattered around the ruins which seems to disappoint. Still enjoyed the visit and learning more.
Great Place. This was a very large place and there was plently to see. There was a lot of history and it is well worth the money. Make sure you take pleanty to drink with ou.

Great view of the entire colosseum area. Must visit place in Rome. If traveling in summer beat the crowds and heat by getting there early. The fresh water from the water fountains is refreshing. Plan to spend at lest 2 hours

Heart of the Roman Empire. Often seen as of lesser importance than the Forum, Palantine Hill showcases the very centre of the Roman Empire. Though it is mostly now the barest of ruins, if you go there having brushed up on your knowledge, you can stand right where the Emperor sat on his throne in the Imperial Palace and discover the tiny home of the first Emperor Augustus. The hill also has stunning views looking over the Roman Forum too.

Amazing . The palatine hill is heart of Rome. Just behind piazza Venezia, on top of hill. Very nice square with the statue of ceazer Orioles on horse (this is a fake one, the real on is in the museum under the ground) on left side of the square you can find the statue off the woolf with Ramos and Romulus - Rome ikon

GREAT WALK AND WONDERFUL HISTORY. Took a guided tour of Palatine Hill which also included Colosseum and Forum, it really is worth getting a guided tour otherwise you are just walking around not knowing all the history of the different places you visit. We had a wonderful afternoon learning about the history of the area.
Amazing Place. It took a few hours to get round this place. Well worth it. The history is incredible. It's next to the Roman Forum.

Must do the private tour of the Agusto palace!. This pace is obviously an amazing place for history buffs but if you pay the extra money you can get a private tour of the emperor Augusto palace that is a treat for anyone.

Steeped in history.. Research before visiting and you will really enjoy this. From the highest point you can imagine this as it was in it`s heyday. Ideal for a full day activity visiting the Colosseum and Roman Forum.

Climbing up Palantine Hill. Of the four of us, only one was able to make it all the way to the top of Palantine Hill. Fantastic views up there of the Forum and Colosseum. Lots of stairs but worth the climb.

Back in time... Walking here is like walking in old times.. it gives you a feeling on going back in time. Imagining how the Romans lived before. It is an amazing experience, especially for people who love to walk around. Try it!
Really Interesting!. Go early before it gets to hot, a lot of walking. Not for someone in Wheel chair or crutches, or difficulty walking!
Least favourite. Excited to see the circus maximus but very disappointing. Massive area but circus not as expected 😥 other areas were worth seeing. Be outside to walk loads in the heat

Beautiful view.. We wet to the big terras and enjoyed the most beautiful view over forum Romana and the Colloseum. It was crowded and hot but worth the walk. Buy tickets in advance to avoid a long line at the ticket office.
Amazing place. I was amazed at how well conserved some of these places were. Architecture is fascinating for structures that have been standing for such a long time
Wonderful Visit. This is a beautiful part of Rome with many remnants of ancient structures. It is a must for any visit to Rome. It's easy enough just to walk around and take in the sights.

Stunning. We had a guide who took us from the Colloseum to the Hill, and then used the ROMA pass to gain entrance to the site.It is a hike up the hill and not for the infirm, well certainly not at the pace our guide set off. He was very knowledgeable and gave lots of interesting facts about the attractions on the hill. Engaging in a question and answer as we went along.We were at such a pace we all decided we would have to come back another day and view it again at a more sedate pace, but would not have missed it for the world.

Take your time. If you wish this could be a quick walk to look at ruins-this can be walked in 30 mins. If you want to try and understand and see everything it would take over an hour, I would advise an audio guide as there are a lot of different things to see. Free drinking water provided in taps if you have a bottle.

Value ...Two day ticket ! . Tip ...If the queues for the Colosseum are too long and you want to do both go here first as we did ....bought the tickets after only queuing for 10 mins and learned that it is a two day ticket for both attractions which no one told us previously...It gets extremely hot on the hill there are many water stops just make sure you carry a water bottle to refill before entering...as to be expected paths and steps are uneven so take care if you have difficulty walking or need assistance...but the sheer size of the place is mind blowing and a very informative museum there too !
Best views from here. This place has the best views of the Fora Romano from top... It lies in the same archeological complex... The steps are not steep and one can climb easily... Don't miss this...

Since you are already at the Colosseum, then check this walk out as well.. A lot of history to go along with the Colosseum and short walk as well. But rumor has is this is one of the places where pick pockets hang out. But no problems when we were there.

Palatine . Very beautiful place to go noce place to walk as well some places with fresh water I recommend to take a bottle of water feom the people at the entrance they sell frozen water so you got some ice when you refill the bottle
What a history!. We took a tour for the Palantie Hill and it was worth it.Our tour guide was exceptional, she explain everything in detail. What a great place, what a history!

Interesting. We walked up from the Forum unguided. Great little museum at the top. First floor has videos with English and/or English subtitles describing the history of the hill. Very informative about the early developments that became Rome.

Going back in time. Amazing to walk around the places where all those people you've heard about in history lessons actually lived. The scale is much bigger than I expected. Very impressive. Good views across Rome as well !

Real Roman History!. The Palatine Hill has such a rich history of Rome in the ruins and also in the small museum. Of special interest inside the museum is the display of the different kinds of stone/marble found on the Hill and the map of the countries where each of the stones originated. Really demonstrates the reach of the Roman Empire. Best to go in the AM before it gets too hot.

Good views. This place gives you good views down over Rome and the forum, lots of ruins to see and to imagine what it would have been like when Rome was in its hay day. A fairly long walk in the heat of summer

Incredible views of the city and ruins. We only had half of a day before leaving and decided to see the Colosseum. Upon leaving we decided to go to Palatine Hill and I am so glad we did. Some of the views from this area are absolutely breathtaking. Seeing the ruins and the Colosseum from a distance was just wonderful. I wasn't too impressed by the gardens but they were pretty (not super well kept), however, don't miss this beautiful area, if possible. We managed to get them both in before a crazy taxi ride back to our hotel to catch another ride to the train station! There was a concert that day and everyone was coming to the Colosseum as we were trying to leave the area. Trying to get a taxi was very difficult - we should have planned better upon leaving the area. Rich in history!

So much history!. It's impossible not to be overwhelmed by the sheer volume of history in Rome. The Forum and Palatine Hill are a great place to wander around and can be combined with the Colosseum on a two-day Coop Italy ticket (though we did both in one day).

Probably the best attraction in Rome (if history is your thing). By far the largest attraction in Rome covering a huge area geographically but also chronologically. You will learn about the earliest settlement of mud huts on the hill all the way through the various emperors and they are still digging for more!Shade is hard to come by so take a cheap umbrella. Don't forget the ticket includes access to the large semi-famous stadium over the road.

Interesting. it is really a nice place to see the remains of the ancient city and how different the layout was. Overall I would recommend, just don't plan a lot of time here, it is more of a walk through visit.

Wonderful views and welcoming breeze!. After visiting the colosseum and having a colosseum/Palatine/Forum joint ticket, we walked up and over the Palatine Hill to get to the Forum. As it was a blisteringly hot August day, the breeze you feel up on the hill was a welcome relief! You'll need to use your imagination up here to visualise what anything is, I also used my Rome Rough Guide to explain what I was actually looking at. The small museum on the Palatine holds artefacts from the site and is worth a visit if you're up there (welcome air-conditioning too!). Make sure you find a suitable spot with great views over Rome and down onto the Forum to take some great photos. You won't need more than an hour on the Palatine but it is a great place to take in some picnic food and eat your lunch under the shade of a tree, taking relief from Rome's hustle and bustle for an hour.
An interesting site. Spent spent time visiting this ancient ruins. The palace was awe inspiring even on a hot day in Rome. A must on your to see list while visiting Rome.

For History Lovers. I went there with no expectations. I'm a fan of history, but I didn't expect much from the palentine hills. Therefore, I was positively pleased when seeing the magnificent vew that is the hill. It contains mostly ruins, but the old Senate Building is still intact. However, it is a good hike, I do not recomment it for parents with strollers or wheelchairs. Also, as I said, it is mostly ruins, so if you are not interested in history or architecture, you might be losing your time

Well worth it.. The Palentine Hill is the centermost of the Seven Hills of Rome and is one of the most ancient parts of the city. It towers above the Roman Forum giving you an excellent view and is an absolute must visit when touring the Colosseum and Roman Forum.

Take a guided tour, then stay to look around. You'll need to let your imagination do most of the work when "viewing" the building from which all other palaces gained their names. There is not much left, but from what there is, you can imagine - with the help of a good guide - how majestic the original palace was.

Greener and more peaceful.... ...than the Forum. Brilliant views down into the forum (and across Rome). Don't forget to take a peek over the opposite side of the hill, down into the Circus Maximus (gives a better view of it, than actually visiting it!)

Just Spectacular. In Rome you must visit Palatine Hill. The views from there are just spectacular. There is so much history to be seen from there. Rome is a very beautiful city to explore. Palatine Hill is part of the history behind Rome.

Living History. Beautiful and tranquil even after centuries have past these walls.
The experience truly allows how the Roman's lived and ruled the kingdom.
A must see for all visitors to Rome.

Not to be missed. Incredible testament to the engineering and intelligence of the Romans of 200O years ago! Best to do with a guide because there is so much history to wrap your head around, it is impossible to do alone.

Great view. Worth a visit. Great view of old Rome and you can also see the St Peter Church. If you are not specially interessted in historical and cultural details you don't need more than an hour to see the most important sights. Buy colosseum and forum tickets together at the entrance to forum Romanum(the line is usually much longer at the Colosseum.

Amazing. There are those places that you visit and after you visit them you become inspired for life... This is one of those places.How great is the mind of a man, how great is his wish to update, build and re-build trough centuries, how timeless and precious Rome itself is- you will find out right here on this amazing place.This is not one hour touristic attraction. Take your time. Give it a day. And enjoy winds over Palatine Hill and its history!

Great history!. The Palatine Hill was absolutely amazing I still can't get over how old it is! I explored the whole area with my partner for a few hours as there's so much to see and read from all the signs which explain a bit of the history. So it is okay if you don't go with a tour guide. And the views are breathtaking!
One of seven of Rome's hills. Had a nice and informative time moving from hill to hill and encountering the remnants of old Rome. Must visit place.
Beautiful. I enjoyed an evening stroll round the Palatine Hill. The picturesque surroundings with the ancient ruins of the Roman Forum make for a beautiful and enjoyable walk.

Be prepared to walk!. You must tour this, the site of original Rome settlement and its palaces, vineyards, and grounds. It's very hilly with lots of steps, but well worth it, and the views are amazing. We did this site without a tour and it was perfect that way. The signage is a bit limited, but you can figure out most spots with the description provided. Our tickets were only 12 Euro each, which is pretty reasonable. There's also a small museum on site as well. The lines were not long at all, and we were there midday in August! Plan a couple of hours here.
Amazing. It takes a while to get your head around it - this is real! This is the capital of the Roman empire that ruled the world 2000 years ago. A real well preserved and fascinating visit.

Interesting Roman History. It's too hot and warm when we took the tour...But one shouldn't miss this part of Rome...one could avail of the many tours provided. Just be sure to bring your sunglasses, hats and water bottles...

Amazing. We went without a guide, and the signage was excellent, so we really understood what was there. The buildings are huge, and we were surprised to learn that the Romans used so much brick. It's really a huge place and makes you understand when they talk about the seven hills of Rome. Lots of uphill climbs. The views were incredible of the Circus Maximus and the Fora.

Excellent!!!. Christian was the tour guide and was absolutely fantastic. He was very knowledgeable and entertaining. Would highly recommend doing this tour as the information given was brilliant, worth the extra bit of money.
Part of the Colosseum tour. we visited it as part of the Colosseum tour. It is a nice part of the tour but I wouldn't do it a lone.
Great views. Bring your cameras!!! Great views of Rome and many of the nearby sights to capture...also the only place with a decent breeze!
Don't miss it.. Lots of climbing, but worth every step. Fascinating to feel you are standing where Augustus and Livia once stood! You are walking on the same marble floor tiles they walked on.

apart of a tour with the Colosseum. Our walking tour of Italy included this area. Really helps to be part of a small group of 12 or 15 and have headset with an educated expert giving us insight and history. Photos are unbelievable that we took from various vantage points

A nice hill with amazing vew!. The ticket is the same for Palatine hill, Coloseum and Roman forum and it is about 16euros. The Palatine Hill is next to Coloseum and it is a big hill like a park with plants and ruins from different kind of buildings, like a palace and churches. The most amazing thing is the view. You can have the most amazing view from Rome, Coloseum and Roman forum. I recommend it

beautiful site with splendifous views of the city. Of course you should go here. Firstly, it's included in your ticket to the Colosseum and is directly across from it. Secondly, the breadth of archeological wonders there make it a must. Take your time to explore the whole site. Audio is optional...most everything is well-signed to give you a full picture of the what you see.
Historic Rome. Loved this place, this is what we came to Rome for. Loads of ancient ruins. So full of history. Really worth the effort of walking around it all.
Roman Days. great site to see and took lots of pictures, to show our friends back in Boston. These statues our huge and beauitful !

Maximus tours. The view was outstanding. We went here at the end of our tour which took us to the coluseum and many other places. The stories behind this hill are amazing. Standing where the Roman empire was controlled is just hard to grasp.

A Roman Trek. When entering the area for the Roman Forum, head up the steep hill to your left to Palantine Hill. Be sure to watch where you walk because not only is it steep but uneven. Once there you will see the palace along with what is described as an outdoor garden area. You have some great views overlooking parts of the city. There are some shaded areas but mostly it is hot and sunny. Definitely worth going to see.

Home to the Emperors. A must see when combined with the Forum. This is where the Emperors of one of the greatest empires of all time lived. The Domus Augustus was the principal residence for many of the emperors which was added to by Severus in 3rd century. The main palace area was built by Domitian but some of the structures purport to date back to Romulus. Take your time touring the area and make sure you get some great views from this regal hilltop. Be sure to read up on the history of both places in order to fully grasp the importance of the 2 sites.

Great audio guide. We visited on a hot August morning but an early arrival made this work. The audio guide was the best we found in Rome ... On a mobile phone with a speaker so one guide was fine for the three of us. The best place to buy joint tickets for the Forum and Colosseum. An interesting morning.

Walking Hand in Hand. Absolutely loved being able to walk hand in hand with my new fiance from the night before. Maybe that made everything even more romantic, but being able to see where history has been and looking at the sites, the bronze doors from early AD and the columns that are larger than life... Really incredible!
The long hot Roman march. Too much for tweens.....great history.....too long in the hot sun...no place too sit....little shade.....one small toilet....no water or service...coke machines broken

Like stepping back in time.. There is so much history surrounding Palatine Hill -- it was such a dream to be able to explore this area, probably one of the greatest experiences of my life. If you're interested in Ancient Roman history, this is an absolute must-see.

Part of the coliseum experience. We visited on a very hot August day! Take advantage of the water fountains dotted around the area to top up your water bottle!The views from the top are spectacular we didn't have guide but probably should have to bring the area to life.Do this at the same time as the coliseum ( ticket includes both)

Roman Ruins. My visit to the Roman Forum and Palatine hill was more enjoyable than the colosseum. There are lots to see I would allow a day just for these two sites. I would take a picnic but can get tiring if you have young children or impatient teens. There are lots of shaded areas. The water fountains give refreshingly cold water even on a hot blistering day. Hence, there is no need to buy bottled water.The visit gives allows one to see the better side of the Romans (CF Colosseum) and their engineering skills.A must see to get a glimpse of the bygone era of the Romans.
great view. Amazing views of rome, worth all the walking. Pretty area to see. Would also suggest comfy shoes for this one.
Interesting. Very interesting wandering round imagining Augustus and Claudius walking the same routes. Very very hot in July. Wear sensible shoes.

Centermost of the Seven Hill. This is one of the most ancient part of the city. It is only ruin but we still can see the glorious day of the Roman Empire by looking at the ruin. Step on the ground and play with your imaginary. Stands 40 meters from the Roman Forum and circus maximus on the other side will give you the intro before stepping to Roman Forum. This is one of the combine visit with the colosseum so just enjoy it.
Site to see. We stumbled on the Palatine Hill by accident and we're not disappointed by the amount of ancient architecture in the site

Amazing. Stunning. We went via tour to appreciate everything properly or its all just ruins without meaning. It's extremely hot so I wore flip flops...heaven, used my umbrella for shade...it was 100 degrees, and took plenty of water. Amazing up at the top by the palace.

Great Visit. This is a lot of steep walking so be prepared. The views from the top of the hill are amazing. Make a point to go at around sun set. There is a paid entrance, although to a large extent you can get the great views outside. I would give the admission fee a miss
Views was stunning. very historical and beautiful place. if you visit Rome you must to see it specially on top of the buildings!!!

So much to see. . Awesome view on Palestine Hill. You can see so much of the area and the Roman Forum. There are gardens to walk through, Roman ruins, and even wildlife in the area. We saw a huge rabbit! A must visit!

Soul of Rome ...Must Visit. Would recommend a full day for same ...It's huge and can take few hours to cover this completely ...It's a must visit for anyone visiting Rome ...Colosseum is nearby as well ...Would recommend reaching early morning as well

Walking shoes and water needed. I think The Palatine Hill was originally where the well to do of Rome lived and there are extensive remains left. Very impressive with some great views over modern Rome. Some modern art installations are scattered throughout the ruins. I like this juxtaposition of old and new and it makes an impressive setting for the artworks. However it is not everyone's cup of tea. Vast area with lots of walking so make sure to wear comfortable shoes. Very hot on the day we visited and plenty of water is essential. The colosseum, Palatine Hill and Forum are all next to each other and make for an amazing, historical, day's sightseeing. Not to be missed.
Stunning views!. Stunning views over the forum and rome. Lots of water fountains, places to sit and watch the world go by.
Awesome. Palatine Hill is very beautiful and historical. Must see place if you visit Rome. I enjoyed my visit to Rome.

History Hill. When standing on the Palatine hill you are standing where Roman Emperors stood,looking over Rome and all its significant sites. Make sure you go with a guide as they are a wealth of knowledge and will enhance your experience. I found this to be as interesting as the Colosseum. Watch out for pick pockets who lurk around the Colosseum and base of the Palatine Hill

Lovely day wandering around. We spent most of a day wandering around the Forum and Palatine Hill. They have done a good job preserving and documenting. All placards in Italian and English. Plenty of places for water, shade and rest. Educational and enjoyable. My favorite day.
Family Trip. This is almost moor stunning than the colossium. Walking is not easy if you are not fully able. Also I would say you need half a day to do it justice

I think this was the highlight of my Rome experience.. We spent five hours here as there is so much to see, experience and enjoy. The other sites of Rome are very good experiences but Palatine Hill to me ( and family) was simply outstanding, vast and full of ancient history it can not be missed.

Worth the climb . Buy this trip with collisium entrance 30€ for both 25€ if you under 25 with I. D most enjoyable walk plenty of steps but will be worth it when you reach the top the view is amazing of rome. There a drinks machine on first level of climb /walk our guide i think his name was craig from scotland was very informative on the history of the place made sure of plenty of rest stops for those who were struggling
Nice view. Nice to visit this old city where you can see the view of Roman Forum and Circus Maximus. While you are in this area there is a free drinking water everywhere in the city.

Palatine Hill. From what ever angle you see this at is just as beautiful what an amazing building with lots of history,make sure you do the museum if your mad on history there is truly an amazing piece as soon as you enter the museum.

History lesson. Was very interesting especially if you're in to history, however if you're not it can just seem like a pile of ruins and be boring so just bear this in mind if paying for a tour guide there isn't much to say about palatine hill itself so they just drone on

Palatine Hill. One of the high points of our stay in Rome. Bought tickets at 9.00am and used them later to queue jump the Colluseum-very worthwhile! It was 34 degrees on the day we visited but if you take a hat, drink regularly and spend some time in the museum there, you should have an excellent time. The views are stunning!

Amazing History. Palatine Hill has so much history - but it did get a little boring for us. Plan to walk quite a bit to see it all. The view from the top is very interesting as you can envision what it looked like 2000 years ago. It was very hot when we were there.

Hot, hot, hot!!. We visited on a cloudless, hot sunny day in the middle of July - it was hot!! We all had hats, umbrellas and bottles of water (lots of water fountains for refilling) which are a must! The history of this place is astounding, hard to get your head around, but worth a visit. Be prepared for lots of walking on uneven ground - good walking shoes a must.

Okay not Great. We booked the Underground Colosseum tour with Palatine Hill and Roman Forum through Real Rome Tours.Palatine Hill had cool features and lots of ruins but nothing extravaggent really got me interested. It is a huge space with what would have been very large buildings but most of it is underground and/or gone over the years. If it wasn't part of the tour I don't think we would have toured it on our own.

This place needs more than a day!. Although it was mostly raining on the day we visited, I found the place breath taking. Visiting in March was a good idea as the crowds were less however it poured with rain the three days we were in Rome. On advice from this site, we bought combined tickets at the Palatine Hill which give access for the Colosseum as well, which saved us from queueing. I just wish we had been able to spend more time there.The loos are near the entrance!

Wonderful area for lovers of Roman history. Walked here from Colosseum and Arco di Constantino along the via Sacra, entry near Arco di Tito. Get a Colosseum and Roman Forum combined ticket in advance, excellent value. A lovely walk up the Palatine Hill and wonderful views of the Roman Forum. Just wander around and soak up the atmosphere and imagine the history. Remember to take a hat and some water, it was very hot even in October when we visited.
Another huge experience, but a bit boring. Its a another massive attraction but to be honest a bit boring once you bet past the building site feel. Its good value though
Rome - wonderfull. Rome is one of those places in the world we can go back to over and over again, Palatine Hill is one of the many places Rome you must see ,it is amazing.

Just OK. We came here because it was included with our ticket to the Colosseum. There are some ancient ruins, but there are much nicer attractions in Rome. If you are a history buff, then it may be worth it for you. I personally would skip it.

Ancient Rome at it's best!. Read about Palantine hill before you go. There is a lot you need to "imagine" because nit a lot of buildings are still standing. Coming here is a great way to learn more about the incredible history of how Rome was foundes and the years that follow.

If you love Ancient Roman History, you'll love this!. All you history geeks will love this place! However, please bring a hat with you! There is no shade at all and if you've been to Rome in the summer, you'll know how strong and hot that sun can be!
Wonderful history comes alive. Signed up for a half-day tour with City Wonders and our guide loaded us with so much information and it totally captured all our attention!
history alive. the layout of the streets gives an impression of life 2000 years ago, take your time and read the information - it all helps
