Honeymoon. We went to Rome on our honeymoon and there was so much to do! We both loved wandering around Palatine Hill and just taking it all in!

Tougher to Understand. Hard to grasp all from the ruins. Maybe a guided tour would work best here (I didn't do). Some video continuously shown in the no extra charge museum may be helpful but seemed to only be in Italian.Lots of people hawking guided same-day combo tours at the Colosseum for a fee. If doing self-guided tour, consider: 1) buy the 12€ combo ticket at the Palatine Hill gate (walk past Constantine arch about 300 meters), 2) see Palatine Hill 1st & the Forum next (downhill walk from Palatine Hill to the Forum), 3) to avoid feeling beat, take a break and see the Colosseum later on or the next day (combo ticket good for two consecutive days), 4) use Rick Steve's free Audio Europe app for both the Forum and the Colosseum.

History History Everywhere!!!. There are not many places in the world that appreciate history as much as Rome and it's population does. Palatine Hill is the perfect example. Rather than rebuilding or replacing the structures that time has taken, the respect of this area is shown in the uncovered pieces of history left as they have been found. The combination of practically perfectly intact structures with crumbled remains provides an opportunity to see the various layers of history and helps to understand how researchers have come to the conclusions they have about what has taken place over the centuries in Rome. As you exit the Palatine Hill area there is a small section of uncovered relics between the exit and a busy city street. According to our tour guide that area was uncovered when a pipe burst under the parking lot that had been there. As they were digging to reach the broken pipe they discovered more relics, immediately closing the parking lot forever, and carefully uncovering another layer of history! Just remarkable!

worth putting up with the crowds. Immersed in history and people.
Get a map and wonder around.
You can spend the whole day on the 3-part ticket for fori+palatino+colosseo.
There are several fountains so do not worry about running out of water, it's heavy to carry... keep it to last till the next water stop.

Spectacular!. A must see! Try get a Tour to Link Palantine Hill with the Colosseum. Having the tour guide provide information really gives you an idea of what it was like back then. Definite recommendation.
Great Value!. Reasonably priced entry. Plenty of water stations for those hot summer days, and plenty of ancient Roman ruins to see.

Literally walking through HISTORY!. I am so thankful we had an extremely knowledgeable guide to lead us through this area and the Roman Forum. She was an archaeologist who loved her field of expertise. We saw where Caesar was cremated, where the Vestal Virgins were housed and the history thereof... I wish I could have videotaped our entire tour to watch again and again.

Breathtaking History staring straight at you. you cannot go to visit Rome and not go here. Whether you spend five minutes or a couple of hours I would suggest that you read up about it before you go to give you a better perspective of what you are seeing.
heart of Rome. if you're touring in Rome, this is one of the places that you MUST visit...have to see. It's in the heart of the city and full of history.

Beautiful, good value.. Great place to visit, better than the colosseum. Spent a good few hours wondering round the site. Stunning views. Make sure you get your tickets at the bottom of the hill before you go up to the entrance.
Tired but wonderful. Hilly yes and wonderful view. Luckily got water stations so can drink. full of history and certainly not to be missed.
Palatine Hill. We did this trip with City Wonders which included The Roman Forum and the Colessume it was a three and a half hours. It was brilliant would use this company again.

Amazing just to be there. We hired a guide, best decision we made, as the ruins can be difficult to decipher otherwise, parts were blocked off as they are still finding more ruins Really enjoyable Highly recommended
Ancient History. I would recommend taking a tour of the ruins if you don't know much about Rome's history. There's much to see and learn.

Facinating Visit. We bought this visit as part of the Colosseum tour. The weather was hot the we went and suggest you take plenty of water and a hat, as there is little cover. Whilst there is no restaurant there are fountains to refill your water bottle. At the high points you get a great view of the Palatine and the City of Rome.

Ruins explorers. The views from the Palatine Hill are amazing. As you pass through the ruins, you feel like you are in the ancient Rome and if you know some history, you are indeed getting more and more amazed

Great with a guided tour. I was able to get into Palatine Hill as part of a guided tour, and it was well worth the money. It was really great to have a tour guide explain some of the areas of interest. I eventually went back again without the tour guide and it was nice to wander around and see more details and take more time the second time around.

Breath taking . One of the things u must do and take a look on while you are in Roma u ll enjoy walking in it and discovering it many many things to learn many many things to see and enjoy your time there it was really worth being there pick up a sunny lovely day and enjoy the culture the history the glory and for sure the selfi I loved it any one who is into culture and history ll enjoy it don't miss and take your time and take a good look while you are there
Worth a look. Would recommend a guided tour if you don't really know the history. To much to look at and just guess what it's all about.

Maybe too much history. We had a combined tour of Ancient Rome and Colosseum thru RAILEUROPE. Our guide Patricia was an archeologist, very personable and apparently knew her stuff. Although we had already toured here 16 years ago we found this visit of Ancient Rome very informative and walked away with much too much knowledge about the past. We had a very enjoyable morning visit after having started earlier in the Colosseum.

Get your tickets here and then go to the Coluseum!!. Go here first and buy your ticket for here and the Colusseum- saved us queueing for 2 hours!!I wasnt fussed about going around this but we spent 3 hours walking around. So much to see.Lots of ruins of houses and aquaducts.Great bird life and bunnies

Amazing history. Lots of walking, but worth it! Did this along with the Forum and Colosseum in one tour. So much to see. We had an awesome guide who really knew what she was talking about, made this very enjoyable and informative
Wow. packed with too much to see. Incredible wealth of history in one small place. a real insight into how the Romans lived only bettered by Pompeii which has more 'preserved' examples of art etc.

very interesting. This area is great to visit in conjunction with the Colosseum and the ancient ruins and wildflowers and cobbled stones really are a site to see, our guide showed us place of interest and I was glad of his services so if you can its best to have a guide, I gained an insight in the the ancient Romans with their many gods and their amazing ability to design functional buildings that many of todays architects would struggle with.

Good if you know what to look for. If not visiting as part of a tour, enter via the via de San Gregorio entrance. You see the main sights in reverse order but there was no queue for tickets and it means entry to the Colosseum becomes quicker as you already have your ticket. I used the guide to Palatine Hill on the Rough Guides website, which follows this direction and felt satisfied with my visit.

A Rome highlight. The area that includes Palatine Hill and the Forum is larger than you would expect and you will need to allow at least 2/3 hours just to walk around it (your entrance ticket covers both). As footing can be challenging in places (especially if it has just rained) the choice of footwear needs careful consideration. If you prefer, guided tours are avaialble outside but due to the number of groups inside and the size of the group you may strggle to hear everythng that is said. We elected not to take the tour but rather wander around at our own pace and there are plenty of information points (in English) should youi wish to know more about what you are seeing; You arelikely to visit this along with a visit to the Colosseum so pick your time carefully (either aim to get to the colosseum early or go to the Pallisades first).

Worth while. I got a joint ticket for plantine hill and the colosseum and it is well worth it. I got the ticket before I got to Rome with GetYourGuide and I would highly recommend. It is a bit more expensive than buying it there but you miss all the ques. There is a lot of walking about but well worth it. There is a lot of history around and chances to take a lot of pictures. Make sure you walk right to the top because the view is amazing you can see loads of Rome from it. Make sure you have a good few hours to be able to see everything and take it all in. It is well worth it and I would recommend it.

Worth a visit. My partner and I visited Palatine Hill, The Forum and The Colosseum today, and thoroughly enjoyed it. We bought the ticket for all three at the short Forum ticket queue, which saved time queuing at the Colosseum (€12 each). Palatine Hill was great to walk around and read the information boards about the fascinating history of Rome.
Amazing. Absolutely a must amazing views of the city there is cover in areas to shade fromThe sun .Get some great pictures of some great spots

Must see. Been to Rome a number of times but missed this out due to time but on this visit left the Colosseum and entered from their had a great walk around got a real impression of the size of the emperors palace really impressive

Start here and then to coliseum. Great- we should have gotten a tour - that is my only regret. Still great. Don't bother with the movie in the museum- it is strange and not worth it. Great to start here and then head to coliseum.

Fantastic views, monumental history, wonderful fotos!. We had bought our Colosseum ticket the afternoon before. This ticket allows you to enter The Forum and Palantine Hill free. We entered about 10.00 am and there wasnt too many people around, but they did enter in floods later. Walk up the sloping hill and towards the right hand side there is a series of steps that lead up to the Palantine Hill viewing point. You pass rose beds and seats and also a fountain. Please fill up your water bottle as the water is free, fresh and cold. Every one uses them.You can get the most amazing views from the top of the Hill. Just savour the history and views.
Stunning . This was part of our tour around the coloseum. Needless to stay this was stunning and due to the bank holiday tomorrow, we also got the fighter jets practicing above numerous time.
Great views.. Combined with the Forum, this is so much history in such a small area. The views atop the hill are lovely. We really enjoyed our tour with Walks of Italy.
So much history!. It's amazing that so much is still standing in Palatine hill! Love walking around learning about history.

Well worth a visit, price included in Colosseum ticket of 12 euros. You can visit the Palantine Hill for free with your Colosseum ticket which includes access to both historical sites. They are both next to each other and can easily be done together though your ticket is valid for two days incase you want to spread the visits out a bit more. We visited the Palatine at approx 11.30 and queued for about 20 minutes to get in but it was well worth it. The grounds are amazing and give you a close view of some of the ruins. If you are able to walk up the Hill (quite high but managable), I would highly recommend it. You get a good view over the surrounding areas and also get to view some of the Roman Forum for a different angle. There are water fountains within the area which enable you to fill up your water bottles for free, when it is hot it is well worth looking out for these! The site is quite big and if done thoroughly can take an hour or two.
Full of History. A visit to the Palatine hill is a very educative experience for anyone who has an interest in Roman history!

Stunning view. Worth the walk.. You really must walk to the very top of the highest building. It is worth the walk. Beautiful view. Read some of the history prior to going so you have perspective of what happened here. There are very few historical markers.
Good point of views.... One of the best view in Rome...get ready to walk much...take a picture in front of the pond...without that picture you can not leave the place...

Great place, wish we had longer to look around.. Great historic site, don't leave it too late in the day to go as we ran out of time when they closed the gates and we had to exit before we'd finished!

Amazing place only a short walk from the Colosseum. Amazing place only a short walk from the Colosseum, I didn't really know about this place but it a hill next to the Colosseum and a wonderful place. it's like being taking back in time the view I will never forgot.. its free if you pay to get in the Colosseum as its included in the price. :)
Much better than I expected! . Spent a lovely morning strolling around this area. Take comfy shoes. Plenty points to buy water on the way round. Well worth a visit!

Worth visiting. We went here as part of a wider walking tour with City Wonders with an audio tour (very worth the money if you have the time) fascinating place with history explained in detail. We also walked around here on our own and again worth doing if you don't have time for the tours.
Travel back in time. It's a must-see in Rome along with Roman Forum & Colosseum. Get there early to avoid the heat and the crowds.

Great area to explore. A great area to explore and see the ruins of the old ancient city of Rome, without the crowd of the Colosseum; we had no plan of how to explore the area and went with the flow. We would have spent much longer at the Palatine had the weather been nicer and had the other-half’s hayfever not got worse; we could have easily spent over two hours exploring the area. The Palatine Museum (Museo Palatino) is located on the hill and the entry is including within the ticket price; for those with a Roma Pass, it is part of the single entry for the Roman Forum and Palatine Hill. Note:If you plan to go the Colosseum, Roman Forman and Palatine Hills remember three things; i. Roman Forum and Palatine Hills count as one entry if using the Roma Pass, ii. if you get the combo ticket for all three sites it is valid for 2 days, and iii. do not get combo ticket from the Colosseum due to the much longer queue.We started at the Roman Forum and because we had a Roma Pass, did not need to queue (there was a queue of about 50 waiting to get tickets and a family of four in the reserved ticket queue); we went straight through to where the security guard is standing. If you need to purchase tickets, get them from the Palatine entrance, when we were leaving from the Palatine side, people were getting tickets without having to wait. When we went to the Colosseum, even with a Roma Pass we had to queue 30 minutes to get through the queue outside and go through all the security checks. If one does not have the Roma Pass or the combo ticket, the queue at the Colosseum for purchasing tickets was longer.
must see. this as all Rome is just the place to be no matter what season it is. There is so many reasons to visit it. Palatine hill is definietly one of them and must see when travelling there
Beautiful . Again we had booked it online as part of the collosuem package €28 totalLovey interesting things along with the Roman forum must have been spectacular in its beginning

A Surprising Trip through history. We went here just after the Colosseum trip, brilliant insight to ancient Rome with spectacular views over the Colosseum and the Circus Maximus (Actually saves you having to go there as it's pretty much just a large field!) well worth a visit.

Fantastic area. You can spend hours walking around this area. Ive never seen so many historic buildings/ruins in a small area. fantastic area to view the history of rome. If you are walking round in the summer remember plwnty of water as there is not a lot of helter from the sun.
Take a guide.... Another must see when in Rome. it is fascinating to walk through the remains of ancient Rome! But take a guided tour to learn and see even more.

My all time favorite. Use the side entrance and beat the queues. You can go to Colosseo the next day with the same ticket. Under 25 years old EU citizens with passport get 50% off. Bring a lot of water if it's a hot day (and in Rome it usually is). There are no cafes but you can refill your water bottle from the drinking fountains. There are also some public restrooms in the area. In my opinion this place is even better than the Colosseo. Don't miss the Aqua Claudia as it is a must see.

Truly amazing. Entry is included in the Colosseum ticket, and is so worth it. We were not expecting so much! The place is breath taking, and the scale of the Palace must have been unbelievable back in the day. Here along with the Roman Forum was probably the highlight of our trip, and I'm 100% heading back here again the future. I have a feeling that due to the scale of the site there are still things we did not see or explore. A highly recommend day out - and you will need a full day to see The Colosseum, here and The Forum.

Worth a stop to soak in ancient Rome. Included in the ticket price for the Colosseum, you should pack a snack and head to the forum/palatine hill area. There are great locations to stop and have a snack among the ruins.
Really enjoyed it. Its easy to imagine your in ancient Rome when surrounded by so much history. The large cobbled streets add feeling to the experience.
Quiet and peaceful. Great experience! Not too much going on here like in the Roman forum and colosseum. Great views of Rome and of the ruins.
hubbys birthday treat. its awesome to walk in the steps of all the previous emperor the buildings are beautiful and you cant imagine how they got built its just stunning

Great Views And Public Toilets.. As impressive as the ruins are on Palatine Hill, we found its best feature to be the spectacular views of The Roman Forum and the Circus Maximus far below. Close to the entrance are a rare Rome feature, public toilets, and springs from which you can refill your water bottle - a blessing on a hot day. If you can spare it, pour some water on the dusty marble floors and watch their colours come alive. You will be amazed by the beauty hidden below centuries of wear and tear.
An absolute marvel!. In the middle of Rome one can stroll among or gaze upon the ruins of the ancient city - I've seldom been in any city where the past meets the present so startlingly!
Visit included in Colosseum ticket. We visited Palatine Hill as part of our Colosseum trip and felt it was excellent value for money and extremely interesting.

Breathtaking. Walking here feeling the vibes of times long gone a society fully functioning over 3000 years ago with architecture so magnificent mindblowing also a time for reflection, where are we heading today? What will become of us and our way of life.

Well worth a visit.. Best to get here as soon as it opens as the tours start at 10 am and they take away from the feeling that you are walking the ancient streets of Rome. This site takes at least 2 hours to explore, and to read the signs and absorb the culture.

Awesome.. So many ruins and so much history. You could spend many hours here and probably not see it all. If you go see the Colosseum you get to go here as well. There were a lot less tourists here than I thought there would be and it was easy to walk around without bumping into people.
Where it all began.... This is the hill where the entire history of Rome and civilization began. Lot of stories abound. Well worth a visit!

Full of History a must see. Thoroughly enjoyed the Palatine Hill, plenty of photo opportunities off Rome.
I would highly recommend a guided tour to fully understand and appreciate the area.

Look beyond the Forum . Most visitors take the path through the Forum which is awe inspiring but the ruins on the Palatine Hill deserve attention. The ruins of Augustus' house, plus other impressive ruins merit a visit.
Beautiful. We went here with Elisabetta from City Wonders. The history was fascinating. Elisabetta did a fantastic job explaining everything and was a delight to have guide us!

Impressive bad badly labeled and closing time is unexpected . It is a must-see, especially after visiting colloseum, but better use a travel guide to really understand what the ruins are all about.
Also, be prepared for walking long distance.
The other thing is that closing time is "on hour before the sunset", so it is not always predictable and we were literally forced out by whistling guards, not cool.
Historic . The very heart of the great Roman Empire, you can just imagine the humble beginning of the empire which grew to be the gigantic state we all know today. This is where it all began.

Great attraction . The sense of history here is palpable in the air. It's part of the Roman Forum. The ruins tell their story. It's so awe inspiring considering how old this place and what all it has witnessed.
The history. This is a must see,we went with a tour guide and the history was out of this world.make sure you get a good tour guide as this helps alot,and is well worth the money.

Take a guide. This was an excellent way to spend an afternoon, however I would recommend a guide. They were able to explain all the various buildings and stories behind them, giving an interesting and quite often humorous tour. It unfortunately rained towards the end of the tour but was extremely interesting and well worth doing

palace of ruins. For old people this may be difficult to climb. The pity is that you can enter through the entrance but exit nobody can guide you. Ther ruins can be seen from here and very near to colossium. The ticket you purchase for collossium will allow you to go free for this momnument
Simply Breathtaking. I was not aware of the history of this area. Stunned by the breadth of it and the amount that is in tact. Ended up being a highlight of the trip for me.
Lots of ruins and history for pictures. Went when it was sunny and one of the nicest place in Rome for strolling and taking pictures with family and friends
Lovely views. Great site -less crowded feeling. Pleasant museum to visit. Great views over the forum. Look down on Circus Maximus.

Very interesting and historical site. Beautiful.. If you visit the Colosseum, you can get a combination ticket for cheaper than purchasing separately. Also, the lines at the Palatine Hill to buy tickets is MUCH shorter than at the Colosseum, so if you want to do both, visit Palatine Hill first, then head over. They are right next to each other, so there's not much of a walk at all. Palatine Hill does require a lot of walking, though, but it is worth it. You can see the history in this place, and that is amazing to me. You can even walk into some portions of the buildings there. This was my second favorite thing to do in Rome after the Colosseum. Well worth the money and can keep you entertained for hours.

Breathtaking scenery. This place was so Historic & Fast, it took up most of the day! Lovely gardens and little water stops scattered around which was a welcome as there is a lot of walking to do so you need comfy shoes, only down side there were 2, toilets on at the entrance & one near the exit not enough as the site is huge.

Fabulous views, vast history. I spent more time exploring the hill than the Roman Forum! The views of the city are incredible, and can be seen from several spots around the hill. Bring your own water for a hot day! The history to this hill dates back so far, it's a must see for not just history buff's!

Utterly Fantastic - Best Day Of My Life. A few years ago I went to Egypt, saw the Pyramids, Luxor, Karnak and so on and those places spoil you for other visits. The Parthenon and Knossos paled and seemed like mere piles of rubble by comparison. I so hoped that Rome would not seem like that to me. I need not have worried.Having wandered around the Forum my wife and I wandered up on to the Palatine Hill - all on the same ticket and essentially the same site - and I honestly had the best day of my life that day.I am not sure if there is any place on earth which has a view that contains so many historical landmarks in such a compact area. Every iconic monument you point your camera at has another equally significant one peering over its shoulder. And the site is so vast that the crowds get lost in there. Unlike the Colosseum where you have to wait for a tour group to go past to get a free shot at your point of interest all you have to do is turn around and look at something else for a bit. You can see so much from a single point that it is hard to know how to focus.I cannot do this place justice, just go there for yourselves.The entrance fee is about 12 euros and that ticket covers the Palatine, Forum and Colosseum and is valid for 2 days - London are you listening? You can buy them on the day or in advance. You can get tours and guides but I honestly think there is less need than for the Colossuem. If you take a tour with a guide you will probably need to come back again and go around more slowly and drink the place in - I found the same to be true of Pompeii. It is great to have the information but you need time to absorb the scale and atmosphere of the place.
Great views of Forum. This was an amazing site, but not all attractions were open, which was disappointing. The stadium and the floor in the Domus Flavia were impressive.

A walk you must take.. A walk along around Palatine Hill is a stroll through Roman history. It is also a colourful everyday event with so many people interacting with interesting sculptures and ruins.

Wow. Best value attraction, but be prepared for blisters! You could spend all day here and not see it all. There is a distinct lack of WCs everywhere in Rome, this is no acceptation. But free drinking water fountains dotted about.

Gorgeous . Full of history lovely gardens to walk around on a sunny day, I really enjoyed imagining what Rome would have been like all those years ago, make sure you take water and good walking shoes there is lots of culture to be seen here !

Palatine Hill an excellent place to visit. Once again we had a great guide and this is so important as it certainly adds to the enjoyment of a great experience. Although it began to pour half way through the tour with all the great stories of the past; especially the virgins who lived in splendour and gave their lives to the city. Although this is a place of ruins it is interesting and worthwhile to learn more about the history of Rome.
Grand and amazing. Definitely worth going. Not many people, but the view is very grant! Love the trip except rain at the end of the day. Oh well, it looks fresh in the rain.

Palatine Hill is the cradle of Rome.. Rome is a city built on seven hills. Palatine Hill is the location of the central archaeological area of Rome. The Roman Forum, the center of the city for ten centuries is located in the Palatine Hill area. Today it is possible to walk through this vast archaeological area, enjoying the ruins surrounded by beautiful greenery. The top of Palatine Hill offers a view of Circus Maximus. One can also visit the Palatine Museum, also located in the Palatine Hill area.

wonderful site to behold. very nice area to see how the past lived. the history and being able to walk throu is great would have like to seen more of this area but had other tours too go on. next time

Great view of Forum an other ancient ruins. From Palatine Hill you can see an amazing ariel view of the ancient Roman Forum, ruins of temples, justice buildings, triumphal arches, etc. We saw this view from both Palatine Hill and from Capitoline Hill. It is just breathtaking. Be sure to have a look.

A super glimpse of Roman History. If you really want to understand and "see" the beginnings of Rome, you must not miss this museum for any reason. You will be taken to the ruins of the most important buildings in old Rome and you 'll be able to experience Roman life. You cannott leave Rome without having been there. Very interesting, complete, incredible, excellent guides and explanations. History comes to life.
Lovely to walk about and just enjoy.. We had a great day but it's such a nice place to wander around and chill out. Buy a ticket for the forum, hill and collaseum in one.

Interesting history and lovely views over the Forum.. To avoid queueing again make sure to book this with the Forum and Colossuem visit before you go as the lines are horrendous. Try to look at everything as you get a wonderful insight into life in these times.

An impressive layout, needs a tour to appreciate fully. You can visit this place on your own but it will have far less meaning without a tour guide, as with anywhere in Rome, there is far more history than you can ever know. Do a combined Colosseum-Palatine-Forum tour.

My visit to Rome. What a fantastic place! The Palatine hill is a place where can spend hours taking in the history and the awe inspiring architecture that remains of what might have been an impressive palatial complex. It is important that you wear comfortable shoes, bring water and snacks, since the grounds are quite extensive and there is a lot to see: from the Flavian palace overlooking the Forum, the Domus Augustana, and, most importantly in my opinion, the Palatine Museum located at the top of the hill. If you are into the history of western civilizations, you may find yourself spending over 4 hours enjoying everything there is to see in this place. If you have kids, 2 hours may be over the top for them. I highly suggest visiting the museum: in it you'll find artifacts found on that same hill dating back to the bronze age, and forward in time to the iron age, the kingdom, the republic, and the empire. It is believed settlements on the Palatine hill date back to 10,000 BC…it could very be the hill where it all began for Rome.

See it from the inside. Fascinating for lovers of ancient history, particularly with the benefit of a knowledgeable tour guide to fill you in on what the signs don't say. Try to combine a tour of Palatine Hill with the Forum and the colosseum.

One of the best views of the Coliseumfor free. When you walk up to Palatine hill, you have a sweeping view of the Roman Forum and a fantastic overview of the Coliseum. Take a moment to walk behind the VEII monument to get the best views. Price is right- FREE!

Impressive and grand scale. Got to know after visiting that Palatine is derived from palace as here was the first monarch who built a palace. The grand scale is visible in the ruins and one can see the retaining wall part of which is still here to gauge the vision of the architect who devised means to flush out water and stabilise the structure. The private and public areas are also demarcated. The grand columns that supported the structure too are there.
Really fun walking tour.. Must see. You can get your tickets for this when you buy your Colosseum tickets (combined tour). The view from the top is amazing.

Walk back in Time but bring plenty of water. This is not for the weary or the easely bored. If one ruin looks the same as all the others, please do not go to this site. You'll piss off everyone and drive yourself nuts. But if you are loke me and can picture life in ancient Rome, imagining all those key events taking place in such a small area, the Roman Forum is The Key to understanding how a tribe of hut makers could evolve to such heights.

How mighty was the Roman Empire . Believed to be the site of the original tribes of Rome (say 7 or 8 hundred BC) before the mighty Tiber was tamed using Greek ingenuity on water management and drainage. It then became the place where Romulus (the founder of modern Rome) grew up.They are still excavating the remains of much of those original settlements today, well below ground level and the scale and quality of construction is staggering.It is also amazing to understand that the Romans built various buildings and monuments that have stood for over 2,000 years despite the looting of various bits and pieces. In some cases, buildings have been built inside existing structures.I think modern engineers would struggle with that even with computer aided design.
History. Very interesting, well worth a visit but recommend a guided tour, its easy to miss information about this historical site.

Amazing site - best with a guided tour. This is just opposite the Coliseum and next to the Forum, quite a bit of hill climbing and walking around the various buildings/ruins. Might be difficult if you have mobility issues. You get a sense of the power of the Roman Empire and all its wealth. Very interesting and our guide (From US) was great - very knowledgeable. We were a bit short on time, but there is so much to see and they are still discovering buildings at present time which are covered with layers of soil.

One of the highest hills in Rome.. Situated to the west,above and between the Forum and the Tiber river,is this important part of ancient Rome.Like todays "nob hill",the Palatine was the major living area of the highest in Rome,including Augustus and Livia,not only for its exalted height but because in Romes hot summers,it received cool breezes.Today you can see the House of Augustus [see my comments under that heading for access],the hippodrome,an ancient racetrack,and equestrian circus [in the oblong] and todays museum of forum objects.2000 year old and well preserved.Worthy of a visit.Enjoy.

Probably best with a guided tour. A good guide book is helpful but it didn't answer all the questions about this amazing area. The imagination roams in an effort to picture what it was like at the time and who was standing on this spot back then. Over-hearing what the guides were saying sounded as though it might be information overload but with so much culture to digest I guess it doesn't matter. Street sellers get on ones' nerves, pity the authorities don't control it.

Amazing site for those of us who do not have Roman ruins in their back yards. Many people skip this site even though it is covered by the same ticket as the Colosseum and Forum. I always go here first to get my ticket because there is no line here. I find the site amazing because you can really see the scale of buildings that one stood here. You also get great views. I really like the trees here.

Lot Of Climbing. One you get to the top there are some good views of the city but i would not recommend for those with mobility problems and young children. Far better attractions to see in Rome than this.
Very good. Our guide, Mat, was most informative and funny and explained quite more than I already knew, or thought I did

Never miss this Palace in Rome. this is situated just before Roman Forum and after Colosseum. The entrance fee covers Colosseum, The Roman Palace and the Roman Forum. They have preserved the palace in the best possible way. It takes lot of time to cover this wonderful and historical monument, so plan your trip properly.

Evidence of luxury living in historic Rome. A must see attraction! Was part of a guided tour to the attraction. Remains of the hippodrome and the palace shows how extravagant life during the historic Roman days was. The final bit gives a good view of the Roman Forum as well so it's a visit not to be missed.

History at a glance. I realized it would have been much better to appreciate all of this if I knew the history. Overheard a guide speaking about Caesar so I am forced to read about it after my visit. Do your research or do a tour.
Walk-a-lot. But great.. You can stand where Julius Caesar stood! Let your imagination flow here. Best to have a tour guide of some sort.
Lovely old ruins with wild flowers!. Inhabited from about 10th century, beautiful ruins not to be missed. High on a hill, remarkably still preserved!
Amazing View of Roma. By all means this venue is worth the walk or ride the area is full of history and exceptional view of Romwe

Worth a visit . This attraction is very open and very big! You'll need plenty of suncream and you can fill your water bottles at the fountains. There is so much to see here, you can spend a good few hours if you really want to do it justice.
Walk among the ruins. Very worthwhile for the chance to see some ancient history up close. Good explanations provided. Fine views across Rome.
Very interesting. If the entrance by the Colosseum has a big queue try the first entrance round the far side, no queues at all but still the same security measures.

Long weekend in Rome. Once you have eventually worked your way through the queue it was well worth it. Despite the crowds it was plenty big enough to absorb them all and allow you to stroll casually around at your will. Very interesting.

Fascinating. My partner and I were enthralled by the structures we seen here, initially we did not know there was still an ancient city left we we had planned our trip, we happened to stumble across Palatine and it took our breaths away.
Beautifull view. Dont be a lazy person and climb that hill. The view is beautiful. Take a guide. take pictures of the Rome and Colosseum from here.

Interesting historical place. Most of the people go to the Colosseum and to the forum and skip palatine hill. Therefore, it is not as crowded as the other two, but it is much better. Several ancient places in a very nice natural scenery.
Opulance. Come on... being wealthy in Rome was really about living large; let me be your slave please... Can begin to image the center of the world being Rome

The views make even Caesars smile!. Atop the Palatine, you have a 270 degree panoramic view of the cradle of Western Civilization. For every one who has dozed off in history class, this emersion into the heart of Rome will force you to regret not learning more about these breathtakingly awesome architectural and historic treasures. A MUST SEE!

Looks great from obve. As an historical site I do not know if it is better to go inside, it was hot a bit and I read that going around the place my be inconvenience and need to claim and pass stone so I prefer go look at all this view from above, Tip: talking a tour guide for the colleseium some tickets in cloud the enters to this site with the explanation of the tour guide just ask before. Have fun

WOWZA. Go! The views from atop this hill are breathtaking. It overlooks the entire forum, and to think about standing on top of an ancient palace is pretty neat as well. There are two different views of the city from on top, there is also a beautiful rose/orange tree garden, and walking back towards the Palace of Augustus, you have views of the Colosseum and the old Circus Maximus. Very cool.

Lovely place, very little information about it. I missed signs or something that explain us how it was in the ancient times, or what was used for. We walked a lot and enjoy it but somehow we feel we missed something.
Worth seeing. Follow on from the Colosseum you get a feeling for the way the Romans ruled and Caesar died. Not so crowded so could soak up the atmosphere.

See as part of the Colloseum. You can see this as part of your entry ticket for the Colosseum so its worth seeing.
Lots of ruins and lovely gardens :)
Stunning gardens and vista. Make the walk up to the Palatine Hill views...it's worth the climb up. Stunning panoramic views of the Forum and Colosseum and a beautiful hilltop Roman garden.

My favourite. My favourite , suited me walking around away from the crowds bought an app for the iPad worked a treet. Lovely views nice for a picnic lunch. Loved looking over the circus where the chariot races took place. Very hot with little shade go prepared

Ancient Roman Ruins on the Hill. Visited by hundreds and thousands of people all over the world, this place still captures the very soul and heart of Romans way of life at the hight of their Empire.Be prepared to spend hours to explore with suitable walking shoes, hat, and water bottle. Even if you start early you will spend most of your time outdoors.You will not be disappointed. It will be best to join an organised tour with a Local Guide to show you the most important sites that you should not miss out. You will learn more through them how the Romans lived many years ago before modern technology were invented.You will see a complete city living in Grandeur. They built the Empire and they have lavish lifestyles. Only regretfully now all in ruins. Imagine yourself in their shoes.Follow this journey to Pompeii and Jerash City in Jordan. Buried deep and unearthed by Archeologists, the work has just began for all of us to discover and enjoy.In search of Roman Ruins...

Fantastic place bursting with history. We went round with an organised tour with Italy With Us and the experience was not to be missed. The ruins were very well preserved and it wasn't too crowded. Water fountains were inside so allowing us to survive the afternoon heat. Unique place, recommended.
amazing roman ruins. An array of roman ruins which really helps you to imagine what it may have been like in Rome all those years ago.
Walking tour of Palatine Hill. We hired the radio speaker thing. Very easy to use. Bought at the bottom so very convenient. Explained a lot. No need to pay for a tour guide.

Worth a visit. It's great to combine the Palatine Hill and the Colosseum on the same day.This is were the Roman empire began! The visit at the Palatine Hill is more like a "park-visit" compared to many of the other monuments in Rome.There are plenty of places to rest and several places where you can sit an soak the history of the eternal city.A tip; you'll also get a great view of the Colosseum and there's a spot for great photos.

Mind boggling but confusing.. Huge number of ruins, very difficult to picture the place as it was. Probably best with a tour guide as the signage and information on the ruins is pretty hopeless. Entry included in the two day Colosseum and Forum ticket - book online direct.

Great attraction. 14 Euro per person and we saw the Coliseum and Palatine Hill. Great value. Buy your tickets on line before hand to reduce waiting times. Loved this attraction and took some great photos.

A Good Walk - But the Forum is the Highlight. If you are looking to take in all of Ancient Rome, Palatine Hill is great - however, in comparison to the Forum & Colosseum - it is better to start with Palatine, or you will be worn out by the time you get to it.

Lovely Stroll. The complex of the forum, Palatine Hill and the Colosseum are now all combined into one ticket, so take advantage and visit all three. The hill wanders up and around in a somewhat confusing manner, especially if you do not have a map of the area. The museum at the top is worth a stop with several sculptures on the second level. Also of interest are the 9th century BC huts that have been excavated. The view over the Forum is wonderful.

Loved it!. This was the one place I really wanted to see while we were in Rome. I loved it! We were on a night tour of the Colosseum and we stopped here and our tour guide gave us so much information. It was really good.
Fascinating. Took this in as part of a guided tour of the Colosseum and Roan Forum and i would encourage anyone to do the same as it just helps bring the place to life!
Worth the visit. Spent over half a day visiting on an extremely hot day but worth it as there was so much to see. Facilities good and plenty of places to sit and rest in the shade.

If must do just 1 thing, make it this! . Wow... simply stunning. Worth every cent. I paid €12 for palatine Hill and Colosuim (advertised in some places for €40+) at the gate. The history and the view is to die for. Wear comfortable shoes and be ready to walk it. You can see the city from all corners from here. Plenty of places to take a break, fresh drinking water and bathrooms too.Palatine Hill. ...a must visit for equivalent of €6, well worth it. The lines were not long either.
This one's beyond words (a first for me on this site). Listen: this is where the city of Rome began, and how. Just go there and take in the sights. Words cannot describe it.

A lot of historic building remains. The size of what would have been here is really quite something. Worth a wonder around but make sure you have flat comfortable shoes on as some of the paths are bit uneven. It is quite a climb up from the forum

Interesting and you need to like your history.. Some amazing views here. And its quite vast. After a little time it tends to blur into lots of old stuff and abandoned stone. Worth a quick visit if you do not love your history though!

Such a big part of the Roman story!. Would definitely recommend a guided tour for this one. Like other reviewers we went as part of a Colosseum, Roman Forum and Palantine Hill tour and although not as spectacular as the other sites we found it another area full of history that we previously only read about. Our guide was excellent and gave us a more authentic view of the lives of the early Romans like Cicerio, Augustus etc. It was a dangerous time if you didn't choose the right companions.

A must do. Incredible walk around. Trees for shade and often a breeze. Fountains with drinking water. The ruins are very impressive. Incredible to see where the first Emperor and his wife lived. Not everywhere in the DK guide is open but still marvellous.
Palatine Hill offers the best views. Arrive just after dawn for breath taking photos and less obnoxious tourists. It offers views of Rome that allow you to drift back in millennia.

Excellent way to spend an afternoon . Taking advantage of Rome's first Sunday of the month free access to historical sites we went off to explore the Palatine Hill. It was thoroughly absorbing and an afternoon well spent. Highly recommend it.

Guided tour with Italy guided tours. Renata did wonderful job keeping the group interested with funny and quirky little factoids on top of the usual historical explanations. Beautiful place to visit- foresee enough time to take it all in

A must to see. Incredible history,need to be reasonably fit as its a massive area.see the circus maximums and imagine how it was.huge aqueducts around which supplied water .although it good to have a guide to tell you the history you may miss the palatine museum(as we did) because there's so much to see.Do it before the colosseum

Roman history here it is. You will need sometime to explore here, but it is well worth it. As you stroll amongst the broken buildings you start to get a feel of the scale of the ruins and how big it was back in the day. A must for those interested in Roman history.

Palatine Hill is a must see.. We had a small guided tour of the interesting area.Our guide was extremely knowledgeable and provided excellent explanation of the area. I would highly recommend having a guide. Very amazing area.

Man alive so much to look at. Once past the entrance there is enough space to find peace. Right on the top there is grass and seats and, unusually, a vending machine for bottled water or a snack. Yes you can drink the spring water from the water fountains, we did and so did the Romans! We spent 4 hours roaming and the time flew by.. Pick a dry day, there is no shelter.

Disappointing in terms of remaining structures. We visited this site as part of a guided tour including the forum and the Colosseum. Most of the original structures have been robbed of their some for subsequent building works. The vast equestrian area is probably the most impressive aspect that remains.

Lots to see. A lot bigger than imagined some of it not a lot left needed your imagination but could see the grandure of it the side. Shame wernt any pictures to show what would have looked like but is like that with a lot of the pkaces there think they want you to buy guide books we were cheeky and looked at it in shop! Some lovely views.
Interesting landmark. This landmark is where the two national museums are located which we visited. The place has many sculptures.

Ruins sent back in time. This park was wow. Seeing all the old relics and ruins of back in the day. Follow the map so you cover all areas. You cant buy food here. There are vending machines. Make sure you have under €5 in a note as it dont accept any more than this. Excellent views from the top of hill. For the ruins. Alot of walking but worth it. I got round in hour and half.

Palatine Hill. We had this visit included in a tour round the Colloseum.Our guide was amusing ,lively ,enthusiastic and full of knowledge.We were amazed at the size the palace had been and about the life of those who lived there,The views up there were amazing and I was glad we had our own time to take photos and admire the panoramic beauty.It was well worth the money.

Far exceeded my expectations. Fantastic! If you are even slightly interested in Rome, this is a must-see. I was not prepared for the extent of the ruins. Levels upon levels, ruins upon ruins, incredible, fantastic.

Bigger than expected- a lot of walking!. This was my 3rd time to Rome and my husbands first and we decided to go up to the Palatine hill after doing a Colosseum tour and then walking through the forum. When you first ascend the stairs the view overlooking the forum is a nice view of the city. My husband and I continued to walk deeper into the Palatine Hill. After visiting the forum and Colosseum, we wished after we would have used that time and walking to go to the Campodoglio/ Capitoline Museums (my husband has never been there either).If you have never been to Rome before there is so much to see so I recommend skipping the Palatine to go to the Campodoglio.

A walk through history. First, even if you are an avid student of Roman history, we suggest a guided tour for your first visit. Otherwise the complex may look like every other pile of ruins in Italy. This was the center of Roman life, and the buildings are from several different eras. This was not our first visit, but given that we had not been here in several years we opted for a tour as a refresher. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable (an archaeological professional) who had many human interest stories that brought the site to life.Second, be aware that the site requires many steps and walking over uneven ground. Last, note that in summer , a visit in the middle of the day will be very warm. Bring sunscreen a hat and water.
Be in the history!. Is such like to be in the history! Great place to understand how was the world in Romans times. Usually cost €8, but you can buy a ticket for €14 and include also the coliseum

Take the guided tour!. Visited the Palatine hill as part of the Ancient Rome tour. A three hour tour including the Colosseum and Capitol Hill. The tour guide was excellent and added so much value compared to just waling around yourself. He made the locations come to life!

The central hill of Rome. The Palatine Hill stand right above the Roman Forum and Circus Maximus. This is where Romulus and Remus, the mythological founders of Rome, were found by the she-wolf that nursed them. It's also where the leaders of ancient Rome built their palaces. The ruins here are amazing! This is a must see!
beautiful but lots of walking!. beautiful sites, but lots of walking ! enjoyable. historic character. nice site for beautiful pictures !

All roads lead to Rome. Where else can you see in front of you, something you can touch, that is so old you cannot get your head around it. Only one place Palatine Hill Rome. This is a place that looks like a builders yard with so much age. It's beautifull and old, something you cannot imagine how it was all put together. This is something not to be missed.

Was taken by surprise.. At first this was just a site of ruins in my mind, nothing to it and since the ticket entering the colosseum also includes the palatine hills, i decided to go anyways. BUT, it is even better than the colosseum, the was so much to see and admire,my imagination just couldn't stop and feeling like being a kid again, bring some food, you can easily lose one whole day in there just admiring the ruins. Visit the museum and get the feel of how grand the Roman empire was. I was sad to see how such a grand city is left to nothing but ruins, albeit how grand the ruins are today, it is just simply un imaginable how awesome Rome was back then.
What a view. I didn't know where to look, everything was so beautiful and ancient! Definitely a must see, great view right from the street.
Amazing beautiful full of history. Don't miss it...so much more enjoyable with a knowledgeable guide otherwise you don't really know what you are looking at.
Great. Between this and the Forum you get an idea of the power and majesty of ancient Rome in a way that is hard to explain. Spend time to wander round the hundreds of info signs.

history well preseverved. no words to describe this absolutely stunning and well preserved, steeped in history and culture, definitely a must do and your basic collosseum ticket gives access into this aswell 2 for the price iof one which is great, I enjoyed this more than collosseum truth be told.

Avoidable. It is a steep climb up the hill and there are just ruins. Ruins so ruined, that it is hard to use your imagination to "see" the palace that once stood in this spot. Of course the legend of Romus and Remulus is romantic and you might be able to sense that when you are on top of the hill, but the heat will take that away. I did this spot with a guide, so it wasn't too bad, but had I done this by myself, I would have been kicking myself.
Must Visit. Must visit along with Roman forum, beautiful view, you can take lot of photos, Ancient structures are how beautiful

History Revisited. When walking through these ruins, one can imagine how magnificent this area must have been centuries ago. It was well worth the time spent on the tour. Our tour guide was quite informative and interesting.
25th Anniversary. Very close to the coliseum would recommend seeing this site. So much history and information given by our guide.

Fantastic walk through history . Lovely wander thorough the historical grounds and an excellent display of ancient statues and carvings in the museum. I can't believe you can see all this plus the forum and colosseum for €12, it's just fantastic value for money.
Unmissable. We spent from 10:30 to 18:00 here (and the Forum and Colosseum) and could have spent longer. Note that the ticket allows entry on two consecutive days. Great value!

Lovely. The weather was lovely when we went which made this so amazing. The walk around was incredible with amazing views and lovely gardens. You can see right over the Roman forum and colosseum, great photo opportunities!!!

Worth the money . You could spend a whole day here. Picnic taking photos and making videos all day long. Bring food and drink as you can't get any in here. We took so many photos that it would be crazy to upload them all. There is free water that comes out of the fou tins that everyone was filling up there water bottles with. I am unsure if this is drinking water but we did it to and was not I'll x
Great View Point. Fantastic views across Rome can be seen from the top of Palatine Hill and lovely gardens also the ruins of the Augustus Palace worth a look.

Beautiful View of the Roman Fourms. If you go to the Colosseum you get free access to the Roman Forum and Palatine Hill included and its definitely worth a visit. The hill provides beautiful views of the Forum and the rest of the city. There are a number of ruins on the hill including the legendary hut of Romulus however the area is scarcely signed so it is difficult to know what you are looking at.

Above expectations . So much history, fantastic views and a good little hike. This is part of the coliseum ticket and is well worth seeing. Have some water for when it is hot. Great just to soak in the atmosphere

More time !. Strolling amongst the ruins on Palatine hill is so enjoyable. Both times I've been there I felt I didn't have enough time. Looking down at the forum and walking around just makes you think about the historical people that would have walked these same paths & streets.
Wow. The views are beautiful. The walk can be a little difficult for some but electric buggies are available for those who can not walk it.

trip trough time. Seeing a part of history and walls of ancient palaces can be overwhelming. First time I came here, I thought I got lost, so dont be scared, you'll find a way. Dont miss to visit a museum, it is in the center of the hill, a big white building. It can get realy hot in july, there is not many trees as you go further.
Amazing. It's literally an open air museum with a mind blowing view that worth the walk (count a few hours) ! Definately a must do in Rome !
Great views. We had a partly cloudy day and I got some great pics of the area, very interesting to walk through and enjoy.

A fantastic site but with management and interpretive problems. After visiting the Palatine Hill I was both thrilled and disappointed. I was thrilled to be there where all that significant history occurred but it could have been so much better if the management and interpretation were improved.I hired an audioguide which when I got into the site found did not work. When I returned it later, the staff person was very rude, effectively accused me of lying and refused to return my money! The interpretation was minimal. When you walk in, you have no idea where anything is, no clear idea of the overall layout or sense of the place as a cohesive whole.You wander around stumbling on different ruins and not really understanding each one's place in the history of the Roman era. Signage needs to be vastly improved. Paths need repairing and the whole area feels like it needs much more money spent on it, considering its major historical significance. There are no staff visible on the site so no-one to ask where anything is or the what/why/who etc of any of the ruins.Often other heritage sites have staff or volunteers around just waiting to help. There was nothing like this. So overall, I'm glad I visited the Palatine Hill but I think it is huge opportunity missed to make it a top visitor attraction for Italy, not just Rome.

Good for those who enjoy a good hike. There is a great deal of history here but it's not for the physically weak or impaired. It was very warm the day we went so that made it more challenging. But you can see some beautiful panoramic views of Rome.

Again a must. It's across the street from the colossium but it's not easy to see both because they require lots of time for exploration. Rome is not a city to spend a day or two it's a city that requires a minimum of 8 days and that's not enough.

Palatine Hill. You'll be outdoors most of the time as you tour these grounds, with lots of walking and small hills to climb. It's a gorgeous place filled with enchanting areas that really make you wonder what it was like in ancient times. I've been here two times, once in the morning, and once in late afternoon. The late afternoon visit didn't give as much time, but the light was softer and the air was cooler, which made the experience even better. It's one of those places that gives you a sense of something being very special and alive about it, even though much of what you see is called "ruins." It's a place that stays in your thoughts and heart for a long time after you leave.

Took me by surprise. Never been to Rome before and I hadn't done any research before i got there. So much to see at this site. Entered at the bottom of the hill near the Colosseum and walked up the hill to Roman Forum.

So much history. I loved it!!!. I would definitely visit again. I had an absolutely amazing time visiting the site. I joined a tour when I arrived at the site which turned out to be an inspired choice. Makaila was the best tour guide of the trip for me (I had 3 different ones for different experiences).

well worth a visit. The Palatine Hill looms above the Forum and, ironically, could be easy to miss for that reason as one wanders below it. But not only are there extensive ruins on top of the hill, and a small museum too, from it one has a panoramic view of the Forum and of nearby related sites such as the Markets of Trajan. There is even a fine photo opp of the dome of St Peter's in the far distance, framed by the ruins on the hill. It is even possible to visit the so-called remains of the cabin of Romulus and Remus, the legendary founders of Rome. At the very least, that foundation represents some of the earliest evidence of human habitation in the area. This is a fascinating place from which to view some of the many layers of history and archaeology visible in the modern city today.
Awesome. Worth a visit and double up with a tour of the Colosseum, def worth using the tour guides as you learn so much more and can jump the queues
Roman ruins. Part of the complex of roman ruins near the coliseum. Very interesting for the whole family but best with pre bought tickets
Amazing history. Well worth a few hours exploring and being amazed at the history of Ancient Rome. There is a great museum too which helps you understand how it evolved.

Nice and quiet.. Visited here as part of a tour and after the crowds around the Colosseum it was nice to have a bit of peace and quiet. Very interesting and was nice to see some greenery and wild flowers as well. Great view overlooking the Forum, and also Circus Maximus. Worth a visit just to chill out a bit.
So much history. So much history here, but you need a good guide to walk you through it. Try to visualize what it was thousands of years ago. It's almost unbelievable.

Ancient Rome in Modern Rome. I knew little about this when purchasing tickets for the Coliseum and was amazed at the extent of Ancient Rome within Modern Rome. It's a lot to take in in one day, so I will need to go back to Rome and spend more time at Palatine Hill and the Forum

Interesting bit of history. Cracking bit of history to be had here. Didn't know this area was here and well work a visit. We went here as part of a guided tour and we're glad we came. A great insight into the non Vatican side of Rome and it's inner workings. A good look at the business side of life as it was back in the day

Be amazed go ahead and do it.. book you tickets ahead of time. Be aware of pick pockets, know who is around or near you. Bring water as there is only one or two venting machines you can buy water if it is available.

Took my breath away. Not wheelchair friendly though. This really is a fantastic place to visit. But beware if taking a wheelchair, it really is very hard work. Huge cobbles for paths and the hills are murderous, but if you can get past that you really are in for a treat. It is amazing all the buildings and history that has survived all these years. Download the Rick Steves app to your phone and you have a free guide to the whole area. Its informative, to know what builidng was what and who lived where. Fantastic area.

Very good view from the hill. Our tour took us from the Coloseum up to the hill where we were able to get a great view of the area below. Whether you are on a tour on on your own, make sure to find your way up to the beautiful gardens on the hill and enjoy the panoramic view.

Lovely peaceful area. Beautiful area in the centre of Rome, yet it definitely doesn't feel like it's located where it is. Incredibly calm and peaceful, providing a lovely place to just sit and take in the beautiful city.

Antiquities. A revelation and when explained by a guide - a quite astounding area which is situated between the Forum and the Circus Maximus. There are many steps and so if you are unable to walk far, this might best be seen from afar.

Mind blowing. WE started our day in Rome visiting the Palatine Hill, followed by the Forum and ended at the Colosseum. This area of Rome is a page out of history and takes one back into an era when these few square kilometres ruled the known world. We took our time starting at the top of the hill and moved down to the Forum. A stop off at the Palatine museum is worth a visit. If one gets thirsty there are drinks machines strategically sited around the site
Nice views. In may the area is very green and nice, and offer nice views of the roman forum. Worth visiting if you visit roman forum

Not as interesting as Roman Forum . After seeing Forum Romanum, the hill is a pile of rocks.. Of course it's not but make sure You keep your itinerary order right. The views over Forum Romanum are spectacular. Look closely, you might spot some wild bunnies! We saw two!

Great place but bring eats and drinks. Be sure to get tickets in advance. We were routedvdirectly from the Forum up the Hill. One continuous visit. There were no places to eat on the Hill when we visited, so we trudged between the great places increasingly gnawed by hunger. If you leave you can't come back. So load your pockets with nibbles.

Huge remains. What can I say ? This place is huge and full of Roman ruins. The history is just amazingI would, in retrospect advise using the audio guide.Take some snacks/water .....there are some machines dotted around selling these but not always when you need them. Also take sun lotion as it is quite exposed.Be sure to go up to the top of the hill and enjoy the views. The is a museum up there and the remains of Roman emperor palaces.Toilets ....there is enough ... And they are brilliantly clean ❤️

Part of this we could see from our hotel window ...lucky us !. My favourite place in Rome, a must for all to visit although a lot of walking entailed up and down steps it was sheer delight.A hot day but it was magnificent the buildings whole or ruins you certainly imagined how life would have been long ago.The gardens and views were wonderful and the walks around were so interesting.The only thing we would say is please take notice where the exits are , or like us you walk round and round!!
A must visit. We went on a guided tour, would recommend, as you learn so much, we took in the roman forum too... Don't miss out on seeing this amazing place...

A significant part of Rome's founding.. Roman history (or mythology) says that the Palatine is where Romulus and Remus were found by Lupa. That says a lot about the importance of Palatine Hill.Palatine Hill has a lot of interesting points, including overlooks to the Circus Maximus and Roman Forum. Much of the architecture within Palatine Hill has collapsed due to the centuries of history it holds. Nonetheless, it is an interesting place to visit.

Quite impressive to visit. The Palatine Hill together with the Foro Romano is a combined visit (paid entrance a 12 euro's) together with the Colosseum. In retrospect, the Colosseum is much more impressive but i wouldn't have wanted to miss this either because it is believed that Julius Cesar is burried here and that is just one of the impressive locations. The Foro Romano is also very impressive. The Green Door was at first a Senate, then it became a church and after a Senate again which explains the immaculate state its in. All together very nice and a must on your to-do list.

where it all began. I would recommend a guided tour of Palatine Hill and take one of the reconstructed books that you can buy any where in Rome then it all makes sense.expect a steep clime and lots of walking but it's worth it as the views across Rome are spectacular .

speechless. This along with the roman forum was I think the most fascinating of all the attractions, the immensity of the villa on the hill was unbeliveable, it's just a pity that all that's left is ruins, would be great if they put some sort of model or even a hologram so everyone could see the magnificance when it was complete

Don't Miss It. This area of Rome is my favorite. The area features the ruins of the emperors palace and overlooks the entire Forum. We saw it as part of a private tour featuring the Collosseum, Palatine Hill and The Forum. Due to travel difficulties we left the tour early and were disappointed that we were not able to go down to the Forum but very happy for the view from the Hill.
Nothing left.. . If you see Ephesus ancient city this place cannot satisfy you. You need to see Ephesus and Cappadoccia in Turkey.
Wow is not even adequate. This is a must see! So much history and a feast for the eyes. I could have spent all day here. Go with a guide who can give you all the information on this great place.

One of my favourite sites in Rome.. This is one of my favourite places in Rome as it gives a sense of scale and beauty that Rome once was. It has ruins, gardens, views and places to sit away from the tourist crowds. It was a pleasure ambling around getting a bit lost and finding seething else to wonder at around the corner. There are some lovely form up high over Rome. It would be very hot in high summer but we wouldn't visit then anyway and late April was perfect for us with some sunshine and some showers but being British we are used to site seeing in the rain and it didn't detract from the visit. The rain didn't last long anyway. We pre booked the entrance ticket on line which included the Colosseum, Forum and Palentine Hill, from the official website. This lasts several weeks and doesn't tie you to a set time of day or date which allows for greater flexibility whilst site seeing.

Great view from top of hill. Take and organized tour or you will not really understand the significance of this site. Gives you a great understanding of the power or the ancient Roman empire. Very close to other sites
Great Place. We booked this along with a walking tour of the Colosseum. We had a brilliant informative guide (Lara @ Walking Tours). Quite tiring in the heat, as there are hills to climb.

if you like Roman History then you must go!. because you get a free entrance when paying for the colosseum then you must take advantage of it, but unless you have a guide it is difficult to go around and know what everything is...

Been there, done it!. That's about all there is to say for me.
If I missed out on this would I be devastated? No. But I can say I did it even though it wasn't on the bucket list.

Where did it all disappear. Had a tour of Palatine Hill. Could not believe the size of the architecture at its hay day and how it was plundered by the future generations. A must to see especially with a tour guide.

Much better than I had expected. This was part of a Viator tour of the colosseum and Forum and this for me was a part of it that was just there. I was very wrong, the guide was very good at explaining the history of Rome and the importance of this area.Without the guide, I would have probably not appreciated it as much as I did though
Amazing Palantine Hill!. Full of History! Draws a sense of awe! Lots of places & 2000 year old structures to see! A must visit in Rome!
A must-see site. Each time we visit Roma, we stop here and visit. Amazing structures and history. Outstanding photo ops as well. Give yourself 2-3 hours to visit.
Fantastic . Lovely place! So much history! Worth the visit. I enjoyed it as I had a tour guide who was able to off load some information on me and you can also see other fantastic views from here.
very interesting. Lots of walking but good place to visit on a fine day very crowded as are most places in Rome. We went mid week its worse at weekends
Bukolisch. Where Rome came into being, one of the most beautiful places to be in this city. Idyllic once the masses are gone.

The museums are a must. You dont have to buy tickets on line. The queue is not big. Great advantage is the restaurat at the 2nd floor. Nice food and is a good stop for rest and a great capucino. Very well arranged and allows you to continue the walk in the museum after a nice stop. Here is the She-wolf of Capitolia, the symbol if Rome. So, a must on the list.
Take the full day to visit!. I would suggest to take the full day to visit Forum Romano and Palatino. Besides, its in front of Colosseum. You can visit both in one day.
Good but you'll get bored. Worth doing, some beautiful vantage points and areas, but you have enough of ruins at some point. History buffs would absolutely love it.

Superb views but lots of walking - not ideal for disabled or accessibility issues. Loved walking around here but the paths were challenging if you had accessibility issues or on crutches.
The views over the colosseum were excellent and we had combined colosseum/Palatine Hill tickets.
Picked up an audio guide, which I actually preferred to the colloseum one.
Would recommend a visit.
Worth the climb. We visited as part of outlr Roman Forum tour. Definatley worth the visit and to be immersed in Ancient Rome.

Walking among giants. Nothing makes one feel smaller than a visit to an extensive ancient civilisation's site such as this. It's remarkable that such a huge area of Roma remains untouched to mark its past! An excellent spot to climb up to in order to see a huge part of Rome... to wander the gardens, smell the flowers and admire the fruit trees nestled among the ruins. It's definitely a must-see situated really near the Colosseum!

See ancient Rome. The Palatine Hill is one of the Seven Hills on which Rome was built. In fact, it is the centre-most of the hills famous Roman hills. This is one of the most ancient parts of the surviving ruins of Rome. You can get some good deals on tickets to the Palatine Hill if you do some researh
Good to see. There is so much history packed into this small area. First stop would be to climb Palatine Hill and see the ruins from above. Also give great views of the city and Colosseum.
Incredible history. We took the tour because we wanted to know everything about this place. I'm glad we did. Boasts beautiful views of the city from the top and we enjoyed all we learned.
Even better than the Colosseum. We found this a lot more exciting and fun than the Colosseum, less crowds and more structures. Super fun and exciting history

Truly amazing. We bought a ticket to see the. Palatine hill and the Forim on our last afternoon in Rome. We had walked through the forum a few years ago on a whistle stop tour at the end of a cruise and wanted to give ourselves time to do this justice. We had no idea how wonderful it was going to be and how much there was to see, We walked for three hours and in the end were too tired to spend any longer. The site is massive. The walk on the Palatine hill gives stunning views and truly amazing architectural gems. We didn't have a guide or an Audi guide but there was enough information on the panels ( helpfully dual Italian and English) for us to understand something of what we were seeing.. The tickets last for two days and include the coliseum which we didn't have time to visit this time and it really does need two days I would say. I recommend taking at the very least a bottle of water with you. There are machines to buy this, but we had walked for two hours before we found one.
amazing. Make sure to get in to see Palatine Hill. Walking through the old ruins of what used to be the Roman Empire is amazing. Entrance is included with the Colosseum ticket.
Surprising Visit. Get a guide. Otherwise, it's probably not nearly as interesting. We got our guide in a package deal with the Colusseum. Very interesting.
Majestic. Amazing to walk around and if here is time, sit and sketch the beautiful architecture. Remember to slow down and take it all in.

Awesome history here . This combined with the forum and coloseum should transport you back 2000 years! This is the origin of the word "palace " because this is where the wealthy lived . This is worthy of your time and even provides a welcome shady respite from the heat and hustle of the city

Awesome expirence.. very roman. This is intense. Make sure to leave plenty of time to see this.. lots of walking.. bring water. Their are allot of places to refill your water. Also amazing veiws for photos and very relaxing places to lie or sit down and take in the expirence. One of our favorite sites. Very close to the coliseum. Feels like your walking through old rome.. get a tour book or go in a group so you know what your looking at..

Really fascinating . We toured this area on the same day as the Colosseum. It was a fascinating tour. We learned a lot about the emperors. Plus. you could see the Forum from above making it easier to see and understand.

Palatine Hill. The day we went to the Palatine Hill was a little bit chilly but beautiful. I remember how I didn't like Rome the first time I saw it. But now, I am completely in love with it. To think that the Roman Empire started here so many thousand of years ago. And a lot of it still stands. Incredible!
Very atmospheric. The view over the Forum is wonderful. It gives you a sense of the scale of this public place where debates and speakers were to be found amongst other daily activities

Glories if Ancient Rome all around. A taste of ancient Rome all around. Lots of tourists trying to snap photos but there are numerous vantage points. There is also an excellent museum nearby. The contrast between old and new is striking. Very close to the Piazza Venezia.

Back in time. This was one of the most interesting places that I have been to!! When you get past the payment area, and walk a little way, you feel like you just entered into another era. It is Rome in all of its former glory and there is one fascinating view after another and it goes on and on. My husband and I explored as much as we could until we literally ran out of time!! Plan on several hours if you want to see everything this place has to offer. And if you're into history like we are, then this is a must see!! Don't forget to wear comfortable walking shoes either as it is truly the Ancient Rome!!!
Go early in the morning. We showed up right as it opened, and there was no line at the entrance and there were very few people around. Highly recommended.
Classic Rome. From Palatine Hill, you can see so much of ancient Rome - the Forum, Circus Maximus and others. As one of the seven hills of Rome, it is definitely adding to your itinerary.
Palatine Hill. This was just beautiful. Was able to get so many good photos on my phone...now to learn how to transfer those to these type of reviews.....Must see
With Colosseum. Combined ticked prepaid on the net. good view of the Roman ancient life. Good view on the Colosseum from abaove and on the city

Stunning. You could easily spend all day here if you had the time! We were here for about 2-3 hours but we were a little short on time. There is a fair amount of walking involved and if it's a hot day like it was for us i would recommend bringing a drink. You could alternatively take an empty bottle as there are 3/4 fountains that you can fill up from. There are a couple of vending machines but be sure to have change for them. The views from the Palatine Hill are spectacular including many different places to view the Colosseum, the Roman Forum and other general views of the beautiful city. This is a definite "must-see".
Incredible place. Everything shines in Italy. Nothing deserves to step by, if you walk and see a church, go ahead do not hesitate. Everything is just great
