Outstanding location, views and history. This is where you can really see and learn a little of history, from temple ruins to a small museum with fascinating history on the origins of Rome. Go in the morning when everyone else is crowding into the Colosseum.

A beautiful surprise!. I didn't know what to expect, think the focus for a first timer in Rone is the Colosseum and Forum and Palatine Hill just sort of goes along with it. But it was worth spending time here and amazing how calm and stunning the gardens and greenery is. We went in March when the weather was changing and all of a sudden felt as though we were in the Mediterranean on Palatine Hill.
4 days in Rome. Visited this site on a tour with "Walk it with Jim" definately worth the money he was so knowlegable and we saw sites that you normally wouldn't get to see!!

Must see sights and sites of Rome. This is where Rome was founded, and where all he important people lived. It is mainly covered by the imperial palace complex and gardens, and affords superb views of both central Rome and over the Circus Maximus.

Great place but be prepared to bake in the sun!. Our second visit. The first (9 years ago) was after a longish visit to the Colosseum and we were too tired to appreciate it fully. Best done when fresh to get the most out of it. Remember also to take your own refreshments (particularly water) as there is nothing on sale inside. Both times we visited in April it was baking hot - with little shelter available so be prepared.It can take a while to get in but is sufficiently spacious that you don't feel crowded once inside. It just suits us. A very pleasant walk around a very interesting set of ruins. There is so much to see and marvel at.Highly recommended.

A real taste of Roman life . This place was great! Really interesting and mind-blowing to imagine the life the Romans lead all that time ago. This isn't the place for people uninterested in Roman life or who do not acquire a taste for history. Take some water! It's a lot of walking with limited shade... A great place to visit when in Rome

Bring comfortable shoes. The guided tour of Palatine Hill was very interesting. There is a lot of walking on uneven ground so bring comfortable shoes and get there early to avoid the crowds and the heat.

A memorable visit to this most wonderful attraction.. We also spent a considerable time wandering around the Ancient City which is a short distance away and accessible from Palatine Hill. The weather was very kind as it was clear and sunny but the views were stunning and it gave you a really good idea of what Rome in bygone days must have looked like. Be aware you need to take water etc in with you as there are no kiosks or similar facilities.
BEAUTIFUL . I loved this! We took some awesome pics. Its also very foreign so it was very awesome for us to spend time here. We went with friends. Lots of ruins

Don't miss it! Go here before the Forum!. This is a great visit, lovely gardens and surprisingly peaceful after the madness of the Colosseum. Go here before the Forum so you can look down on the Forum and piece it together and see it with a sense of perspective- it will make the Forum trip more enjoyable!

Worth a visit for views of ancient ruins against more modern buildings - and for FREE!. Worth a visit for views of ancient ruins against more modern buildings - and for FREE! It is also a good place to imagine the grandeur of ancient Roma. It's relaxing and on each visit I find new vistas, building to explore or ruins I hadn't noticed before.
Amazing view of the forum. It is one of the seven hills in Rome and next to the Roman forum. If you propose to there after visiting Colosseum and Roman forum, it can be somewhat tiring.

Definitely in the top. Really impressive conserved place in Rome, worth visiting it with a guide so you can understand more about the history of this place or even the entire Ancient Europe, if you buy a ticket for Coloseum you can get a cheap package with Palatine Hill.

Amazing atmosphere. One of my favourite areas of Rome. There a re views from the hill of so many ruins of the ancient Roman city. Towering arches and columns, remains of vast warehouses and shops are set among gardens and walkways.

Just amazing.... A must. This place is almost magical, steeped in so much history. We were there late afternoon and early evening which was great as not many queues. There are guides but there is so much to see and plenty of information dotted about to explain what things are. There are a lot of steps in places but the routes are labelled hard or easy so follow which ever suits you. Many photo opportunities.

Love it!. Do not visit this place if you lack of imagination or don't appreciate history because in that case it will be bunch of rocks for you. For me it was amazing place to see and trying to imagine just how glorious once it was. Bonus is the great view on Forum and less people than elsewhere arround ruins of Rome.

Great for a meander and stroll. Palantine Hill and the Forum have a gazillion things to see, views to take in and things to learn. The size and scale of these are staggering -- the temples, the gardens, mussolini's old home, the Christian monasteries, Caesar's tomb, views of ten colosseum, views of the Vatican from the terrace of palatine hill. Much less crowded than the colosseum. Great for hours.

Trip back in time. You can get a ticket which combines the Palatine, Forum and Colosseum. The site can be a bit rough under foot in places and there are some steps however you can avoid these areas if you wish. The easiest entrance is through the forum. If you come in through the Via di San Gregorio you will have a large number of steps to climb to the site. There is a museum on the site. This has some statues and artefacts found on the site and there is a toilet. There are also some fantastic views over the forum and lovely gardens.
This is Rome. Take your walking boots and go for it, this really is Rome. Take a sandwich and be amazed by the Forum and Palatine hill.

wow set aside a lot of time. good shoes,plenty of water,plenty of film in the camera,take a slow walk around this amazing place the views are breathtaking, then stroll through the forum.top tip if it`s hot take a hat

Allow plenty of Time. We visited here after doing the Forum as we thought it was quite small. We're we wrong ,there are loads of ruins up on this hill and some good views too. We did a combined ticket which has Palatine Hill,Roman Forum and the Coloseum for €12. The ticket is for over 2 days with 1 visit to each. Really good value and it means you can skip the queue the next day to whichever one you're visiting.
Long way round . While many maps show an entrance at the Palatine you have to enter via the Forum. So go to the Forum entrance first and get a full ticket including the Collosseo

Well worth a visit. You can easily spend a full day here, exploring the ruins and enjoying the views from the top of the hill. I bought a guide book beforehand and would recommend this as the ruins mean more with some background information.

Great!. Walked through it, around it, next to it and finally inside it. Amazing place and a need-to see, in my opinion.Well worth the visit, although it seems The Other Places get a little bit more attention from visitors, this was one of my personal faves.
Ruins. Great walking around, part of our tour, well worth it, if it is a hot day take care, as there is a lot of walking and up quite steep areas as well.

Amazing. It's an amazing piece of history- it leaves you breathless at every step you take there. I didn't expect that from what I read on the Internet and it can't be described in words the beautifulness over there.

Must see. When coming to Rome you have to see the old city, the old Rome, and this is exactly it. Nowadays, there are just some ruins, but it is very nice. When buying tickets to Palatine, you buy also ticket to Colosseum and Roman Forum. So ifr you want to go to Colloseum, dont waste your time standing in the queue in front of Colloseum, but go to buy tickets in front of Forum Romanom, you can see Forum and Palatine and then you can go to Colloseum.

Palatine Hill is interesting from an architectural as well as a historical viewpoint. This is a really interesting attraction, there's lots of walking involved but there's some interesting facts and sights as well as great views
Worth a Guided Tour. You could walk around for hours in this place on your own and not fully appreciate this place. Get a guided tour and watch this place come alive.

Amazing views. Interesting visit (with a guide) and incredible views. We had a ticket which took us into the Colosseum, the Forum and Palatine Hill, which we would recommend doing. Guides tell you lots of interesting details which you would miss if you just go in on your own, so worth the extra money.

Gorgeous!. Such a pretty place to visit, you need lots of time though as it is so large! The ticket will cover you for colosseum as well so it is easier to go here first as the queue for the colosseum can be so long!

Get a map. It certainly is a fascinating place to walk through and it is apparent that there is a lot of work going on. Brilliant insight into what Rome was like and the architecture with great views across the Forum area from the hill look out.The palatine Museum is worth visiting so make sure you go there and don't be put off by how crowded the lower section is the first floor was less crowded. Both screening rooms were full and there were people standing so perhaps it is about time some of the income was invested in extra tiered seating or a new screening room set up. We then explored the Forum area and returned to the entry gate only to be told the exit was behind the church with a hand indicating the direction by the lady stopping us trying to leave via the entrance through the partially open gate. No - that sent us to a dead end so back to the lady who then showed us where the exit was. Maybe you should get a map as part of your entry fee or there should be more/bigger signs.Quite windy so there was a lot of dust blowing around.
great to wander around. Place to take it all in,, less hussle and bustle. The true scale of Rome comes to life. Beautifully maintained . Worth a visit

So much to see.. Make sure you wear comfortable footwear as you find yourself walking quite a lot to get around this wonderful attraction.Well worth the entry fee, we spent a few hours following the full tour but you can take a highlighted version which is a lot less walking. You can explore this place at your own pace which is always preferred.
History uncovered. The visit to Palatine hill requires walks with ample time. The hill is still not yet fully discovered. It seems lot more is still hidden than what is visible.

hot and dusty and incredible. If you have only day or two, you should skip this because it really requires couple hours and they are not very exciting. But if you get there early before it gets too crowed and you have the place to yourself (relatively) it is peaceful and feel closer to the place.

Fabulous! . Make sure you leave plenty of time to visit as there is so much to see! And remember it is on a hill....the view from the top is worth the walk up it though! Very, very highly recommend. We took our one year old and the only down side is some of the routes you use to walk round are original 'roads' so not very buggy friendly.
Love our visit. What a great end to our tour, lovely sunny day and a brilliant tour guide, you need comfy walking shoes.

The things they don't tell you.... We visited The Forum. It was August and it was hot down in that hole of ruins. We listened to an audio tour and walked all around and enjoyed ourselves. Then we exited for lunch and decided we wanted to do Palatine Hill the next morning. What nobody tells you that that you have to visit Palatine Hill THE SAME DAY as The Forum. It is some kind of dual attraction that you cannot split up. So we never did see this attraction... you are now informed.

Incredible. Walking the place you can imagine being Nero, or Julio Cesar or any other of the emperors enjoying there time in exactly the same places you´re watching. The link of the word "palatino" with "palace", a very pleasant discovery

Give yourself time!. We visited the Palatine Hill and Roman Forum during the late afternoon, and it was absolutely lovely; we could have easily spent more time there, except for the site closing (we did in fact end up paying to go back a few days later as we didn't get a chance to explore everywhere!). One of the things we found so fascinating was all the different levels you pass through as you climb up the hill and then look out towards the circus massimo.One word of warning (other than making sure you give it the time it deserves): the paths (even the non cobbled ones) can be very uneven. I lost my footing along one of the paths and ended up with some seriously colourful knee bruising that's still not fully faded nearly 3 weeks later.
Great Walk and View. Palatine Hill & the Roman Forum is worth walking and taking in the amazing history and beauty of Rome. Some amazing views and not too crowded.

Great Surrounding Views!. I visited this location with my family after walking around the nearby Coliseum. This location is included in the price of the ticket at 12 euros. Although there's a slight incline to the top, its not too strenuous and worthwhile the effort as its has some great views all over Rome. You walk through a small but lovely orange and lemon grove and there are also other areas of interest within the vicinity. Certainly worth a visit.

Beautiful Views. Gorgeous views and ruins, right across the street from the Colosseum. Our ticket was included with the Colosseum tour (booked through the Roman Guys). Only stayed for a bit, we were jet lagged and exhausted.
The view is awesome!. The view of the Roman Forum and much of Rome from Palatine Hill is not to be missed. Awesome view that you need your panoramic photo for!

Love, love, love. This was my absolute favourite historic experience in Rome...even better than the coloseum. So much to see, so little time. Meander through the ruins, check out the views, and consider its place in history.

Beautiful, get a tour for the history. I loved this and the Roman Forum, great pictures. Without a tour guide, which all seem to be college trained historians/archeologists, it would be easy to miss the significance of some of the ruins. Worth the time to see.

Amazing. Now this was the best surprise I had in Rome, even though it was waay too hot to be outside, this place has worth every single drop of sweat. You really get emmersed in history in this place.

Interesting. The ticket to the Colosseum includes entry to the Palatine Hill and the Roman Forum. However, you can buy the ticket at the Palatine Hill or the Roman Forum and avoid the ticket line for the Colosseum.I really like Palatine Hill. It is higher than the Roman Forum so there is a nice view. It is less busy than Forum and the ruins feel more complete. It is nice to walk around.

Best view of Rome/The Forum. In addition to the views, what made this experience ideal for us was Greg from Gladiator Tours. He was funny, engaging and knowledgeable. I do not think my children would have "gotten it" (some imagination required), without him. Find a good tour guide for a better experience.

So much history. This whole area shows you that really smart people have been around for a long time. Lots of interesting tidbits to see and hear about. I think you need a guide for the best experience.
Amazing views of the Forum. Great views of the Forum and there's is a beautiful park where you can rest for a while. Also, there are the ruins of the houses of many Emperors

A great walk in the past. Palestine Hill & the Roman Forum takes you back in time and is worth a couple of hours of walking and taking in the amazing history and beauty of Rome. Some amazing views to be seen.
That view.... A truly spectacular panoramic view over Rome is the amazing vista offered from here - a must do/see on any Rome tour.
What a view.. A breath taking place to visit in every way! The climb is worth it just for tge views alone. It is an amazing place to visit.
Explore your Imagination. Palatine Hill was an amazing archaeological site. There are just enough artifacts to imagine what it looked like 2000 years ago. The view of Circus Maximus is outstanding.
Must see. Must see and one of the best attractions in Rome. We started here and then continued to the Roman Forum main areas and finally finished at the Coliseum. Worth a visit!!

Rome.in one place.. Breathtaking views.ancient rome almost comes alive. I would recommend to hire an authorized guide.it will make your visit much more interesting and connected to present days:many romans have inherited good and bad habits from past emperors.
Freaking huge!. Ready your shoes.. Suitable shoes I mean.. It is just freaking huge.. You can get in with the 3 in 1 ticket that can be bought at the entrance of the Palatine Hill

Wonderful place. Great historic place. Great spot to take pictures. easy to access.Not a lot to say, the history and atmosphere speak for themselves, simply brilliant. Wonderful place but avoid the legionaire con artists.When in Rome you must visit these sights. Buy your tickets ahead of time and beat the crowds. Get the tickets at the Palatine Hills entrance there is never a line. Plenty of sightseeing and restaurant in the area also.

Very Interesting.. Very large site. Be prepared to queue both for tickets and to get in (there are X-ray machines). Tip: plan to spend an good part of the day there, there are only vending machines once in so take some food if you need to eat. Good views across the site without going in from the roof go the Vittorio!
grate. When I Visited this area it was raining but it was very interesting and I continued visiting this hill

Historical marvel!. Supposedly the ancient seat of Roman empire and a "posh" area where the Romans lived in unabashed luxury, Palatine Hill has lot of history and overlooks the city below. There is also a museum worth a visit. A visit to Palatine Hill can be combined with Colosseum and Roman Forum as they are nearby and hence can take a whole day, so be prepared.

Magnificent Chunk of Roman Life . Huge structures of ruins everywhere. Amazing views from all angles. Circus Maxima, Colosseum and Roman Forum from within sight. This place is huge and as you take a walk through it, you are left pondering what a great nation Rome once was. The architecture of some of those buildings being Titus. Within the grounds you can also see the ruins of the Arch of Titus. We didn't use a tour guide either as we wanted to take our time just to explore and of course there are few information around about the area itself. Ticket price gurantees you access to the Roman Forum and the Colosseum. This is the piece of Roman history you can't afford to miss, highly recommended indeed.
Better than the colosseum. Fabulous history, great views of the city, once inside no queuing and all venues are included in the ticket.
Beautiful views. It was a lovely sunny day when we went. It is full of history and lovely views but leave yourself enough time to get around it all.
Best Views. If you are limited in time, you must go to this venue! It has the best views of Rome and a great overall experience of the history of Rome!

Amazing archetechure and brilliant experience. This is a very good place to go when you first go to Rome. It shows you how Rome started all there architecture. I would fully reccommend going to the Palentine Hill.

Fantastic bit of history.. Walking through this historic site is just amazing. You can see so much history. It is well worth a look if your in the area but can take a few hours to get around. And if you find steps difficult and cobble you might want to give it a miss. Good value entry also. Only down point is signage is very poor. We did not go for a guide but would have been nice to have a signposted route to take.
The visible history!. Even though they are ruins, you can imagine the grand palace that stood above the Circus Maximus. It was huge!

''You are part of the history''. Visiting Rome without visiting Palatine Hill means that your Rome experience is not full.. This is a really important place for Roman history (everything started from here) .The view of the hill is amazing but the view to the holy road (via Sacra) is unbelievable!!I had my 3y old son but our stroller is an off road one , otherwise it would be a little difficult to see the whole place. Walking - shoes required .

Stunning. So much to do, you could take all day and still not have seen it all. A nice mix of history, pleasant views, history and architecture. Those with limited mobility would struggle, but it will certainly wear out children very nicely as they gave space to run and the imagination to gave fun in the spaces.

Fascinating! . I recommend avoiding tour groups for palatine hill and Roman forum. Instead find a good book and give yourself a good few hours to explore! Ticket price also gives you access to colosseum and Roman forum.

Fascinating story of ancient Roman casas and palaces.. We spent the day on the three big sites, starting here. No queues at the entrance and admission for four was 30€ as we are teachers. The audio guide was extensive, almost too much, but we also had a good guide book which made it easy to identify what we saw. We prefer to go at our own pace, rather than be marched around on a tour, but we did see that some parts of the site (notably the interior of Livia's house) were only available to some tours. Might be worth checking if that is something you specifically want to see.
Amazing views. It is simply mind blowing the size and architectural skill the Romans had and Palatine Hill enables you to look over the Roman Forum as well as the Circus Maximus.

Must see and should start here. Should start with Palantine HIll as it is one ticket to visit here and the Roman Forum and Colosseum. The line for Palantine is much shorter than you can stand in a different line for ticket holders at the Colosseum. It looked like it was the faster bet.
Walk thru history. This is a great opportunity to walk thru real history. It is worth your time and get a trip with What-A-Life or Dolce Vita Roma tours.

No High Heels Here. This was our second stop on our day tour. Such a vast amount of history everywhere you turn. I titled this No High Heels Here as there were women who were actually wearing high heels while walking over cobblestone pathways and uneven stairs - wear flat shoes - you'll thank me! There is quite a bit of walking to be done to see everything. Could easily spend a couple of hours here so plan on it.
Amazing. Much prefered here that the Colosseum. Allow plenty of time and worth an audio guide to tell you more about the area.

Quiet and green. This is a great relief from the dust and hustle of the forum. It's grassy and sweet with birdsong. Best have a guidebook if you want to identify all the ruins but I think it's O.K. to go there for the atmosphere rather than education.

Great to see. Great to see the garden and the views of the city. If you're not too mobile or have young children, I recommend doing Palentine Hill first and walking down the steps to Roman Forum rather than the other way around, as you ascend gradually this way around, opposed to many steps on the way up from Roman Forum

Just had to go back a second time. This was our second visit. We were there in 2013 when we had a guided tour which was a very interesting taster. However there is just so much to see that we needed to go back on our own and spend more time exploring. Take a guide book with you as the signage is not the best. The scale of the site, like most of Romes splenders, is awe inspiring. Take your time and a bottle of water!
Great views of Rome. If you are going to the colloseum then make sure you visit the palatine hill where Rome began and where the emperors lived.

Best View of the Colosseum. Although it's a hike, and somewhat difficult to find when navigating the Roman Forum, it is definitely worth it. This is one of my favorite views in Rome. You can never seem to get a decent picture of the Colosseum when you are near it, but from Palatine Hill you get the best shot!
what a lot to look at!. there is plenty to see here , there is quite a bit of walking to be done but its well worth spending some time looking around .

So much history. Palatine Hill is a great to see a lot of the ancient Roman history in one place. The site is very well preserved and you get a sense of how the upper class lived when the city was in it's prime.

Amazing area. Free with tickets to the Colosseum, this can't be missed. There is so much history to be found here and at the top of the hill you can get great views of the Forum, Colosseum and the rest of Rome.
Impressive landscapes. Wonderfull landscapes from the top terrace. Really impressive architecture with rich history. Must see! I hardly recommend to read some facts about the place or hire a guide.

beautiful gardens, don't forget sunscreen. This was a great place to take in the scenery of Rome. We had a private guide (Vera with "Rome: Tours of the Vatican with Tom & his Team") with us, so we were able to get some interesting history and look down at the forum as she described how the buildings looked back in the day. Don't forget to apply sunscreen; while there is a little shade in the gardens, this event, including the forum, is mostly out in the open.

Another place you must visit in Rome. Right next Colosseum. This is the place where Rome was founded. Apparently the word "Palace" came from Palantine. Right next to Palantine hills is a large area where the movie Ben Hur (Moses Charton Heston) was filmed.
Ancient city. Spend a wonderful afternoon at Palatine Hill after visiting the Colosseum. On a sunny day it could be a bit hot.

Fabulous . Great visit here today - 1st Sunday of the month meant it was free entry and we waited until late afternoon when there were no queues and great light. Well worth the climb up Palantine Hill for the photos
Awesome. One of the great sites in this historical city, it is the core of where the Roman empire was founded and operated for centuries. Really interesting!
Paletine. Lots to see we had an Audio Guide which helped with info, fabulous views at the top wear sensible shoes ☺

Interesting and full of history. Palentine Hill is a beautiful area. It is full of ancient ruins and history but meaningless without a tour guide. Be sure to at least have a book that explains the area otherwise you will just be walking with no clue what you are looking at.

A walk through history.. March is a great month for visiting Rome: there are no crowds and you just need a bit of luck with the weather. We decided to visit The Colosseum on the morning of March 8th followed by The Palatine Hill. We had two pieces of good luck, the first being that March 8th is International Women's Day which means that ladies can enter all attractions free. The second was that the Colosseum ticket -- a mere 16 euros -- includes your entry to The Palatine Hill.Having spent a couple of hours or so in The Colosseum, which I have written about in a previous review, we strolled across to The Palatine Hill and Forum. As you would expect, a unique atmosphere pervades this amazing place. Was I standing on the same ground as Julius Caesar and Cicero ? Other names like Augustus, Marc Antony, Tiberius and even Nero occurred to me. Phrases like "The Cradle of Civilisation" and "Birth of a Nation" floated through my mind. It was especially poignant for me who had studied Latin at school and had read about this place many times.We spent about three hours on this historic site that has been the inspiration for thousands of books, plays and films. My advice for visitors to Rome is to get up a bit earlier than usual, go to The Colosseum in the morning and then, perhaps after lunch, walk across to The Palatine Hill and Forum. This will be a very special day as these are two "must see" attractions.I have taken the liberty of reading other Palatine Hill/Forum reviews, especially the poor ones. How anyone can write a poor review of these places is beyond my comprehension. What are they expecting: glass, plastic and flashing neon lights ? Ignore bad reviews and follow my advice -- you will not be disappointed.

Well preserved ruins. This place is huge. So don't go there too late or you won't have enough time to check everything out.The ruins are well preserved. But you really need to study beforehand before you go. If not, you won't quite understand what happened there. As the place is huge, even if there are a lot of tourists, you won't feel very crowded. However, there's definitely not enough toilets and you can see there's a long queue outside the ladies' toilets. :(The entrance ticket allows you go to the Colosseum as well. So it's suggested to go here first (because the queue buying the ticket is so much shorter). And there's an exit that can lead you directly to the Colosseum.

Amazing Though Mostly Ruins; Entrance w/ Colosseum Ticket. A lot of the photos here are more for the Roman Forum area which is the low area to the west. To the south Domus Augustus (House of Augustus) overlooks Circus Maximus. Palatine Hill is accessed south of the Colosseum and is a relatively easy walk up the hill. On top you'll find the Flavian Palace that was grown larger by following emperors, and a small stadium with track. There are really so many different ruins, it is difficult to know what is what.

Worth the climb!. It was not the easiest climb up, but worth it for the terrific views of the Forum, Colosseum and outward to the city of Rome. There was a beautiful little garden on the way up with orange trees and blooming shrubs. We climbed up then down again, then off for another well-deserved gelato.

Blown away! . We got to Palatine Hill early (8:30) using our Colosseum ticket we bought a day previous. Allowing us to basically have the run of the ruins and the sights. We were both in awe! The area is huge, much larger than we both expected, and it seems as if workers are still excavating more. Definitely worth a visit with a camera. The scale is incredible! Enjoy!

Beautiful, historic and good views. We bought the Colosseum, Forum and Palatine Hill combo ticket. Walking up to the top of the Palatine hill gives you a great view of the Forum as well as the rest of Rome.

Awesome. When I visited Colosseum I got disappointed and I thought that I wasted my tickets for nothing... but then palatine hill was amazing and it made my day.... there were cute trees with purple flowers

An oasis in Rome. We spent our last full afternoon (sunday) in Rome wandering these ruins of the Roman elites. It was a great way to have a quiet stroll absorbing what it was like to be one of the rulers of Rome. This place is best savored not rushed through and provides get vista views of the Colosseum, Saint Peter's and the Circus Maximus. Read up on the history first or use an audio guide..tours here rush through and take away from an opportunity to take a break from the hectic life.
Loved this. We did this as part of our tour and found it amazing the history is fab and you can imagine how life would of been well worth going

The rich and famous district of old Rome. The ruins stand testament to the lavish life style of the upper class in those days.Trechery was prevalet and Power ran supreme.Emperors acted like Gods, some actually believed they were decendants of Gods

PICTURES OF GREAT EXPERIENCES. This is an amazing location. Bring good shoes and water. There are vendors all around this location wanting to sell you things, so be prepared. This location is worth a day of wondering, The problem is the rest room situation. It is zero. Rest rooms are hard to find. There is also a lot of walking and climbing and walking up hill. But, it is an amazing sight to see and worth the effort to visit.

Guided tour is essential to bring the past alive. This is a must do for Rome but a guided tour is essential to bring it alive in your imagination. Without the tour you will struggle to imagine what the city looked like in its prime and the functions of the buildings. Our tour guide did a brilliant job of showing us paintings of what the city centre looked like 2000 years ago and explained the history of the place. After all, it's just a lot of broken columns and rubble now. A must-do but fully get the benefit by spending a little more arranging tour guide.
Birth Place of Rome. Entry to Palatine Hill is via tickets bought with entry to the Coloseum. a fantastic view into the past which also provides panoramic views over Rome.

As fascinating as colloseum. This place was every bit as fascinating as The Colloseum, which it is adjacent too. Take your time and walk among all the different ruins and try to imagine what it once looked like and what life was like for the ancient Romans. Truly spectacular history lesson.

Fantastic!. You really get a feel for how powerful the Roman Empire was. Palatine Hill/ Forum ticket is included when purchasing Colosseum tickets. There is a bathroom just inside the entrance to Forum. Use it because there is not another one until you are on top of the Palatine Hill. Bring a water as I did not come across an opportunity to buy one inside.I did not get to go into the museum on top of the hill.I visited the Palatine Hill with a tour group I really liked (you can see my review of Real Rome Tours). I highly suggest it.
Beautiful . The history behind palatine hill is so interesting. It's a great place with lots to see & do the views are fantastic & it's nice to spend a few hours here on a warm sunny day.

Great views of the city. This is a quiet, peaceful spot, high on a hill overlooking the city. Cesar is supposed to have lived here and we could see why. It's above the hustle and bustle of the city, quiet gardens and beautiful views. This is a quick easy walk and well worth the time.

Beautiful area. We took a tour that covered the forum, Palatine Hill and the Colosseum, and it was very worthwhile. The information that we learned about each area really helped us appreciate what we were seeing.

Worth every penny. The views are amazing, gardens beautiful and the history interesting. I visited as a part of a guided tour which was good because that way it was possible to learn more about the place. Without the guide I wouldn't have learned much of the place and its history but i wish there would have been more time to explore the area.

Feel the POWER of Ancient Rome. Must go there!. I know - this is so mainstream and turistic. I was 4 times in Rome and finally got there with all my familly. And I tell You - I regret not going there earlier! This is amazing. And despite of the crowds You can find spots where You can really feel the POWER of ancient Rome and the romantic atmosphere of the ancient viallas on the Hill. Take Your time. Walk. Feel. Do not follow the crowd. And remember to take comfortable shoes and water! Do not wait even if You are a up-stream hipster ;)

Beautiful and interesting . A lovely way to spend a sunny hour and it's part of the combined ticket with the colosseum and the roman forum. Beautiful views of the forum and some interesting history regarding the hill and it's ruins. Make sure to at least read the Wikipedia page about it!

Ancient Rome. Not much of it left and unless you have a fantastic imagination it's hard to piece it all together, but I'm glad I saw it. The palace was gigantic. Pictures really don't do these things justice. Nowhere near as crowded as the coliseum, and plenty to see and touch. Not stroller friendly in most places.

Would not miss it for the world!. I loved every minute of the 'Foro Romano' and 'Palatine Hill'. It really gives its visitors the clear picture of how majestic all those temples used to be. This attraction takes more than 3 hours to view completely as it has many things to see in every corner. If you love archeology and ancient Roman history I would recommend you go there and see for yourself!

Very nice but a bit exhausting. The place is wonderful with so many details that can consume a whole day. Take care if you have a baby stroller cause it might be a bit hard to move, better if you can have baby carrier instead. The peak area at the top is really nice with a brilliant view on the Roman Forum.

Great site of the former Palace, and great views. This wonderful location allows you to see the view Roman Emperors had over Rome. From here you can see Circus Maximus, the Coliseum, the Roman Forums, and beyond to the rest of Rome. Wonderful history throughout and worth the visit.
A thousand times yes!. If you don't fall in love with Rome here you never will! ENCHANTING and an absolute favourite part of the trip! For history lovers as well as curious travellers. GO!
A piece of history. Pick a sunny day and spend a couple of hours walking around! We didn't buy the audio guide but we regret not doing so. Will def come back to this place next time

Serene and enjoyable. This is a fantastic area to just want and admire the architecture and the skill of the builders. Included in the entry to the Colosseum it is worth the one or two hours at least to just wander through this ancient area.
Old Rome of the emperors. Definitely worth a visit, slow moving from one piece of history to the other. Plan what to see in advance and take your time during the visit.
Next to the Colosseum and a must see!. If you are at the Colosseum you need to see Palatine Hill. It's right next to each other and gives you wonderful views of the Roman Forum.

Very interesting . The best place to view and free of charge and away from the crowds is on the hillside there is a Iron fence but you get a better understanding saves time from queuing and saves money.

Features the splendour of Ancient Rome . We went here as part of Colloseum - palatine Hill tour. The tour guide explained the history and at the end we were able to stroll at the forts. This will definitely give you the impression of the splendour of Ancient Rome. Good to get a tour guide as they explain the history and some of the details in this vast sight.

Capitol Hill of ancient times and just as intriguing. Palatine Hill can be considered the Capitol Hill of ancient times and is just as intriguing, The Curia or Senate Office Building of DC fame is closed for renovation so as with everything else in Italy, check back in a couple of hundred or thousand years and it my be reopened to the public. So we could not actually stand on the steps where Julius Cesar was assassinated which is OK after all, since it seems he was not stabbed on the steps in anyway. Rick Steve does pretty good justice to the area with his 30 minutes free downloadable narration if you don;t take his direction too literally and kind of go with the flow of the place. Well worth a couple of hours strolling around.
part of our tour. Was after the colosseum - anti-climatic experience. Worth walking around if you have the time, but just average.
great views of the city. visit the hill while visiting the Colosseum. it offers great views of the city. it's peaceful and quiet. good for taking a break and enjoying the view.

Feel the history. I am a history architecture lover and walking through this part of the city is just amazing. It has the charm and historical wibe.
Those who aren't into history, architecture will probably be boring and all the same old. But still you should see that.
Interesting. If your in Rome for whatever reason, you must see at least some ancient sites. If only for the lack of queues this site is worth walking round. Its is interesting as well.

Crowds without feeling crowded.... The line for the Colosseum was 2 hours long so we opted for its next door neighbor instead. What a relaxing walk through history. It was crowded but the space is so large you can wander into little nooks and feel like you're alone. You can feel the massive weight and power of Rome's ancient past as you walk the same paths that people walked thousands of years ago. Stunning and awe inspiring. A must!

Our private tour of the Colosseum included the Palatine Hill.. Our private tour of the Colosseum included the Palatine Hill tour with English speaking tour guide. It did require a lot of waking but it was worth it. It was very interesting to learn how the Romans lived.
Very Tranquil. We had just been to the coliseum so to find this place after the hustle and bustle was a god send. Very tranquil and peaceful. With fantastic views of the coliseum for photographs etc.

The walk. Overall amazing, me and my family spent all day here and we loved it. If you like to walk a lot and see some of the worlds greatest than its for you. I would not recommend this to children under 10 because it's so crowded and you really can,t run around, there is also a lot of reading to do which I personally enjoyed. Things you should know.not a lot of pick pocketing in this area if you're careful .you can buy water and snacks .THIS APPLYS IN THE COLOSSEUM AS WELL. IF YOU BUY ONLINE TICKETS (which I recccomend) PRINT THE VOUCHER OUT OR THEY WOLNT LET YOU IN OR DO TOURS AND THERE ARE NOT A LOT OF PLACES TO PRINT, TRUST ME !.Busy but not terrible .BE THERE EARLY IF YOU WANT TO GET IN ( the line can get bad).
Amazing. So neat to see all the ruins that they have excavated and to see what is left of the old buildings. Glad we took the time to explore the area.

So much to see. We did the colusseum first thing and then wandered up here (I assume this is part of the Fora...). Bit of a queue but worth it, especially at the top of the church for views of the fora and all of Rome.

Amazing archeological site. The queue to the Colosseum was too long, so we decided to start by visiting the Palatine. It was great as there was hardly anyone in, so we had a great walk around the whole place. It is an amazing archeological site, a must see.

Quiet majesty. My friend and I spent about 3 hours here and thoroughly enjoyed our visit - despite the crowds! There is a quiet majesty to the area which is worth exploring slowly. I thoroughly enjoyed the visit!

Amazing piece of architecture. I only viewed this attraction from outside the gates and so I didnt get the benefit of finding out about the different buildings. Friends who went into the attraction said it was well worth the visit.

Also must see place. Palatine hill is the centermost of the Seven Hills of Rome and is one of the most ancient parts of the city. You will need plenty of time to walk around everywhere. I like it a lot and my girlfriend too! Must see !

Breathtaking. Was a little dubious about going with my 10 year old son, we were both more then pleasantly surprised, the area is literally oozing with history and you can quite easily visualise the scene 2000 years ago ! Would reccomend for children if only so they can "see" some of what they learn in the classroom...well worth the visit.

Well worth the climb.. Lots of steps. You need to be able to walk and fairly fit. Well worth it when you get to the top. History wherever you look.
A good 2 hours spent here.
part of ticket to colleseum. No queuing go straight to gate with your printed tickets/ very pretty and not too busy and some lovely photo opps...
Must see!. Sad to see something so great destroyed, by humans too. Nonetheless go check it out, it is a super historical spot and very awesome
ancient roman monuments. like an ancient city within modern Rome, incredible ruins and archaeological finds Must see and recommend tour.

No less than the Colosseum. it's just adjacent to the Colosseum, the ticket price includes entrance of all three. the stairs are a bit steep but still climbing to the top is recommended for the spectacular view

Living history. We had tickets for entering the Roman Forum included in our Colosseum ticket, so went along not knowing what to expect. It is so impressive, full of buildings/structures so you can see through the ruins to what the area would have been like. My children were particularly fascinated by the sizes of buildings and bits of buildings scattered around the area (old cornicing and decorative stonework that would have been on buildings sit on the ground, many bigger than young children) It's a living history tour and a must-see for Rome.

fantastic. we visited Palatine Hill as part of the Colosseum tour, our guide was amazing and made the tour really interesting.
Such a shame that there is so little of the palace left

Must see in Rome. Next to the Colosseum, this is a must see archeological site. I would recommend doing some homework first, picking up a good guide book to understand what you are looking at. My favorite was simple with the building pictured then overlayed with what it used to be a an explanation of the history.

Walking through history.. It was awe inspiring to wander through this area. It's a lot of walking after going through the Coliseum but worth it. Wonderful to be able to see all of this in the middle of the current city.

Stunning views!. We visited after the colosseum as part of a tour with "colosseum & Vatican tours" who I'd really recommend as the knowledge they give you really adds to the experience! There are some stunning views of the city from there but very little shade so wear sunscreen!

Astonishing ruins - a must see!. This is definitely a must see in Rome! Site is very large and ticket (coliseum + palantine hill) is valid two days for a reason. You could spend an entire day just strolling on the palantine hill. Museum on the top of the hill is excellent introduction to the whole site with various videos explaining the history of the hill and adjacent area. Since we didn't have a guide we spent a lot of time (an hour or two) just in the museum learning about the site we were about to see. With excellent views over the city and the forum this site was in our opinion much better than the coliseum and less crowded. A definite must see!
I dont understand it. May be uf i have a tour guid i would understand it, but i was in it interested in it, took some photo
Huge!!!. Just a tip for future travelers, bring a picnic for you and your family and books, to relax and unwind after the all that walking! It is like a very beautiful huge park!
Family vacation. What a beautiful place so full of history. Make sure you have good shoes and are able to spend 2-3 hrs to see everything
Amazing sights. Great views over the ruins of the Roman Forum, it was not busy at all on the Tues morning we visited as part of a tour of the area and Colosseum.
Incredible!. This is so amazing and the history is vast. From the temples to the gardens it is a MUST SEE. We did have a guide and it was helpful.

So much to see...wear comfortable shoes. Had a great time. Way more impressive than the Colosseum only what it had in majesty and grandeur, it lacked in those basic fundementals in public toilets. Long queues for the loos so it will pay to take care of business before you go.
Palentine. So many ruins I wouldn't of known what they were if it wasn't for the guide. A lot of walking but well worth the visit. Helped by fantastic weather in March.

Very impressive site. Visited this hill housing buildings from Ancient Rome today. Amazing to consider that the palace of the emperor was the preeminent building of the entire World at that time. Worth a visit with a guide.

Wish I could have had more time to go around. Some lovely sights here and I would defiantly recommend going. There is descriptions in both English and Italian around and you can get audio tour guides as well.
Stunning.. I'd forgotten the amazing history of Rome. There are so many amazing / breathtaking sights but this is def worth seeing. Stunning.
amazing ruin. amazing ruin but was not impressed with the location or area right across the street from the Colosseum very overcrowded and dirty area,
One of my favorite spots in Rome. Palatine Hill really gives you a sense to see how the wealthy lived in Rome. It is fascinating that it is still so intact. I loved walking the property.

Almost Famous. Before planning our trip to Rome I certainly knew I wanted to see the Colosseum and Forums but one place I was not familiar with was Palatine Hill. It is part of the area of ruins that include the Colosseum and Forums. It is VERY interesting and includes a wide variety of buildings and ruins. Dare I say I actually preferred it to the Colosseum. It was significantly less crowded than the Colosseum as well. Highly recommend taking your time to peruse Palatine Hill.
Rome. Rome was buil on seven hills. Today some of the bet preserved and excavated sites are on or near the Palatine Hill. A genuine must visit attraction, no really long queues and reasonable cost.
Beautiful . One of must see in the Rome. Scenic place but consider taking the Tula, sling of some kind or other baby carrier As it is really difficult with stroller
Awesome !!!. Once inside, this area is full of amazing architectural wonder. Our tour guide explained what everything was and is a must for visitors.
WOW. Emagine - this place is where all the old "top guys" ruled the roman empire and they did things that we (danes) first were able to do about 1800 years later !

How old is old. The tour we did of the Colosseum, included the tour of this amazing historic site. From bottom to top,from end to end, the jaw dropping constructions just leave you in wonderment of how in their time they had the knowledge, the skills and abilities to construct such huge buildings that have survived time and the ravages of nature. I don't think that there would be a single construction company anywhere in the world today, that could repeat the process.Again do yourself a favour and see this at least once in your life.

Taking A Guide is Well Worth It. We took a tour of the Coliseum which included a free tour of the Palatine the following day. Both tours were well worth it. Known for its ruins of ancient imperial palaces, Palatine Hill is one of the most ancient parts of Rome. To one side is Circus Maximus and the other, the Forum.Reportedly, people have lived here since 10,000 BC based on excavations done!! This is the original town of Rome. This is as the legend goes, where Romulus and Remus were found.

The roots of Rome. We went straight across the road after visiting the Colosseum to this attraction as our tickets allowed us free entry. Walking up the hill to the museum is a good place to start. If you want to get the most out of this visit, hire a local guide, as there is so much history. This part requires a decent level of fitness and flat shoes in order to appreciate and enjoy the views.. Once you have finished viewing the excavation on the top of the hill, you move to the views where you overlook the Forum. Not only does this take you breadth away by the vastness of the layout, you are surprised at how high you really are looking down onto old Rome. There is still excavations being undertaken at this site, so it is not unusual to see people in overalls with hardhats/lamps walking out of the ruins.An excellent attraction

Amazing. My 8 year old daughter and I spent hours wandering round this beautiful place and sitting and simply admiring the view and soaking up the atmosphere. It gives beautiful views out over the city. The museum at the top is worth a visit. The price of this was included in our entry to the Colosseum.
Beautiful to see. Very special place to visit. You should see this while visiting the Roman forum and coliseum . Check the weather. Can be miserable in ugly weather.

Beautiful place with great views. The paths are uneven on the walk, and I wouldn't attempt if not fit, however this place is stunning, beautiful views of the colosseum and arch of Constantine from here as well as the city.Even though it was busy it was still peaceful. There is a museum at the top which was interesting and informative. All the audio and videos used also speak in English if you wait.

Vist. Make sure you wear flat shoes as it can be a little bumpy. If you visit the colloseum first the tickets allow you free entry here, we paid €12 each so well worth it. There is a little church just to the right as you exit, if you have time pop in, beautiful architecture and history

So so nice. What a wonderful view over the Roman forum, you definetly don't want to miss that. The entry by the forum even if you have the Roma Pass you have to do the line... Fortunately was not a busy day but better know it! A must see in Rome!

Always something newly discovered to see. This year it's the Doitian Ramp and Santa Maria Antiqua. The oldest know icon is on display along with mosaics and remediated frescos.
Good photo opp from the top of the ramp
Palatine Hill. Must visit to appreciate the history of basically where it all began. The ruins are literally that. The views and ruins of downtown Rome, as it was, is certainly worth it.

Excellent place to wander. The Forum and Palantine Hill were an interesting and beautiful place to wander around (on a warm day).We chose not to use a guide (after being ripped-off by the 'official' guide at the Colloseum) and instead just wandered. This was fine for us. The views were fantastic. There was only limited shade so beware on hot days. And there were a lot of (mostly uneven) steps. The only refreshments we found inside were dispensing machines so pack a picnic if you are planning to be there for lunch. Enjoy.
Oh so worth it!. Take time to walk through, views in all directions. So much to see in the area and a nice place to rest and enjoy the scenery.

Nearly Missed This. We nearly missed this as we hadn't realised that it was included in our Colosseum ticket. A real walk back in time with amazing structures and fantastic views from the top of the hill. The whole area is enormous and loads to see with English signs on all of the exhibits.
A Must See. We were with a guided tour. There is so much history here. It is well worth a visit. You need a guide to get the most out of the visit.

Stunning views from the top.. Included along with Coliseum guided tour and we thought this was better, perhaps mostly because guide (Gregory) was excellent. The views of the city skyline were really good offering good photo opportunities.

Part of the Colosseum stop. This is a good attraction. The entire Colosseum area is a "top shelf" ancient historic area. The Forum, Palatine Hill, Muse Capitolini, Monumento Vittorio Emanuele 2 are all easy walking distance, all top notch. Do not miss Muse Capitolini

Palantine Hill "Palantino" amazing. As an adult this was my favorite place other then Pompeii me and my daughter visited on our trip so far. it's absolutely incredible very intact and the history around it will blow your mind. I suggest staying after any tour and wondering the grounds as there is a lot to see and a museum on the top that most tours won't go in. It's a must if you visit Rome.

A Must see. An amazing place to see. I was lucky enough to have a great guide that showed pictures as to what was presumed to have existed at this site in its glory days. The guide was able to bring the area alive to me as we walked the area.

Top 5 spots. Worth walking through to this amazing venue from the Colloseum. Really extensive archaeological diggings and wonderfully preserved ruins. Easy to imagine a trip back in time to when this was a thriving community

Palastine Hill. I would say visit the Palastine Hill then do the Roman Forum Tours after. Doing it this order will leave you feeling at see with the surroundings the space and the beauty. Located right next to the Colosseum. You can get tickets for the Colosseum, Palastine Hill and Roman Forum for €25.

TOO MANY ATTRACTIONS. That's the best way to understand the greatness of the roman empire and try to breathe the remainder of its air. Good for everyone - those loving museums galleries, those preferring picnics and those walking around all the time. Beautiful views on the city

A Mind Bogler. This, the site of the Emperors Palace is awe inspiring. A massive site that in its day must have been magnificent, as our guides overlay pictures showed.
This is another must see Roman location with its own museum and information centre.
Wear comfortable shoes, as this involves a bit of walking if you want to do it justice.
Combined with the Forum and Colosseo. A superb view over ancient Rome, worth the climb up to get a bird's eye view of the sites before walking around the Forum etc.
Walk and explore. When visiting Colosseum, Palatine Hill is included, and a must see. Be ready to walk and explore completely.

for a quiet walk. Definitely for a walk but a very long walk. After the colosseum and forum comes the palatine wich i must say is far from the noise and fast flow of Rome. Just relax and enjoy what you see

Wear your walking shoes. THis is part of the Colosseum package. Beautiful walks and you can imagine how the wealthy Romans lived. Great to wander round but a few dead ends and it can be a bit of a trek back. Well worth a wander and we took a picnic. You get a good view of the Circus maximus and it must have been amazing, that said it was an anti climax from the road. Looks like a car park but it is being developed.

Gorgeous scenery. We went there on a lovely sunny morning and starting from the bottom away from the Colloseum was the best way to do it. There were no queues and it was a nice gentle slop up the hill with plenty to see and lots of peace and quiet before the groups that appeared closer to the Colloseum.

History with a view. Covered this beautiful place in the package of the Roma pass, you definitely need quite a couple of hours to truly appreciate the place. An umbrella and comfy shoes are a must to ensure you dont tire out soon.

What a view . We went the palatine hill today what a place the views where to die for. Lots of information about how Rome was like well worth a visit. We had been to the coliseum the day before to tell you the truth I was a bit disappointed with it. How ever with the ticket came access to palatine hill the nxt day so we went and loved it

stunning - so glad we did this as an add-on to the Colloseum. wasn't going to bother with this bit after the Colloseum tour (thought we might have had enough) but at the last minute we decided to go for it: am SO glad we did - absolutely incredible, especially seeing the cuts made in the stones on the roads by the chariots ..... a bit eerie

Amazing tour with Walks of Italy. This was part of a tour including the Roman Forum and Colosseum. A great tour with Maria from Walks of Italy. I highly recommend this tour company. They are so professional and well worth the money spent.

Step back in time. This was part of a shore excursion booked through our cruise-line and it was a guided tour on the way to the Colosseum.Of course Rome is built is layers and layers of history. One cannot help but sense how this is called the Eternal City. So much of the cornerstone of the western civilisation is built of the reach and might of this once powerful city.

Absolutely incredible!. Walking through Palatine hill was the highlight of my first full day in Rome. An incredible glimpse back in history. Pictures don't really do it justice, just go and experience it yourself.

Breathtaking!. Visited Palantine Hill as part of our visit to the Colosseum and was included in admission using the Roma Pass.A truly breathtaking historic site, great information points throughout the site.There is current excavation going on which will yield exciting finds for future visits. Very uneven floors /paths in places, need comfy shoes and a good few hours to take it all in.
Just amazing. To stand in places that are thousands of years old and marvel at the engineering feats they accomplished...it's breathtaking. The beautiful weather we had that day helped too!

You have to experience this first hand. Don't bother with tours. All signage is in English and it very easy to walk at your own pace. Was definitely worth seeing. Buy your ticket online or have the hotel do it for you and skip the lines
Great views of area. Crowded but worth the wait. A great view of the surrounding areas, Colosseum, Forum and Circus Maximus.

Scenic Ancient Rome-convenient break. After immersing myself in the Colosseum, I enjoyed this nice stroll through some beautiful lush green landscape. It was easy to get lost, so bring a good map and get your bearings. The hills are gentle enough, but make sure you have very comfy shoes-no fashion police out here. There is a small exhibition building which didn't maintain much of my attention (can't even recall its name). There were two beautiful vantage points, one that looks back over the Roman Forum. I wouldn't spend more than 1 hour wondering through here, it's a stepping stone to the Forum.

An amazing area not to be missed. It may have taken a while to get into the site as the signposting to the ticket office and entrance leaves a bit to be desired but it was all very worthwhile. Be prepared to walk a fair distance but wow what magnificent views to be seen. A fantastic feel of stepping back in time was the the thing we remember most. One could spend a full day discovering all that is to be seen. A great trip and well worthwhile. We will return!

Beautiful but a bit of a walk. Firstly, Rome is walking central. You'll have plenty of crowds but what they don't tell you is that if you buy a ticket to the Colosseum, you can access Palatine Hill as well. It's beautiful to see!
visiting the past. do not miss this. Be sure to have on good walking shoes and be ready to spend around 3 hours exploring

STUNNING. Simply breathtaking. Very well looked after, clean and with stunning views. I preferred it to the coliseum which feels very much neglected and sad.Do not miss it on your trip to Rome. You could spend ages here just admiring the views.

Pieces of history . This site contains what is left of the Roman Empire. A unique view on how successors used parts of old Rome to construct or repurpose into new buildings. Visiting the site will put modern Rome into perspective. Bring a camera, water and comfortable shoes or urban hikers.

Amazing place full of history..... Been to Rome twice but didn't get to see Palatine hill the 1st time round, so made a point of visiting on our 2nd trip. Really glad we finally got to see it as it's an amazing place full of history. The palace is particularly impressive and must have looked amazing in it's heyday more than 2000 years ago. A must visit when in Rome and the views across vatican city are amazing from the rear of the palace.

Guided tour Mircea. One of the most impressive place to be in Rome.It feels overwhelming to pass the same paths where people died for their beliefs hundreds and hundreds of years ago.You need to go all the way up in the garden.The view is beautiful.

Dowtonwn Rome, year 0. For the ones who know the history of Rome, it is a must. It is true that you will need a guide, on paper or in person (best) because the on site scripts ar not enough to understand the historical facts behind the ruins. But do not take from yourself the opportunity to walk those stones, and to think about how the Roman civilization could rise, dominate the world, then fall. Just impressive.

must see. This place is without doubt a diamond in Romes crown for 12 euros you get entrance to here and the Colosseum, Palatine Hill and the Forum. Palantine is so deceiving when you look from the colosseum you see one building and when you go there it is amazing and you also have the Forum all together plenty of steps also.

Enormous. The Palatine Hill, is a huge area worth visiting near the Colosseum. It is connected with the Roman Forum and you get to see both and the Colosseum with one ticket! Better choose a good day to visit it since there is no rain protection and there might be lines in order to get in. It's a beautiful and really well preserved place which offers a lot of things about life back then to see. ATTENTION: If you visit it right after the Colosseum, like we did, make sure that you don't go through the entrance that is right next to the Colosseum cause there is a really big line in order to get in. We waited for 30-40'. If you walk a bit round it (i.e. if you take the road that it's on the Roman Forum's right and head to the Piazza Venezia) you can find another entrance to the area, that is smaller and has significantly smaller line.

Start here in a Forum visit. We were herded to the "back" entrance because the line at the front of the Forum was so long. We went in through Palatine Hill and it was great. Very quiet there since everyone was at the front. The beauty of this tactic is that you are then going downhill towards the Forum. We saw people struggling to get to Palatine Hill after visiting the Forum. I think it probably gets missed for that reason and it shouldn't be missed.

History making sense. A must see pkace at least once in your lifetime. Wear comfortable shoes as there is a lot of rocks, uneven paths and climbing up and down the stairs. They won't provide you with a map with your ticket. I found the audio guide to be of little help. They don't start you inthe entrance and you must figure out where you are. Amazing views of the Roman Forum from the top.

Fantastic sense of history. Wow! What an amazing place and would have loved much longer to dawdle and take it all in. The sense of history is strong and you can almost imagine what Roman life was like a thousand years ago.

The older, the better. This was also included in our Roma pass as part of the Colosseum/Palatine Hill and The Forum visit. This is a must see when you are in Rome and make sure you get in line for the security check and not walk all the way up the hill and then realize you need to get back in line. We used the Rick Steves guidebook to Rome to get us around this landmark instead of using a guide.

Much better than the rest. I actually preferred this to the colosseum. Fewer crowds, more space and things to see and just as stunning a view from multiple buildings and sites. Lots of sign to guide you and interpret what you are seeing this was 40x's more an enjoyable experience than the colosseum was by far. Cross the road and do not miss this.

A great sense of history & some wonderful views too. We very much enjoyed our visit to the Palatine Hill, the most central of Rome's seven hills & a site of temples & residences for several Roman emperors. It is a large area which has the Circus Maximus to one side of it & the Forum to another - in fact there are quite outstanding views across the Forum which are really worth seeing. Also on the site is a museum which houses archaeological finds including sculptures & pottery etc.We pre-booked & would recommend other travellers do the same as the queues can be rather daunting.
Good for the views and see the museum. The hill really brings the Forum and Colosseum alive. It is worth the climb and the museum is small but pretty good.

Palatine Hill. Amazing! Through Dark Rome tours this was the first phase of our tour prior to entering the Colosseum. Our guides name was Sev -- amazing! Sev is an archeologist and the passion and knowledge he brings (he also has a good sense of humour) makes the tour more than worth the money. I could have spent all day learning about Palatine Hill. Our ticket was good for a second day of admission (no tour/guide) and we need to go back... There is just simply too much to see.
amazing piece of nature in the middle of the city. it was the best place in all Rome. a lot of nature, birds and beautyfull views. spent there few hours if you can.
Great. It's right next to the Colosseum and will keep you walking in loops for hours but if you're not in a rush, check the place out ,its worth it.

An insight into ancient Rome, but the queues are terrible!. We bought tickets for the Colosseum including the Palatine Hills and the Forum, so after visiting the Colosseum we wandered across the road expecting to "skip the line" as the advertising goes. What a con-trick - although we had tickets for the Palatine Hills, and joined a smallish queue (about 15 metres long) it took one and a half hours to get in! This was for three reasons: (i) Groups had precedence, so they were overwhelming the security system; (ii) Some people were pushing in; (iii) the security process was airport-style and took forever. Now I'm happy to go through security checks, but the system used in the Colosseum was just two guards using a metal-detector wand and looking in some of the bigger bags, so it was much quicker.Anyway, after all that, we were quite tired of standing around, so the walk around the Palatine Hills and Forum was inevitably cut short, although what we did see was very interesting.I would recommend: a) Joining a group tour; b) Going early in the day; c) Don't take young children as they will get very bored!
Good views of Rome not much more. Went here as part of the Forum tour but not really that much to see with the exception of the view. Ruins up there are in very bad condition.

If you visit the Colosseum don't miss the Roman Forum!. Walking around the Colosseum requires time and some luck with the weather, because ther's much to see and enjoy such as the Roman Forum and all the remainings of ancient buildings.
Needs more signage. Difficult to find the entrance & not much information available for the tourist without a guide. Such a pity because with all the ancient ruins there must be plenty to be said.
Goodness. Very interesting place walking around old roman ruins is amazing, only 5 mins from the colosseum, and is included in the ticket with the colosseum.

Relaxing and beautiful sights . Directly after visiting the colosseum a "small" walk through a garden full of ancient buildings. Really impressive what the old Romans built there ... One after the other ... Over hundreds of years ... Destroying the former buildings, gardens, parks, thermes and temples and using the material to build own stuff. The result is astonishing!
interesting area. There were a lot of monuments here, with panels that explained their stories. Interesting place to walk through.

Ignorance is Bliss. We had no idea of the expansive archeological experience to be had We spent 3 hours wondering the hilltop and exploring the many facets of the Palatine Lovely, relaxing stroll for a sunny afternoon

Atmospheric place. Wonderful place to wander around. You feel as though you are travelling back in time. Could have spent the whole day here, if only time permitted. The views of the Colosseum are great from the hill too.

Interesting place with great views. I don't feel that this rivals the Forum, but it is part of the same place and you'd be foolish not to walk up the hill to see it. The area is massive and has great views over the Forum, and Circus Maximus and beyond. The stadium is really impressive and there are some huge ruined houses. The gardens are also nice and relaxing, but beware of the crowds.

My favorite. I booked a tour of the Collesium and Palatine Hill. We had an amazing guide who told us wonderful information. This was my favorite place that we visited. We had 90 minutes and it was not enough time. You could spend many hours there. Bring a water bottle. Wear comfortable shoes.
Amazing. Just like the Roman Forum, it's an amazing architectural surrounding of buildings and structures. So much history.

immense. It's rather staggering. It's just a whole heap of partial old buildings and there's a part of you wonders how the heck somebody could have built over them in the first place, but that soon dispels and you just find yourself blown away at the size of the buildings, wondering how they were built, what the place looked like at various times...It's well worth following the path up to the top for some brilliant views of the forum, and indeed the city beyond.

Good for the views.. It would probably be better to visit here before going to the Forum. From the top you get a good view of the Forum which puts it more into perspective. There are also views over Circus Maximus. and over that side of Rome. Worth a good look around.

Go back to ancient Rome. The Palatine hill is where in ancient Rome the rich people lived and worked. Go back to this time by visiting it. It costs some money, but is truly worth it. Look from some elevated spot to make a nice picture!

What a way to live. This was part of a tour by City Wonders, excellent tour guide, and she took you back 2000 years, well worth seeing how the rich and powerful lived their lives. Would be no fun in the summer, no cafe or toilets here, there is a vending machine, but it ate my money, take a drink with you or you can use the constantly running water at the fountains, I drank it and no ill effects.

A cool place to be visited with families and friends. This place is really beautiful and all buildings or monuments are so unique that they should be visited by all travelers that come here. This place is close to the Colosseum, so you can pretty easily move between these two areas.

"The History of the place is Overwhelming". We visited the the Palantine Hills on a rainy day and took our time reading the information on the signs posted throughout the site. Although the temperature was not on our side the site is impressive and quite amazing. I would however recommend a tour and you will definitely increase your understanding of the time and the Grandeur of Rome.

You can feel the presence of the Caesars. To me this was Ancient Rome , you are surrounded by 2000 years of history, the Coliseum is just across the road ,the forum Constantines Arch and more all around you, a truly a don't miss.With a Roma Pass you can skip the queues and see inside the Coliseum on the same ticket, I would recommend a guide for the sake of a few Euros because there is so much take in it just helps having someone explain it all.

Fabulous new tour of homes of Emperor Augustus and Empress Livia. We booked a CityViews tour of the Coloseum, Palatine Hill and the Roman Forum. The highlight was definitely the homes of Augustus and Livia, which had remained buried until recently. The frescos are incredible. Our guide Ambra was terrific, and was training 3 new guides, all of them Ph.Ds in Archeology or Art History. It isn't cheap, and only 90 pole a day are admitted, but it was definitely worth it.

One of the must see in Rome. Spent most of the day there, it is much more touching and emotion stirring than I expected. The ruins area is much bigger than expected, could spent more time if possible.
amazing!. Really interesting place to go. Loved our tour guide and learned quite a bit from him!! Highly recommend going there!
Absolutely Beautiful. We enjoyed the breathtaking views of Rome particulary the Roman Forum from atop the hill. I would recommend Palatine Hill to anyone that visits Rome.

Overwhelming!. Exact opposite of the Colosseum for me, almost too much to take in. The view from the terrace is spectacular and to try and envisage what it must have looked like before it was plundered by the Romans for the building materials is mind blowing. The sheer scale of the place is incredible.
Spectacular. One of the best spots from where you can see and get an idea about the grandeur scale of Ancient Rome!

Fascinating walk. We bought tickets for the colosseum (€12 each) and the ticket also covered entrance into palatine hill. This is a deceivingly big area to explore. There are lots of ruins to see and great photograph opportunities. There is also a museum within the grounds which is free to access and displays things that have been discovered on the grounds as well as models of how the area originally looked. At the top is the best view of Rome we had all weekend.

Suggested by Hotel. On our arrival the staff at The Grifo told us to go here to buy our tickets to this and the Colosseum because there would be no line..So glad we did..this is just an amazing area..we spent close to 3 hours walking this.

Wonderful! . Our fascinating guide (Andrada of Gladiator Tours) brought this place to life for us with stories of emporers and popes and the history beneath our feet. We loved every minute of wandering around here. A few steps and inclines, but nothing too difficult if you take it steady and pause to look around, which you will want to do, believe me! There are drinking fountains dotted about and as the water is pure you can quench your thirst. There are panoramic views of the city and forum when you get to the top, so don't forget your camera!

Fascinating!!. Wow, so much interesting and historic buildings and sites in one location! Spent about three hours walking around taking in all the sights and exploring all the fascinating buildings and significant location of the place. Well worth visiting this place first then the Colosseum.

If you know Rome's past then you will feel it hear. Just amazing how rich this country is with history and surviving architecture! An amazing sight. Make sure you save it for a day when it is not raining.
Palatine ruins. We visited in conjunction with our colosseum tour. Very interesting. Could have stayed longer! Don't miss this tour, lots of interesting history.

Incredible History, Interesting Archaeology. I don't know if I would have been able to fully appreciate Palatine Hill without a guide. I would recommend either a guide or, at least, a good guidebook. It's hard to discern what you are seeing without intentionally studying the site before you arrive or having a resource with you.

You still need to use your imagination..... But, it's a place that can makes you feel like you've been transported back to history as you read the signs and plaques.
I was here in April 2014.
Take time herr. Well worth taking time here. Made sense of the whole area. Look out for the black rabbit! Ticket for here and the colleseum saves long line at Collusium

Just one Thing "METRO C LINE". The place is like a cementary, just few things on this place are good to see (an all of them can be seen without paying the ticket), if you are short of time, you can easily skip the time from this place and just see from the outside. The worst of it is that this place is so abandoned that they are building the Metro C line in one of this buildings, its awful.

A bit of nothing. We bought tickets for the Colosseum which also gives you free entry to the Palatine. This wasn't really our cup of tea, I suppose if you like wandering around gardens & looking at ruins then it's exactly that but we soon got bored. Perfect if you have plenty of time to read the boards & walk the entire length but this didn't interest us.
Incredible experience. You will never forget this place. It's fabulous. I think even when I really old I will remember visiting this and being moved. A must when in Rome.
History. Great trip back in history with wonderful guides who were very knowledgeable and accommodating. Be prepared for lots of walking but there are plenty of places to stop and rest along the way.

Ruins which bring it to life. Walking through Palatine hill and the ruins really brought it to life the scale of the Roman understanding of architecture. It's quite a long walk when you're taking everything into consideration but definitely worth the trip round! I was lucky enough to have the sun out shining which made it all the more impressive.Note that this is free on the first Sunday of each month along with the Colosseum.
