Very interesting. There is so much to see with the old Palace and gardens it is a must. The view from the top is stunning. We then went down into the Roman Forum and my favorite place the house of the vestal virgins, so interesting. Again you must not miss. When leaving the Roman Forum, cross the main road and there is a fantastic café on the corner, we sat there with a glass of wine and took in the lovely views in the sunshine.

Another bucket list item for Rome.. We visited this site as part of Segway tour, having walked around it years ago. As with most historical sights, this one really benefits from a good guide. In fact, you will miss 70% of the experience without one. Fortunately our guide was excellent. I will try after this review to review the Segway company, but just in case i cannot, they were called "Rome By Segway", and I can honestly say, they that the were the icing on the cake of our Rome trip. Marcello was out guide, and he spoke perfect English, which was appreciated!

Great site but plan on at least two hours.. Make sure to buy your tickets in advance or buy your colosseum ticket which includes Palatine Hill. Be advise, the entrance is down the main street and not just outside of the colosseum. Most people (like ourselves) went all the way up the hill and we had to walk all the way down to the entrance. The ruins are incredible and will take 2 to 3hr to visit. Plus, there are some easy grade hills you'll need to walk up. Also bring some water I don't remember seeing any inside. But, overall an amazing experience.

So much history!. What a cool place to visit! We spent hours wondering the ruins. It was well sign posted and we were given maps to navigate. We visited during the summer and it wasn't too busy we entered almost straight away (maybe a five minute wait) which is great considering its peak times. You can purchase tickets here for the colosseum as well so id recommend going here first because then you can skip the massive line

Great Views, Great Pictures Loads of People , Visuals. This is a must see. You can climb up the hill and then look down in multiple areas. You can take photos that span long areas or to specific rock / building formations.It is something you can spend an hour or more walking around and just enjoying the views. Definitely depends on the day (rain, cold, too hot etc) but we are here in February so just wow.

A little disappointed. Visited Palentine Hill today 9th Feb, a lot of 'red brick' partially standing. Looked out of place to the surrounding ruins, but it's difficult to imagine them being covered in polished plaster and decorated as they would have been in their time. Just a lot of red bricks
Fantastic. Get there early, and take your time. There is so much to take in here, and you get such a great sense of what ancient Rome was like. Has to be seen
Interesting.. Taking in the surroundings is hard to believe you are there. Full of history and a great visit for anyone.
The View is excellent. I was able to see Rome at its best. I would like to visit it again and be able to take pictures with a more professional camera and be able to share with people

Oh my Goodness, the history!. This is ancient Rome, if you're into history - or not - this place is a must see.You can easily spend half a day here, climb up the Palatine hill and enjoy the gorgeous view of Rome from up above.I would recommend getting a tour guide especially if you don't know much about the history of the area. Also, plan your visit to the Palatine Hill with the Colosseum, buy the tickets from the entrance of ancient Rome/Palatine Hill, and when finished, continue to the Colosseum, this way you'd save yourself the trouble of a very long queue at the Colosseum.

Amazing site if you like history, ruins and a walk in nature. This is a great place to go for a walk and spend at least a couple of hours enjoying the history and sights. The paths that lead to the top although full of ruins are nice and green which is great.From the top we can see the Roman Forum ruins with all its splendour. If you like history make sure you rent an audio guide.A quick advice is to buy the tickets to see the Palatine Hill, Roman Forum and Colosseum in the Palatine Hill or Roman Forum entrance. Doing so will avoid the usually big queues for the Colosseum.
Magnificent History at your feet. I should have been a History professor. To be able to walk through the streets in which Caesar, Cicero, Hadrian walked is an experience unequaled by any

Nice!. Like with many things in Rome you'll love it if you have some background. I'm not a history-buff but I do know what's what and why. When I visited I could perfectly imagine how the richest of Rome lived here and why.

A True Time Travel. If you want to get a sneak peak at what ancient Rome would look like, this is the place for you. When you get into de Roman Forum you will get transported to another time,and see a bit of ancient Rome that has not been touched by the present. To see everything it will take you a long time though, so I'm not sure you should come if you're in a bit of a hurry. Otherwise I saw mostly everything in 4H and was worth every penny.
Especially recommended for history maniacs!. This is a must see for any admirer of the Roman history. House of Augustus is definitely breathtaking. One should not go there in a windy day.
Love Rome. Rome is the perfect city , use the hop on off bus service 20 euro per day it stops at all the major sites.

Great views. This is the place where the richest Romans lived and died. Now, the place is so calm that it sometimes seems surreal that the entire Roman empire was ruled from here. You can spend hours walking the grounds exploring the ruins before you even visit the museum, so get comfortable shoes and clothes, and a bottle of water. I wouldn't advise very young children to do it, they can get bored. Get a guide, and you'll find out amazing things!

Amazing.. Get a guided tour no kidding. It is a walk but is well worth it This is were many of the great roman family lived, loved, plotted and killed one another. I could have stayed here and looked around for hours but we got really hungry. I do not recommend for very young kids but maybe 10 years old and above would be fine.

Wear comfortable walking shoes. This place is enormous and you can spend hours walking the grounds exploring the ruins before you even visit the museum on the grounds. The museum is nothing compared to what is outside like remains of aqueducts, cisterns and Roman auditoriums. We visited after the Roman Forum and Colluseum. It took us all day to visit these three places all right next to each other. I highly recommend a guided tour through the Forum and Colluseum because you learn so much more about what you are looking at and what period these things were built or excavated. The sights date back to 600 B.C. To the Renaissance.

Nice on a good day. We were fortunate enough to have good weather during our trip. We could have easily stayed for longer meandering along the various paths between the ruins.We cisited the site with our Roma passes. I would have given it a higher score if they procided you with a map with some basic information rather than us having to wonder around and spotting the few maps jotted around the site to set your bearings.It's amazing to think how old some of the srructure are. Well worth a visit if you have a few hours to spare on a day with good weather.
Pretty. Pretty but there is no need to buy a ticket! Just walk towards Piazza Venezia and you will be ableTo see the highlight for free!
photo experience. I enjoy taking photo's. Shot many great angles at this point of interest. July hot day great photo's...and a wine at the end of the day!!

Interesting, but best with a guide to bring it alive.. Large site, the real history of Rome lies here. Considerable amount to see but suspect the best gems need inside knowledge to uncover and see. Try to get a guide who can add civilisation contexts of the religions and tribes that shaped Rome. For RAM brethren, see the Porphyry stone columns either side of the entrance to the temple of Romulus, a sight to behold.

Amazing views. Leave yourself plenty of time for this as there really is a lot to see. Steeped in the ancient history of Rome including, in the price, the arch of Titus with its beautiful carvings. I would strongly advise flat shoes and avoid if you can't manage lots of steps or steep inclines. Unless your children are history buffs I would say this wasn't one for the little ones.

Ticket included in Colosseum tour.. WHEN (not if) you purchase a ticket for the Colosseum, you will also gain access to this attraction, but bare in mind that it closes around the same time, as I found out. However, I was able to climb a near by hill and experience it in its entirety.

Breathtaking!. We (young couple) happened to be in Rome last weekend when it was lovely and mild weather with the sun shining!It was so magical walking through here. You have to visit Palatine Hill when in Rome!

Amazing. I could have spent hours just wandering around here. It's incredible and you can almost hear the hustle and bustle of what it would have been like here when Rome was the centre of the world.
Watch your step though, an obvious thing to say but easily forgotten!

My best visit in Rome. Included in the same ticket with more famous Colosseum and Via Fori Imperiali, Palatino it's an informative trip back in time about the emperors staff real life. All of the Antic sites took 1 day!

what a fantastic place to visit - great history. this was one of best places visited - but you need a few hours and your feet will be sore. Take the tour. I would aslo recommend getting access to or visiting on web the reconstruction of the palatine or palace and you then understand what this fantastic building was actually used for. great.

Exquisite walks and history. The gardens and historical buildungs arw just exquisite.
The area is unfortunately not well preserved.
The history and buildings are amazing.
The area is a bit dirty and 2000 year old marble is being trampled on and parts are being stolen, even today. Such a pity!!
The way we were!. The oldest and most revealing space in Rome from a historical perspective. Must see. Does not take too much tme and is next to the colosseum.
a must to get an idea of Rome. Great to see the remains and the cradle of Rome. Also dont miss the museum to see the excavated artefacts.

Fascinating area with fewer crowds and great views. This area is easier to interpret than the Roman Forum below, particularly if you have guide that covers the outline of the place and it's buildings. The views down onto The Forum and across the city are splendid.Admission is included with that of the Colosseum and Roman Forum and it's well worth walking up the hill to reach. There's also a small museum inside the old palazzo that's free entry and worth visiting.I'd recommend the Palatine Hill as an escape from the hustle and bustle, in an historic setting
Interesting and Photo Friendly. We spent hours walking through the Forum and surrounding areas. It was one of the highlights of our week in Rome.
Amazing history. Try and get there early to beat the crowds. Great views and the museum and the chapel were lovely. Probably need at least 2-3 hours to see everything
Must see.. Joint ticket with the Collesoum which is handy. Lovely gardens and setting. Amazing views over Rome. The scale of the buildings and ruins are unbelievable. Museum was interesting too!
Ancient feeling. You must visit it, especially in sunny weather. Feel like time stopped and you back to ancient age... Breathe taking ruins and temples.

A must see for a great view, just wear comfy shoes!. Get a guide book if you are going here, I had a small DK one for the whole of Rome, so found I didn't always know what I was looking at. Still worth going for a beautiful, scenic walk with stunning views of the Forum.It's so hard to comprehend people actually lived here! Definitely one to check of your list if going to Rome.This features a few sets of stairs and hills, so may not be appropriate for those with mobility issues, however the Forum should be fine!

Impressive. Visited Sunday 31st January. Queued for less than 10 mins at 10:30 in the morning. We hadn't prebooked or been to the forum or colosseum already so once inside we bought tickets on the door. There was literally no queue at the ticket office, so ironically we got in faster than many who already had tickets, who were the overwhelming majority, as they had to queue for the "pre-booked" turnstile while we walked straight through after buying ours. Anyway, turn left out of the entry gate and it's a lovely gentle walk up the hill, seeing the magnification Roman structures as you pass. There's so much to see that you could spend all day, however after a while one dilapidated building is much like another. Other reviewers have said there's not enough info available. I disagree. I think it's pitched about right. The signs dotted around the place give just enough info to know what went on without getting you too bogged down in the detail. If there was a sign on every building you'd need several days to read them all. There are regular drinking fountains along the way, and once you've reached the top there are vending machines and toilets. The view from the gardens at the top is pretty spectacular. You can see the whole of the Roman Forum beneath you as well as the rest of Rome. Tip - since its the same entry ticket for Palatine Hill and the Roman Forum, start with the hill first. For one, the queues are a lot shorter, but also you get a nice gentle walk up the hill before a steeper descent into the Forum, rather than the other way around.

A Walk Back in Time. I read the book The Advocate prior to going to Rome and the story centers around ancient Rome in the Forum and Palatine Hill. Really blew me away the sheer scale of the whole setup. Closed kind of early I thought, it wasn't even dark yet. Not very crowded either. Highly recommend.
Large but not much in details. Personally, I'll skip this if i don't have time, maybe it is because i don't have much historian background for this place.

Amazing place!. What a wonderful piece of history. We had a guide take us through which made the experience that much better. To actually know what you're looking made everything that much more filled with experiences. Be careful to go during summer as it get's extremely busy.
Very interesting. If you are studying art history this is a fascinating place to visit. I don't have a particular interest in history but could it really interesting.
Get a private tour. I've been here twice, once on my own and once with a private tour by a registered tour guide. The tour is worth every penny you spend, as there's so much history to tell.
Untouched ancient Rome. Take a couple of hours to really explore here, a large site full of ancient monuments, relics, buildings and ruins to discover.

Do not Miss this!. I noticed that when a lot of tourists enter the Palatine Hill / Roman Forum complex they would go to the right (towards the Forum) - so I went left. I am so glad I did. There are some spectacular view of the city from up on the hill. The weather was perfect so I had a great view of St Peter's Dome. The view overlooking the forum from up high cannot be beat. And when you are done head down and see the forum up close.

A good place to experience the old Rome. A good place to spend few hours experiencing the old Rome. There are a lot of visiting points so need to read the map carefully. The site is very big so need to bring enough water and put enough sun-block~ :)

Caesar's Burial Place!. I had no idea what this place would be like. It came with the Colosseum so I stopped by to check it out.
WOW! The relics are massive and so is the hill. We took so many photos. The best part was seeing Caesar's grave. I had no idea he was buried there.

Worth a visit for the views of the Roman Forum and Circus Maximus!. Palatine Hill was part of our walking tour which also included the Roman Forum and Colosseum. I recommend the tour since you find out so much more information from the guide. Palatine Hill was where the palace was located. Fantastic views of the forum from the hill. Well worth a visit!!

The best bit of Rome. it has an entry fee but its worth it its what old Rome is about, don't get rolled up with the groups slow down fall back wander in different directions its a great big small place
Amazing place. Great place to get areal feel of ancient Rome, get pre paid tickets to avoid the long lines. Walk around the hill and the forum,it is amazing.

Explore Ancient Rome. Centermost of the Seven Hills of Rome and is one of the most ancient parts of the city. From the hill’s slopes view a panorama of the archaeological remains. Take your time to enjoy this extensive area!

A view of what much have been the reach of view of the early Romans. If you are a history buff, this is one of the musts of your visit to Rome, especially getting up on the less developed turfs of land there. Looking toward the Forum and Colosseum gives a glimpse of the majesty of Imperial Rome.

Following the Colosseum tour. Our guide from the Colosseum suggested we go to see Palantine Hill which is the grounds where the emperor lived. It is adjacent to the Colosseum and was part of the tour package. It wasn't quite as interesting as the Colosseum but we were very glad we saw that part of it while we were there. I would definitely recommend it if you are in Rome because you should see everything that you can while you are there!
Great!. The Palatine is an amazing massive complex that takes you down the history of Rome! We spent a good 2-3 hours walking through the ruins! A visit here is highly recommended!
You must not miss this.. Very extensive and an informative display. Be prepared to walk and allow a few hours for your visit.
Step into history. Though we've visited Rome many times before we made our first foray along this path this time. Some impressive views but each step is through the heart of ancient Rome

Incredible Historic Site. The Palantine Hill was one of our favorite places to visit. My husband and I spent hours walking through the ruins and discussing the architectural feats. The historic value of this preserved site was overwhelming. Imagining what Rome was like during ancient times was brought home being surrounded by the palaces over looking the Circus Maximus and the Colosseum. The marble remains gave a hint to the magnificence of the palaces.
The taste of ancient Rome. In this big complex, we can see the best part of ancient Rome, and go deeper into the history. A must see when in Rome
A Nice Walk. A nice walk up but you are better spent your time actually entering the forum or getting a view from the Capitoline Museums.

A you will need a day to view this site properly. A fantastic site full of details of the ancient Roman society, well the rich ones I guess! Some fantastic views over the surrounding ruins and the lower areas below the hills.

You can spend so much time here if you have it to spare.. We wished we could have spent more time after the guided tour, but wanted to fit as many places in as possible. If you have plenty of time, just take a picnic and enjoy at your leisure, so much to see and absorb!
brilliant. very good value for money, lots to see and read about the history. not suitable for people wearing heels

So much history!. A great place to walk around and explore. I would have loved to see it in all its glory. You could spend hours alone here just looking at everything, the place just oozes history, and it's right in the center of lots of other cool places.

More ruins. Didn't have much time to view since it was pouring rain. but it was so beautiful. It is partially restored which allows your imagination to run wild. What did it really look like? Even in the rain it was fantastic.

Phantom Palatine Hill.. Well spent ticket money at euro 12.00 by standing in the queue for a short time to visit two of the greatest architectural wonders. This is a showcase of the Rome standing right next to the Colosseum and the beauty is you can visit both Colosseum and Palatine Hill with one ticket in TWO consecutive days as there are so much to see. Once you are inside, you can imagine what a great place this could have been in ancient times as all was built in attention to detail and in tandem. Perfectly laid gardens, horse training yards, right next to the Circus Maximus, arched or porticoes to walking for dignitaries and also to have a good time with their loved ones. There are few chambers dedicated to loved ladies at that era.Scale of the size of these standing pillars are proof that in ancient times they thought for the longer future where in modern days it is so difficult to get an extension to an existing dwelling. Worship areas dedicated to sacred Gods and Divines together with how they regard water springs, fountains and waterways as their life blood in that times are remarkable. Must see historical highlights in the World.
I can't believe this is still here!!. It's pretty unbelievable to be able to stand in something with so much history, that is so old and is still standing!
It's a hill. Raised historical sight with good views into the Forum. Nice place to take a little break while walking through Rome.
A museum in the open. An open air historical site with lots to see. Took a tour so it was better explained on what was there and how things were then.

one of the Greatest open Museum. There is so much to see and observe. I would suggest to go with a walking guide as they would be able to tell you more on the stories and event and to know what I am actually looking at...Make sure the weather is fine! bring a bottle of water and wear comfy pair of walkers. Not a place to visit in a rush...but a must visit place for history and archeology lovers!Beautiful environment...let your imagination do the work on imagining how these places would have looked like centuries ago!! Magnificent!Its a walk to remember!!
great history, walk on Romes oldest streets. great place to see architechture, ruins, churches, oldest rodes in Roma, Arches where slaves passed through to build colosseum etc
Easy to visit. It feels like you were watching history in a movie but inside of it. I can only said you must see it to feel it.
Amazing. It is so lovely here, lots to look at, very interesting, beautiful gardens and ruins to wonder around, well worth a visit.
The greatest open air museum in the world. Walking here is always a surprise, you never get tired of visit this place, take your time and don't go here in a rush.
Stairs. We took a tour and the history of the area was so interesting. There are beautiful trees and be prepared to walk a lot of stairs.
Great historical site. Really enjoyed my visit here, great historical site with lots to see. The path ways are graded for ease of use which is great if you have limited mobility.

Link with a visit to the Forum.... This is a very large site with a number of quite long walks involved, so similar to the Forum leave yourself plenty of time to do this site justice. The museum was a little disappointing, but is still worth a quick visit. The ruins are beautiful but you will need a decent guide book or the audio tour to get the best from your visit. Buy a combined ticket (Palatine Hill, Forum and Colesseum) if you intend to visit all three sites during your stay.

Spectacular. The Palatine is part of the 3 sites included in a two day ticket and extends from the Forum. Lots of walking (wear good shoes, flip flops not allowed or sensible!). Worth the walk and some fascinating displays in the museum at the top of the hill.

When in Rome .... Visited the Palatine Hill and Roman Forum after visiting the Colosseum (all on one ticket costing €12ea) ... We had the same guide give us a brief intro to these two before leaving us to explore ourselves which was really useful to put it all in context. Some great views and insight to the history of the city.

Get the pass!. There's a pass offered at the entrance to the Palatine Hill (across from Colosseum) that includes entrance into the Palatine Hill and Colosseum. GET THIS. We zoomed past tourists who had been waiting hours in line. There's so many amazing things to see in Rome, why waste any time? This was cheap (about $20-25 per person) and we had an incredible time. Do your research ahead of time, download ebooks, or print out some details to bring with you instead of opting for an expensive tour guide. Remember, there's water fountains throughout Rome, so if you are buying a bottle of water, you're doing something wrong. This water is clean and fresh, and there are plenty of places to fill up at the Palatine Hill.

Mosty rubble, some good views. Like all the Roman attractions where private guides want your business, we found the maps and directional signs at this attraction to be confusing and inadequate. Some informational signs in English were helpful, but mostly what you are actually looking at are partial walls and columns and piles of rubble. Outdoor sights in Rome have been pretty much stripped of anything really good, you need to go to a secure museum or basilica to see much more than worthless remains and descriptions of memories. If you are into ancient history and have a vivid imagination, this area will appeal to you, but especially after Paris we found little here that was engaging. Nice outdoor walk away from traffic, and of course in winter not too crowded, so in that sense it was ok. We found a long ticket line at the colosseum but we were able to get a combination ticket for both attractions at the Palatine Hill gate in just 5 minutes. Got all the way up the hill on the adjacent road before realizing the entry was down the block from the ticket booth. Again, lack of good map

Beautiful . Absolutely beautiful. You feel the history surrounds you and it's a huge place so if you should set off a whole day for Palatine Hills, The Forum and The Colosseum. It's easy to spend time here.

Amazing place but you need a guide/audio guide. This was one of my favourite places in Rome which surprised me. That said, I was too late to get an audio guide and with only my Lonely Planet in hand, I was a bit stuck to understand all I saw. I think it would be well worth booking a tour to get the full experience. At only €12 entry for this site, Roman Forum and Colloseum you won't get better value.

Palatine. Only do this if you have a guide, to explain all the sites and history. You can get a guide at the Coliseum who will offer you both a tour of the Coliseum and Palatine Hill combo. That is what i did the first time. Since then I have not gone back. It is not a place you want to see over and over again.

Great Day out!. The Colosseum tickets get you into Palatine Hill and The Roman Forum. We were surprised at how big the complex is. Be prepared if you do all 3 in one day, which the ticket permits to allow the WHOLE day. Provides the most stunning views of Rome and so much serenity.
Interesting, loads to see in here. Great place to visit the ruins of Rome, very interesting, expect to spend some time in here. It's right smack in the middle and other big attractions are nearby.
Amazing place. Just an amazing place to walk, in footsteps of people so long ago, seeing the remains of buildings that once gleamed brightly and were actually used.
Explore Ancient Rome. Walking through the ruins and learning about Rome is a fantastic experience. One that's best enjoyed in the sun, but don't let the rain put you off!

wonderful. A great place for history buffs and architecture lovers.
Would recommend for anyone in the area to see and appreciate on a nice day (open to weather)

History Lesson. This is the tallest hill in Rome. When visiting the Colosseum this is a quick walk to see some of the ancient structures. You walk past an old acqueduct that was formerly used to carry water to the citizens that live on the hill. The hill overlooks the valley that was used for chariot races back in Ancient Rome, and is a great place to visit and tour as you check off your landmarks on your tour.
More than beautiful! . It is one of the most beautiful things in Rome. A time travel to see this wonderful civilization! I love it and every time I go to Rome I visit it!!!

Amazing. Don't miss this and the forum. Allowance a good few hours to walk and explore. This is beside the colluseum. And your tickets allows you entry to all 3 but queue for colluseum were over 2 hours long and it is not that impressive on the inside. Buy your ticket online to skip the queue. Dont miss the forum and palatine hill, they are beautiful.

Lovely place. My partner and I visited Palatine Hill as part of a combination ticket to enter the Colosseum and Roman Forum. It was definitely better than we expected! The Palatine Hill is one of the most ancient parts of Rome, and houses the remains of the residences of emperors including Augustus (House of Livia) and Tiberius, as well as the Flavian Palace, overlooking the Roman Forum. One of the standouts was the Palatine Stadium, which is a must-see. Visiting Palatine Hill without a guide is generally fine for those who don't speak Italian, as there were plaques everywhere in English, which provided historical information of the ruins.

A walk through time. Walking up this hill makes you feel you are strolling where citizens of old Rome walked seeing the old city pillars and buildings stood. At the top of the hill you find the church /chapel where once the early Romans worshiped. Take your time slowly up the hill and appreciate every step.

Stunning!. We were guided through the Palantine Hill by Richard from italywithus.com. It was a wonderful experience we will never forget. If I get back to Rome I will do it again for sure.What could look like a pile of old rocks, comes to life with the political intrigue, social life and scandals of the past. Richard is the consumate guide.

Very good. Takes the whole day to walk through the palatine hill and roman forum. I recommend you keep aside hole day. Also go in a guided tour. we did not have a guide and we could not really learn all of the history it is very beautifull. wear walking shoes some areas are slippery

Bring plenty of imagination. You will need a great imagination to visualise what these ruins used to look like. Our book (Rome: then and now) was some help but not a lot.
However, the views back down to the Forum and the Circus Maximus are worth the trip, especially as coming in here was on a combined Colosseum/Forum/Palatine ticket.
Fantastic. To visit this historic setting is just sooooo good. It is impossible not to be taken back in time and imagine the crowds and the royals etc. I encourage everyone to see this if you can.

Beautiful. My son and I visited Palatine Hill right after the Colosseum. There's information boards in Italian and English around the site, which is helpful. Amazing views of the Circus Maximus, the Forum and the Colosseum. We saw at least 3 water fountains and there are washrooms available. Easy to walk down and into the Forum. My son had a blast imagining what everything might have looked like in ancient times. It's part of the Colosseum ticket, don't skip it!

Great place to go. Really enjoyed our visit to this place. fascinating history combined with great views. well worth the admission mm it's own so the fact you get in to the forum as well is a real bonus

Must see and feel the Roman Empire!!!. There is a little museum in the hill and please don't miss it.You will spend 2+ hours here and Roman Forum. Must see!로마를 겉만 보고 갈 사람이 아니라면 여긴 꼭 가세요. 내부 박물관도 꼭 가시고(무료). 패키지나 일일투어로 사진만 찍고 가셨다면 제발 로마 제국 이야기는 핮 말아 주세요....콜로세움 내부와 여긴 무조건 봐야 합니다!!
Great site!. We had a great time exploring Palatine Hill. There are lots of little hidden gardens, statues and a museum tucked away right at the top of the hill.

two for one ticket. visited here a few years ago while on a wales versus italy 6 nations rugby tripthis is the part of the collseum ticket entry which i visited the day before the collseum. visit either of the two and the ticket gives you 48 hours to visit other sitegood sense of history could spend all day here a lot to see too numerous to mention here, not good for the infirm or wheelchair users i think, just acroos the road from the colesium again good bus links close to bars and cafe ect please be careful of the traffic when crossing the road and as it is crowded and busy please look after you wallets, handbag, phones ect

We could not get enough of this place.. We wished that we had planned more time to see this. It was beautiful, there was so much of it,it was so rich with history, it was fascinating and we could have stayed all day. You always see photos of places like this but being there was incredible as you can really experience the extent of what is going on. Rome should be very proud, they are saving this incredible place for all of us to experience. To be able to see what they have already exposed of these beautiful ruins and to get a peek into what they are still working on exposing was fascinating to us. Take your walking shoes and your camera and be ready for one beautiful sight after another!
Great views. This looks over the triumphant arch and the Colosseum. Plenty of columns, some being repaired. Part of an aqueduct is on view as are other stone features.

A grand ancient palace!. This was the former location of a grand Roman palace. I used Rick Steves' guided tour to receive a better experience and I learned a lot! It is definitely worth the trip. Buy the combination ticket that includes a timed entrance to the Coliseum, Palatine Hill, and the Roman Forum.
Very big, get a tour. Very very big, loads of history. Best to get a tour round it to help pull everything together and see everything.

Awesome views to the ruins. The Palatine hill offers stunning views of the ruins around it and the Foro Romano. Very impressive to think of how old everything in the area is. Lovely place to spend some hours walking. An absolute must see!
Beautiful ruins. I wish I'd had a whole afternoon to explore the ruins on Palatine Hill. The area is so vast, encompassing so many different buildings and temples.

a relaxation area. an area to be visited mainly because you can admire the beautiful view from the hill
It is very close to the Coliseum , Roman Forum

The best place to begin exploring this part of Rome. We spent many hours amazed by the sheer scale and extent of the ruins. All well signed posted and with lots of accessible information made the place come alive

Central Part of the History of Rome. Recommend doing this in a combination tour with a guide. We did our with Walks of Italy, which included the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. It was great! Well worth it! Plan for the whole morning or better part of the afternoon.

Save your breath and enjoy. A huge place and gets you tired of walking in a moment before you ending the visit. My girlfriend was almost giving up of walking until we found rabbits. You can find ver old ruins from the first century AC and a lot of panoramic views for amazing photos.

The part of Rome I knew nothing about. To be honest, I knew nothing about Palatine Hill when we arrived Rome - just that you could visit there when going to the Roman Forum and Colosseum. We had read that this was the best place to skip the long lines and buy our ticket for the other sites, and we wanted to start here and feel like we saw everything we could. I'm really glad we visited, and that this was our starting point.First, we didn't wait at all to buy tickets or get inside - so it was way better than starting at the Colosseum. And it was older. I felt like the stories here paid the foundation for the Roman Forum and Colosseum to come. Looking out over the Circus Maximus, and walking the grounds of the original Palace and trying to understand the life and people that were here even before that was eye opening. There is good information in the museum here which helped me understand the landscape better. Really glad we visited and started here. Spent about 1.5-2 hours before moving on to the Roman Forum. Note: Besides the museum, there isn't many signs or explanations. We had some information from a guide book on my phone to help orient us and give us information to better appreciate the site. I recommend doing the same, as there are no informative brochures available at this site (or, as it seems, most sites in Italy).

Simply amazing, a true history lesson.. For those who like history and particularly the ancient Roman history, this is the place to go.The roman forum it was the center of the ancient Roman Empire, and it’s amazing how those ruins survived until today.It is an amazing feeling to admire the arch of Septimius Severus, or to have a privileged view of the coliseum.I truly recommend if you go to Rome, to visit the roman forum, despite the ruins, its majestic, awesome and an impressive place, part of the history of the humanity.

Day and night . Loved it during the day with the blue sky back drop. Loved it at night with the illuminations.Beautiful area of Rome. Well worth a visit. I'm not the biggest history buff but even I can appreciate what Rome has to offer

Most Amasing. One of the best parts of my trip. I loved it tha palace tha gardens, the view. It was mesmerizing. You can see the colosseo the Foro Romanum the Arch. You gaze at an ancient city inside of the modern city of Rome. Beautiful. Reccomended

Impressive must see. The Palatine was the site of the imperial palaces of the Julio-Claudian emperors. While the ruins are not in the best shape, the small museum contains some priceless treasures. The gardens also give a great view of the Roman Forum with excellent picture opportunities. One entry price covers the Palatine, Forum and Colosseum; so well worth a visit. The Palatine entry gate us less well known than that of the Forum or Colosseum; so the best spot to "jump the line" without paying the usual premium. Buy a good travel book to Rome, which provides a map and overview of Rome's ancient ruins and save on the guide. The ruins are well sign posted.

The beating heart of ancient Rome. if you get a chance to get an over view, after visiting by foot all the ancient center of Rome, you will find it so inspiring and exciting to get a whole view of the Palatine Hill. I had the pleasure of getting a great view from a point right above Circo Massimo. it is the most ancient place in Rome I think. really magical.for ancient times lovers, I believe seeing it will be very meaningful. in one minute you go far back in time, and really feel it. while in the back of your mind you feel serenity... just wonderful.

What a view. The views from Palatine Hill were amazing, we took hundreds of pictures. If you don't have a guide, it will be difficult to know what you are looking at. We took a tour with a company outside of the Colosseum that included Palatine Hill, and we learned a lot that way.
The start of rome. It is a very important place,because from there Rome started to being built.special view of the city from above.
Beautiful landscapes. From the tom of Palatine Hill you can see the whole Rome, good spot, very close to Colosseum and Roman Forum.

Perfect Saturday Morning Stroll. Woke up early, a good cappuccino and walking shoes and off I went. Meandering through the ruins, taking time and taking pictures it was a wonderful start to the weekend.
must visit. very historical place you can loose your self with history ,i recomend for everyone especialy at nigth with ligths

Palatine & Forum are one attraction. Beautiful place and a much better place to get your ticket for the '3 attractions' The Palatine, Forum & Colloseum. However me and my partner were frustrated with the ticket. The entry makes out that the 3 locations are seperate however The Palatine and Forum are counted as one attraction. We visited The Palatine then left to go to The Colloseum as we were concerned about time. When we went back to the Forum our ticket was refused. Very annoying!!!

Residential Rome. If the Forum is the business end of Ancient Rome the Palantine, (or Palace), is the residential side, at least for the wealthy. It is still being archeologically excavated, and requires a little climbing but is well worth the effort.

Walking in the footsteps of Ancient Rome. Right across from the Colosseum, you can see the top of Palatine Hill where the rich and famous of ancient Rome lived and played. It's a huge area and you will definitely not be able to see it all in one afternoon. The signage isn't great and you will probably end up wandering aimlessly (same goes for the forum), but it is still a place that everyone should go.
Love it; great vistas and history. Enjoyable place to walk around and soak it all in. Tour ticket to coliseum usually includes entry here.

Breathless experience. The popular place where the ancient romans gathered together after the winned battles. The ticket from the Coliseum includes the Palatine as well. We recomend to dedicate an entire day to visit it, or at least arrive before 12:00 because they close at 15:30 hrs.

Awesome to see!. I followed the advice from other on TA to start your visit to Palatine Hill, Roman Forum and Colosseum at PH because the lines are shorter. If you buy your ticket online, you spend 2 euro to avoid waiting in line but here there was no line here so I save my money which is a win in my book. Anyways, I wish i had gotten the audio guide. I'm not sure if you get it at the ticket desk or what but I definitely saw people with them. Plus there are signs that help you follow along.In my opinion, I think the people that are leaving negative reviews for this attraction as well as others is that they find it boring or not what they pictured. If you have no idea what you're looking at, ground with bits of remaining buildings, sculptures and temples could be disappointing. You have to use your imagination. These landmarks were very important parts of Roman lives and society. Walking the same places as Roman dignitaries blows my mind. Open your eyes to your imagination and enjoy! Tips: Bring a water bottle to fill up. The fountains have very drinkable water. Also, the stoney paths can be difficult to walk on. Please wear sensible shoes!

A lot to see but don't know what things are. Without a tour guide I feel like this place can be super confusing. A lot of ruins and no labels makes one walk around wondering what things are or could be. A map of some kind would be very helpful in helping to make the experience more enjoyable.

don't miss this. I had been to Rome 3 times before and never bothered to go in. My mind was blown!!! WAY better than the Colisseum!!! try to go as early as possible!! it's usually crowded but if you go as soon as they open, it's EMPTY!!! read about it beforehand or get a audioguide so you know what you're looking at. makes a huge difference.

See how the rich and Roman lived. Wear comfy shoes and sunscreen. Bone up before you go because there's so much interesting history here, it's hard to get your mind around it. We downloaded Rick Steve's helpful audio guide on our smartphones and listened as were wandered about the site.
Historic Rome. So many historical buildings a huge place full of old architecture. just loved it.. you must visit it.

Interesting but not spectacular. If you're visiting the colosseum, palatine hill and the forum together then this is honestly the least interesting part of the trip. Lots of ruins, but nothing to go into or explore, maybe it was the time of year and it was too hot, but felt the time spent would be better used somwhere else....

You cannot visit Rome without visiting the Palentine Hills!. Right next to the Colusseum are the Pallentine Hills,- the remains (remains but still pretty impressive) of once magnificent Rome. Columns and arches and pillars and structures. The remains of the Temple of the Vestal Virgins, where Julius Ceasar was murdered, the remains of the path illustrated in scenes from the movie Gladiator. Need I say more?
Next to the Forum. Palatine Hill is next to and west of the forum. there is no additional fee to get in, because it is part of the forum. It has nice scenic overviews.

Historic Rome. Palantine Hill is for me a great companion in terms of architecture, history and culture when paired with the Roman Forum, to be able to walk around an ancient and observe the intricate detail and effort that went into one of histories more notable sites is wonderful. A great place to visit and make sure you take your camera for those all important shots of a charming site of Roman history and building magnificence.
nothing impressive. we had to walk up to the hill and roman forum after visiting colossseum. There was a small Palatine museum but we went in there and out within 5 mins.
Great piece of history. Fantastic views on the city. Definitely worth a visit.Make sure to buy the tickets online prior to the visit, otherwise you will spend long time in line.
Just great to walk with history. The day we went was a beautiful clear blue sky day, temperature just right for walking (none of which we had control over but we picked a good day to go).

So much to see!. It was extremely hot the day we visited. Be sure to take a water bottle and drink up at all the free fountains. None of us had any problems drinking from the public fountains. I used an umbrella to help keep the sun off and it worked well to keep me cooler. Tennis or hiking shoes recommended. Road and streets with cobble stones are too uneven for sandals or open-toed footwear. Be prepared to do some "well-worth it" walking to really enjoy this wonderful site.

Worth it for the view alone!. We visited Palatine Hill and the Roman Forum as part of a Segway Tour (amazing as I imagine your feet would be aching by the end of the day as there is so much to see!) The trip up the hill is worth it for the views at the top right over the Forum to the Colosseum. Some tours do audio guides so you can find out a bit about what you are looking at! Beautiful on a evening in Roma!
Amazing insight. Fantastic place to go and see some proper Roman history and imagine the llifestyle they lived. Amazing history along with lovely walks between the areas of interest

Get ready for a walk. You`re going to need all day for this area of Rome. Walking the entire area can be accomplished but you`ll want to have a couple of bottles of water and take advantage of benches and fountains when afforded the opportunity. That out of the way you`ll be amazed at the extent old world Rome had going on. It actually appears that this entire hill is sitting atop remnants of buildings and aqueducts, the sheer size is completely astounding. There are beautiful views and amazing architecture and it`s all in a very overwhelming to try and see it all, so go prepared.

Fantastic view over the antic Rome. Tickets for entry is the same as for the Forum and the Colosseo (13€ for the lot), so make sure you don't miss it.We expected to spend max 1h there, but we quickly found ourselves walking slowly between the ruins on the hill, admiring the views over Rome, Vatican in the far, Circus Maximus, the Forum just below... Basically, we've spent probably 3 hours there (until it was closing!) without seeing the time flying!A nice museum is on the hill as well. Really worth spending 15-20mins.By good weather, the view on sunset over Rome is beautiful.I you like nice walks and ruins, this is one must-do attraction!!

Together in Rome tour. Palatine hill is very interesting as it was part of the coliseum tour. Our guide, Ava was knowledgable and enjoyed what she was doing. She had a good pace and did her best to take us back into history. There were plenty of facts she told us and it was a great experience.

Travel back in time and walk through ancient Rome.. Booked a guided tour with VIATOR which combined Colosseum tour and it was the best move we made. Guide was superb and 4 hour trip was worth every penny.
Great Views of Rome. You cannot visit the Forum and Coliseum without adding this onto your trip. A gentle walk uphill will allow you some insight into what Rome looked like in bygone days.

incredible! my favourite!. could be overshadowed easily as you have to pass through a very arrow street to get here! once passed, the view is amazing! i was blown away by the sheer size of the historical artifacts, and how much history is packed into such a space!
Vacation. Absolutely amazing!! We made this a joint tour that was attached to the Calloseum underground and also Ancient Rome package. It was cheaper doing so. Tons of History a must do in Rome.
beautiful views. A long walk to the top but well worth the view from the hill ...a museum was up there as well...lots to see

Overgrown. Acres of history but a lot of it appears overgrown and neglected.
The views from the gardens could be spectacular if better maintained.
Good View. Beautiful view, there's a lot of birds that don't afraid of human. You can enjoy the view for few hours.
Worth a trip!. Spend one of your days in Roma walking through the Palatine Hill. The views are amazing and the history is incredible.
One of the Cradles of Western Civilization.. Involves a lot of walking but well worth it. We spent six hours going through Palatine Hill and the forum and just barely scratched the surface.

Rich Roman History lie here!. Must watch & you get the best view of the city and also the Roman architecture. Visit on first Sunday of the month and it is free! Give it at least and hour and there are 3 exits so plan accordingly which one to take.

Highlight of the trip for me. We went on the first Sunday of the month which was free in. I really loved walking around and trying to imagine what it was like to live there. There is an area with a beautiful view over Rome.

Ruins seen from the streets. One of roman's sights you can see for free, isn't crowded and isn't completely shut on a bank holiday. Of course there is more to see if the doorsare open and you pay to enter through the ruins. But much can be seen from the streets you walk by (ie. Minerva's temple).

A view of an old city. This is one of those sites that you need to allow at least 3 hours to soak all the atmosphere in. We went in without a tour. (The accents of the tour guides grate on you after a while. Hint; they are not European)
Just visualising how the Romans lived and the culture they developed over the centuries was amazing.

Worth the walk. As you enter the Palantine Hill you find nature mingling with the majestic ruins. The views from the top was amazing, it is worth walking to the top. We found orange trees full of ripe oranges all over the place. As any other place of historical importance it is advisable that we read and research a bit before visiting that helps us understand the place a lot better.

Use a tour guide. There is SO much history and things to see that I would recommend using a tour guide for the Forum and Palatine Hill. They can move you thru the area in an orderly fashion and give you a little background on what you're looking at. Otherwise, it's just a bunch of ruins and rubble with no context. Also, when lines are long a tour guide is useful to zip you to the front and in without wasting any time in the queue.

Very impressive ensemble of historical buildings and ruines. Unique place to visit - recommended to visit before Collosseum as the combined ticket is valid for both attractions and the line at ticket counter at Palatine is usually shorter

First place to see in Rome..... This is where Rome came into being....there is so much to see and understand about the beginnings of the city...you really need to spend as much time as you can, by far the most interesting place to visit.....
Historic Rome. Fabulous place to visit to get a feeling for what the ancient Rome might have been like. Great place to sit and relax, and great views over the Forum Romanum

Good Value Visit. Ticket to Coliseum, Roman Forum and Palatine Hill is a bargain and can be used over two consecutive days, so absolutely well worth doing. Good information signs and great views. Has to be done!
Great views. Palatine Hill has great views of the Ancient Roman sights and has lots of history to walk around. Audio guide was really helpful.

Nice place. Visited here after our Forum visit. Quite nice to walk around up here. Many more opportunities for shade than down in the Forum. A pleasant experience. I recommend not skipping when you do the forum.

If you're going to do the colosseum pair it with this. Provides a nice view of the forum. We had a guide that was interesting and informative. I would recommend doing this as it provides some sense of scale to everything.
Covers an enormous area. Incredible history, just a shame there are no plaques to explain what your looking at and I feel with the sheer numbers of visitors the municipality could do far more.

Take Time. The ticket for the Colosseum, Forum and Palatine Hill are 2 day combination tickets when purchased directly at the locations. I wish we had spent more time here enjoying the walk and using an audio guide. We had a guide book to read (which was fine) and the signs in the park are informative, as well. The views on a clear day are spectacular. Next time we will go to the museum. Spending two full days is well worth the price of admission, even without a tour guide, it is doable if you have a good tour book, map and some advance reading.

The nucleus of European culture. One of those places where you need to be to understand how the european culture grew. There started the Imperium Romanum... I won't write anything else you need to visit this place :)

Stunning site, really interesting. I thought this site was incredible, much more interesting than the Colosseum. I takes a good 2 hours to walk round and would be worthwhile to take a guided tour. We didn't, but I think you would get more out of the visit if you did. We received a top tip and that was to buy a ticket for Palatine Hill first. The same ticket gets you into both here and the Colosseum. We visited Palatine Hill first in the morning and waited 15 mins for a ticket. When we went back the Colosseum the ticket queues were taking 3 hours. We walked past them all and were inside within 5 minutes.
Less crowded than colosseum. Very pleasant after the crush of the Colosseum. Take the time to walk right to the back of the site.

Another great day in Rome. Endless history in one location. Just so much to take in. It's absolutely overwhelming to see so much at every turn. History buffs there is so much to see you need more than a day. I bet if you go thru the area a second or third day you would find things you did not see previously. Had a lot fun. Great to do it in December when it was cool. If you did not buy tickets ahead of time, skip the long tour lines and go to the left, buy your ticket and enter right away.
Rome musts. If you are into history, I would definitely visit the Palatine Hill and the Coliseum. You will bypass the long lines at both sites with a guide and get great insight.

Best View of Ancient Rome. You can't really get a sense for the Roman forum when you're standing in it. Definitely make the trek to the top of Palatine Hill. It's worth it even if you're not interested in the ancient Roman city. The view all around is spectacular. Great gardens at the top. Beautiful old structures and just a lovely setting. Worth the visit!

Give Yourself Plenty of Time!. I recommend the combo ticket for Palatine Hill, the Roman Forum and the Colosseum. Get the combo ticket at the Palatine Hill as close to 8 am as you can - no ticket lines! This is a spacious area to tour. If you like to tarry and actually read the posted info signs, or if you want to visit the museum onsite, then give yourself 2-3 hours. With only an hour, its a rush. For 10 euro, you can get a guidebook in English that covers the Palatine, the Roman Forum and the Colosseum in the gift shop on Palatine Hill. You can read up while waiting in the security line for the Colosseum! That said, the informational signs posted around the Hill have plenty of information too...and in English.
Soaked in history. Nice to walk around. Good views over the forum and nice spacious greenery. Lots of history and lots to take in. Can be busy but everyone gets spread out, so doesn't feel like it.

Our favorite site in Rome!. After the Colosseum, we headed over to Palatine Hill. The price of admission was included with the Colosseum. We didnt know what to expect, our guide book said it was a must see. Thank goodness we listened. This spot was my most memorable from our trip around Europe. It takes a bit of a walk upstairs to get up on top of the hill but it is so worth it. The sweeping views of Rome were breath taking and the view below onto the Roman Forum was amazing. The grounds were so peaceful and beautiful, even in winter. You can see why this place was the home of Romes most influential. When walking around I had a feeling come over me, I could feel something here, I cant explain it but i will never forget it. Make sure to visit the museum up top it is worth it, really cool history of the Hill, and its included in your ticket. This is must see and don't miss it, after you finish your walk around Palatine Hill, head down and walk through the Forum....another must see!

fantastic place to visit. If you like history and the ancient world this is a must. You can picture how the ancient people used to live and even see the marks in the cobble of where the carts used to drive over and have been worn. If you are looking for a great weekend Rome is a must fantastic sights to see.

Ancient Rome at its finest. Make sure that you stop here in conjunction with your Colosseum trip, this is too close and too good to be missed. Walking among the buildings and temples of ancient Rome is just too amazing. Any one item here would be given a dedicated room in any other museum, here there are acres of artifacts to pore over.Gives you a feel of what the ancient capital was like.

Do provide plenty of time. Unfortunately only had 1 hour to visit, but really could easil have spent the whole morning. Really nice location overlooking Rome, and quite impressive how organised this area was in Roman times.

Stunning View of Ancient Rome.. For me, this place is the essenesce of Rome! It takes you back thousands of years in a time and place we know nothing of or about except what we read. I loved the architecture and the details. Its simply amazing.

Best pictures from elevated position.. OK, we did not meet Pulo or any other members of the HBO series Rome, but it had a real feel of what the geography and topography of the ancient rome must have felt like. The walk is a bit tiring for an out of shape 66 year old, but the views and picture opportunities were well worth it. The combined Forum and palatine tickets can be purchased right at the gate and are reasonably cheap.

Must see ruins in Rome. This site is a fantastic representation of ancient Rome with old streets and remnants of palaces. Try to book this with a walking tour or have an archaeologist lead you through - it's very intriguing and enlightening to see the various sites within the complex.

Include this as part of Colosseum, Roman Forum tour. Palatine hill is nice, but it felt like the precursor to the Roman Forum which is a must see. I would lump these two together with the Colosseum for a good half day or more excursion.

Breathtakingly good. The whole Rome tourist attraction is great. It the only place in he world that I was happy and not embarrassed to be a tourist. We took a bus tour which you can book for 24 hours which enables you to get off and see the sites before jumping onto another bus and going to another attraction. Palatine Hill is a must see.

Better with a Guide- Plan to be around Dusk.. I've been to Palatine Hill with a guide, and this last trip my husband and I went by ourselves. I didn't learn as much on this trip, but it was still quite interesting. And it was absolutely gorgeous at dusk....I mean magical.

A must visit for all history buffs!. If you're going to the Colosseum, this would be included in the ticket as well. You'll have to walk up a little to see the attraction. I went there without a guide but I would recommend you to get one so that you can understand and learn a little more about the area. There are several breathtaking ruins to see and is definitely a must see for those who are interested in the history of the Roman empire.
Simply Amazing. It's amazing to see how people lived 2000 years ago are so similar to how we live today. The only thing missing back then is Face Book....

History at it's BEST!. We toured this area with Renetta from Italy Wonders, Colosseum and Vatican Tours and I am so happy we did. She gave us so much history of Palatine Hill, The Roman Forum and The Colosseum that it completely changed the success of our vacation. Don't consider visiting Roman without a guided tour of this area. There is just too much to learn and you will miss out. Renatta knows how to give good info without being overwhelming and I am quite certain she could go into greater detail with a more advanced group. It was the best part of our vacation.

Nice piece of history. Fun, though massive, a lot of walking, start here and make your way to the colosseum which is very close by, one ticket can be used for the Roman forum, here and the colosseum and it cost 12 euro.

Amazing. Must stop and walk around in the bottom not just the top. The columns are so tall and the arches are so tall it's hard to believe this was built so long ago. Very incredible to see and walk in ancient Roman times.

included in the colosseum. this is all included in the ticket price to the colosseum. long walk to see everything. and its little walk up the hill to see this attraction. we had a tour guide which was useful and recommended.
Great views . Lot's of walking and uneven ground so if your not good on your feet probably not for you. But great sites and and buildings to explore!
So much to see. So much history, so much to see. I'd recommend a guided tour so that you can understand what the buildings are and learn a little more about the whole area.

It was OK. We did not go into the museum though. But it was one of the few places in the forum that had a bathroom. Many of the workers at the forum did not speak English and the one that did guided us up to Palantine Hill. Much was closed off for archaeological reasons. We could see great views of the Forum but it is hard to tell where the forum ends and where Palantine hill begins. We thought we could see Circus Maximus from there but we could not. If you want to see it, you need to leave it and walk on the streets.

King of Rome's Seven Hills. Rome was built on seven hills. The Palatine Hill is the tallest and most central of the hills The hill is now an outdoor museum. Here, Romulus and Remus were suckled by a she wolf. The verdict on the claim that the she wolf's lair had been discovered is regarded by experts as unlikely. Still, it's a popular spot andx many visitors visit the hill.
Spectacular views!. We took a tour of Palatine Hill, the Roman Forum, and the Colosseum. Palatine Hill was my favorite part due to the view and all the trees!

Wow. The place is huge, so be prepared to walk a lot. You breath history at every piece of stone you see - everything is impressive. The only thing I would suggest is to have more signs with explanations of what you are seeing so you don't have to carry a paper guide with you all the time.
Palatine Hill. For those who are interested in the history of Roman empire is the visit of Palatine Hill a must. There are several sites and although in ruins it is still breathtaking to see it all!
City Break Rome. It is interesting to see all the history. It is like a history movie and the tourists are the main characters.
Beautiful Vew. When you walk to the top you have an amazing view of the forum and beyond. You get a sense of the levels of the city and how many layers are underneath the city.

Extremely large. The space is much larger than I expected. It is combined with the Roman Forum. I was not as impressed with the hill as I was with the Coliseum or the Roman Forum. The view, however, is spectacular. I could imagine standing there 2000 years ago surveying in valley all around. Get your combo ticket here rather than at the Coliseum; the line is much shorter. Plan to spend about 3 hours wandering the grounds. Adult tickets are 12€, kids are free.
So much history. We did a tour and it is a lot of walking but so worth it. There is so much history and it is very cool to see. A tour guide is a must. And possibly an umbrella in the hot months...

Views Galore!. Don't miss this as you'll get some of your best pictures and views here of the colloseum and the forum! The walk itself is lo lovely and the gardens are gorgeous.
Maybe could do with more info signs but apart from that I had no issue!
Spent so much time there!. loved the palatino, it was amazing so many great sights, but the real victory is the great photo ops and chill environment.
Wonderful. A wonderful journey through history. I recommend getting a guide to complete the experience. A memorable experience.

More interesting historically than the Colosseum. Following our Colosseum visit just across is Palatine Hill.Initially I thought it might be a just another historical place, but I did find it covered a lot of the various historical elements of Rome in its heyday. Some good views of Rome at the top and plenty to hold your interest of various aspects of the site. We spent about an hour and a half as we were also slightly tired after the Colosseum tour. Booking tickets in advance saves waiting in the the queues. To sum up this does compliment a visit of interest along with the Colosseum.

Very first thing you have to visit. I would say this is the nicest spot in the whole Rome. Accessible from different sides, amount of history that can easily take you whole day. You can pay to enter it, but you don't have to as you see more or less all the same stuff even without it, and can take some very nice walks around.
Visit the Heart of Rome. This is the way to start your visit of Roma. Walk the paths of the earliest Rome founders and savor the history. Wonderful views of the city.GO!

Impressive. I very much enjoyed PalatineHill because of the guide. We had a wondrefull explicit guided tour for the Colosseum and Palatine Hill. At first i was to tired after the Colosseum and wanted to skip this part,but i am so happy that i haven't. It is in some sort much more interesting that the Coloseum per say. The history overwhelmes anyone who dares to step up the hill.The views are amaysing and they make you feel quite small...

Almost a panoramic view. The hill is located overviewing the Roman forum which is really amazing. I suggest you buy tickets for the Roman forum and Collessum together from there so you could avoid the colloseum que
Interesting but challenging on a hot day.. We were with an organised tour booked through Viator. Its the only way to go if you want to skip the lines!

Great place to transport you back to the old Roman days. We did not have a lot of time but we spent a couple of hours here and we're glad we did! Its probably one of the best historical places in Rome that give you that authentic "feel" and historical vibe, a place very rich with artifacts, a nice museum with interactive videos, plus much more.If you have at least a couple of days in Rome and trying to decide what to prioritize, this should be towards the top of your list, maybe even in front of the more famous Colosseum. Last but not least, the Palatine Hill offers some very peaceful walks in a very green setting, right in the midst of Rome!

So much culture. Breathtaking
Too much to take in and can only imagine what this beautiful city must of looked like back in its day. To see some of the original buildings lay bare or barely standing still. Love Rome

Excellent and easily overlooked!!. We took a stroll through this area, which was fairly quiet and loved the amount of ruins and bits and pieces, thousands of years old, just strewn around. Live history !!
Great site. Buy the headphones and wear substantial shoes very interesting it takes 2-3 hrs so take a packed lunch

Very Nice view even from Outside with segway tour. We stopped on top of the Hill to admire the Palatine and it was indeed impressive. I was lucky not walking all around but looking from Outside with my segway group. Do not miss this place filled with history.

Highlight of my visit. Came here in December expecting great things and it didnt disappoint. Felt like walking in the footsteps of history, was completely awe inspiring, particularly the remains of the Imperial Palace, which leaves you thinking what it would have been like in its heyday. Visiting in December meant there was very few crowds and we could go round with ease, took far longer than we imagined simply because it was so good. Give yourself PLENTY of time for this but its a must visit!

Nice place to go. You can take awesome pictures there, after the colosseum, it is a must go attraction in Rome if you like ruins and history, the audio guide is good if you have a full day to explore the place. You can buy a ticket for the Colosseum and Palatine Hill that can be used for two consecutive days.

An unbelievable view of ancient Rome. Try to avoid the heat of the day if it's summer, as there is only one tiny air-conditioned museum in this huge attraction. Not suitable for people who have any issues with mobility.

Enchanting. As a historian, the Palantine Hill is one of the most enchanting sight in all of Rome, it is peaceful and full of history. You are sure to spend half a day here, that is including the Roman Forum. This is an absolute must in Rome. Certainly when you realize what has happend here in the last 2500 years. Absolutely amazing.

Wear walking shoes!. Wear walking shoes! When you buy a ticket to the Colosseum, it includes entry to Palatine hill and the Roman forum (which are both at the same place). I would suggest doing the hill first, great views of the forum below and if you get tired or your feet start hurting, at least you saw it all from above before you decide to call it a day.

Nice to know. This place is incredible because you can see nice descriptions in each place... You have a lot of police and you feel safe . Lot of people but well organised. It something that you see at least once.

Fascinating. It was a wonderful experience walking about the Palatine Hills and soaking in the historical atmosphere that still feels authentic and well preserved. Definitely worth prioritising out of the 3 connected attractions (Colosseum, Palatine Hills, Roman Forum) in the area if you prefer a peaceful walk in the greenery as opposed to architecture/history.

A Walk Back In Time .... At first glance in a guide book, Palatine Hill might not seem all that exciting. However, after visiting, to walk among where those walked 2000 years ago and see what had been built at that time was surprisingly memorable. The further we walked into the grounds, the better and more remove the ruins became. Tip, buy the tickets for the Colosseo at Forum/Hill and skip the long lines for the former.

The lives of the rich and famous. After all our walking, I wasn't sure that I could make another climb but here in front of us was the Palatine Hill. The ancient city of Rome is surrounded by Seven Hills and the Palatine Hill is the centermost hill. Recent excavations show that people have lived there since about 1000 BC. Many of the early rulers of Rome built their temples and homes on this hill. Over the centuries, the buildings have crumbled but are currently being restored to their original condition. I felt as though we had entered a time warp and had awakened in this ancient civilization. It is incredible that so much of this history is standing after all these many years. Our tour guide is also an archeologist and explained the difficult choices between leaving the current ruins standing or continuing to dig further down to uncover even older ruins.As you climb higher up the hill, there are park-like areas with shade trees and gardens. Audio tours are available for the Palatine and the Forum. You will need them (or a tour guide) to appreciate the history of these old churches, temples, etc. and the rulers who lived here.

Wonderful place. When doing the Roman Forum, you will have a stroll through the Palatine Hill... Wonderful place and great to see. Spend some time here looking at the architecture as it is amazing for the age.... Definitely do as part of a tour as you will also get an incite to the history of the place...
Rome. Another place in Rome hard to miss, and must visit. Puck a century, and imagining yourself there, open your eyes, and you will be there!

Palatine Hill Visit 20151205. Toured Palatine Hill with City Wonders-Dark Rome tours as part of Colosseum & Forum tour. Beautiful ancient area. Prepare for lots of walking but very well worth the effort. Once in a lifetime experience.
Great historical site. Some well preserved ancient Roman houses, building and temples give you an idea how life was back then

A great day out, set aside at least 2 hours for this and the Roman forum. A great day out, set aside at least 2 hours for this and the Roman forum (both in the same complex). One ticket gets you access to this, the forum and the Colosseum
Imagining Rome as it was. From this hill, you can look out at the old ruins of the Roman forum , arch, temples, etc. Use your imagination for a moment and it can take you back 2000 years.
Huge area. It is the old palace of the emperors. Ticket is 12 euros with admission to the Colosseum and the Roman Forum as well.
Magical you can't go to Rome and miss this. You just have to go, you can't not feel the history and the magic of this place a must in Rome above all

Taking a step back through history. There is no better way to look through the history of the Roman Empire than to take a walk through Palatine Hill. You can spend a few good hours looking at the old temples including the place where Julius Cesar body was. Definitely something that you have to do while in Rome!

A trip though history. We visited the Palantine Hill after the Colluseum as included in the ticket price. There is aa good view of the Forum and Colloseum and the site of the Circus Maximus. Well worth a visit take in the atmosphere, walk in the footsteps of Rome's ancient elite.

Make sure you have a guide with you. We did this on a guided tour, and I am so glad that I had a guide...otherwise I would have NO clue what anything was... Most of this is laying in ruins with pieces here and there of what were once buildings. It was very interesting to hear the history and see pictures (the guide) had of what these things were supposed to look like. So by all means, go and see this...just make sure you have a guide or a map...something to to explain what it is you are seeing!

stunning and quiet in December. Palatine hill made the ticket to the colluseo worth it. You can explore in your own time, sit on one of the many benches and take in the view. There is so much to see here, we were looking around for 2 hours.

Fantastic View of the City. Palatine Hill gives you an amazing view of Rome. Situated across the road from the Colosseum and above the Roman Forum, I highly suggest that you book a tour that covers all three.
Tour Guide was amazing. We booked with City Wonders for the Underground Colosseum, Palatine Hills & Roman Forum, best guided tour we have ever been on

Peaceful and historic. I really enjoyed my visit to Palatino, it was my favourite place in Rome. It was peaceful and quiet, the views were amazing and you felt immersed in the history of Rome.Highly recommended.
Stunning!. Allow plenty of tie as this is a big area to cover. Not much shade so wear sunscreen and take water with you. The history here is mindblowing!
Must see. This is required viewing on any trip to Rome. Not much left of Augustus' or Nero's home, but this was the center of the universe for several hundred years.

Wonderful place but awful information shortage. Great buildings going back 2000 years but absolutely useless information on site you need to buy s book before you go in but go in you must. The history is just amazing.

Love This Tour. We took the Gray Line Tour of Palatine Hill and really enjoyed our tour guide as well as the sites. Rome has so much history it is sometimes hard to take it all in. Thankfully our guide was working on her PHD and was wonderful in explaining everything in layman's terms. Great tour and beautiful site.

Lovely walk and worth a look. We had a fast track entry included on our Roma card so we went straight to the front of the queue. Lovely views across the city...quite steep in places. Few vending machines dotted around for drinks and snacks. Spent around 2 hours here but could have spent longer

Part of Colosseum/Forum Ticket.. Entrance is part of the Colosseum and Forum ticket. It does have an interesting museum with an architectural model that gives you a better idea of the impact of the palace and other buildings. Most of the area is complete ruins or foundations but it was interesting. Without a map, you don't know where or what you are seeing...we had Rick Steves' book open and it was still not clear. Guess we entered at the wrong place.
found by chance worth it. found this by chance and what a great find was a sunny day so we had chance to have a good look and took wonderful photos
Rome city break. As most people say it is mostly ruins but you use your imagination and think what it was really like. Still a fascinating insight into how they lived. still worth the visit,
A must see. A must see relic of Roman architecture.Here is where so much history was born. There is some re-construction work going on, but can avoid it easily and view the wonders of the age.

Drink in the history!. Palatine Hill is simply an opportunity to take a walk back through history and imagine how the Romans lived thousands of years ago. We loved spending time exploring this entire complex. Be sure to take good walking shoes, but be prepared to just saunter, as well, so the years displayed can sink into your spirit!

Need a good imagination but if you got one the it's great!. Like my title says if you have a imagination then you will be fine and you'll enjoy the experience.Easy to find and your ticket is cheap and includes the Colosseum so it is well worth the visit.Definitely check it out if your in Rome!
Open Air. It is an open air sight. If you want to recognise the ruins , get ready with the sight map in advance
Nice place. This is a nice place to walk around, but you really have to be able to imagine what it looked like because most of it is just gone.

Long and Worthwhile Walk. We did a Roman Guy tour through Palatine Hill. There is A LOT to see, but if you enjoy history, it is worth the trek. I highly recommend going with a tour group, otherwise, you will have NO CLUE what you are looking at. I thoroughly enjoyed our tour guide. If you go in the summertime, bring a bottle of water if you can. It is very hot and there is no shade on the tour. Would not recommend with small children due to the amount of walking on unpaved areas.
