Excellent insight into historic Rome. Having paid for and queued for a long time to get into the Colosseum, the Palatine Hill was a far better value for money experience. Spread over a huge area, the amount of things to see is far more than can be easily covered in a couple of hours. It will involve a lot of walking, but I would highly recommend this, and if you have limited time would definitely recommend it over the Colosseum.

Interesting experience. The hill is conncted to the colosseum and is a direct link to continue looking at the old roman ruins, the ticket for the colosseum covers both sites, dont miss it it is really interesting and shocking to see all this structures from 2000 years ago, just were really comfortable shoes

lovely views from an amazing site. You need a dry day to really appreciate this. you wander through history and ruins of temple, very ancient dwellings, villas and palaces..We bought our combined tickets for Palatine Hill, Forum and Colosseum here- no queues -and also paid for the excellent audio guide. There are great views from the top- shady spot for a picnic lunch. You could just walk through it quickly in an hour o r so or take your time to get the most out of it

Palestine hill. Entry to here was included with the Coloseum so it wasn't bought deliberately. The Guide was very informative about the story of Rome regarding the two brothers and the Alleged Wolf who found them, as we meandered up the hill he pointed out various facts so a guided tour for us was a must as we hadn't a clue, we spent around 2/3 hrs in total ( guide lasted 1 hr ) sitting in the Unexpected but very welcomed Sun,( don't think we would have enjoyed if it had been raining ) reading the various information boards trying to soak it all up. Very enjoyable and interesting

Walk in the steps of the ancient Romans. Walk in the steps of the ancient Romans - feel the history of the area. The views across Roe are fantastic and of course you get a great view of the forum. You do need a dry day as there is no shelter.There are sloping paths for the less fit but it would be difficult for whechair user

THIS was the Roman Empire Capital. This place is awesome beyond words. Miss it and you'll regret it! Can walk through in about 2 hours, but I recommend spending up to 4 hours...really a nice place to go after the Colosseum which we did in the morning, and then here after lunch! Grab a headset at the gate to learn the history...but without its still awesomely amazing :-D

Great historical site in the middle of the city. It's just amazing to see that site in the middle of a big city. The best views are from the top gardens. Great morning there.it is a must do if you like roman history.
History in abundance. Palatine hill it is mainly a ruin its an amazing place with history going back centuries a fine day attraction no where to shelter here

Watch your step but have a great time. What a good day out .It was well worth the effort and we took our time as not being able to walk so well we had to watch the uneven paths but would not have missed the experience. This was yet another place where disabled get in free.

A nice place in fine weather. A beautiful collection of ruins and sights, best done with a guide unless one is a historian. The Temple of Vesta is here, the ruins of the temple of Castor and Pollux, the Arch of Titus, the temple of Romulus (the original doors still there - and the lock still works!), the remains of Julius Caesar's residence, and much more. Stroll to the top among the gargantuan ruins of the Imperial Palace, and there are great opportunities for breathtaking views and photographs of the city. Bring a drink, you can get thirsty on the walk up and back.

worth the climb. The Palatine Hill is part of the Roman Forum, so no additional fee to visit here once you've entered the Forum. The tickets are little disingenuous, as it says "Colosseum, Roman Forum and Palatine Hill", so it feels like you are paying for 3 attractions, when really it is just for the Colosseum and Roman Forum.It is worth the climb up the steps and walk through an orange garden, an interesting walk itself, to the hill where you get an excellent view of the Forum ruins and Rome.

Fantastic walk around Ancient Rome. We bought our tickets online (coopculture.it) for 14€ per person (tickets are generally 12€ each, but a 2€ booking fee applies). This ticket allowed full access for one day to the Roman Forum, the Colosseum and Palatine Hill. Our taxi dropped us off on Via San Gregorio, outside the entrance to Palatine Hill. This place was deserted and we walked right in without having to wait in any sort of queue.Palatine Hill houses a museum showcasing artefacts that were found in the vicinity, which has interesting video presentations. Admission is free.Most sites are signposted in Italian and French, with brief but good information. Was delighted at having seen the supposed dwelling place of the founder of Rome: Romulus. Palatine Hill offers beautiful panoramic views of the Roman Forum and the Colosseum. The Forum is connected to the hill and you just continue walking around the grounds. You'll need to exit the forum to cross the road to reach the Colosseum. Allow at least 4 hours to see everything, whilst walking at an average pace. 90% of footpaths are cobbled stones, so appropriate footwear is advised. There are no shops nearby, so I recommend carrying a bottle of water.

Real Rome. Stunning and truly impressive. Great views on the city. You can really feel the ancient atmosphere here. Must see when in Rome. Ticket covers entry to the Colosseum and Forum Romanum as well.

Worth the Walk. Interesting remains on the hill itself - Emporer Augustus' and his wife Livia's dwellings. Lots of things to explore, small museum and shady peaceful gardens. Fabulous views across the Forum to the city.
good to see history. you need good strong legs to walk all round to see every thing but there is place you can fill up your empty water bottles

Also Excellent On Your Own. My wife and I didn't book a guide and still very much enjoyed this ancient site. Since the ticket to the Coloseum includes Palatine Hill and is valid for 2 days, we visited Palatine Hill on the second day when we were good and rested.

Pinnacle of Rome visit. Endless mounds of rubble, with partial arches, floors, walls and buildings that just happen to be the foundation of our modern world. Unless you have a pHD in roman history, DO NOT visit this site without a tour guide. I had read the info and actually bought a small book about this site but didn't realize that NOTHING is marked or identified. Completely frustrating- until I walked upon a tour group. Tagged along after speaking with very knowledgable guide then paid at the end. Amazing history here. Everything I knew about ancient Roman civilization occurred within approximately one square mile of Palatine Hill/Forum/Coliseum sites. Visited many fabulous sites but this is number one for me. Buy a Roma pass (1-3 days) which includes unlimited public transportation, 2 free sites, and a discount on others but most importantly allows you to SKIP THE WAITING LINE to enter sites. Side note: I wore my normal leather touring shoes but at this site really needed a more substantial sole- completely uneven, cracked surfaced.
A must see whilst in Rome. So much to see - allow at least a couple of hours or more if you can. Research beforehand or take a tour to make the most of what you are seeing.
Give it a walk through. Don't spend all day. Amazing bit of history. Don't miss it on your trip to rome. 12 euro ticket also gets you into the colosseum.

Peacefule haven. A lovely peaceful area away from the Colosseum and Forum. Lots of interesting sites here so worth a visit. The ticket is all inclusive with Colosseum and Forum. There is a recently reopened viewing terrace which affords magnificent views over the whole of the forum - don't forget you camera. 12€ ticket. We paid an extra 10€ for a guide to take us here as well as giving an overview of the Colosseum and Forum, worth it.

The Best. This was the best bit of our trip by a long way and we are really happy to have had a beautiful blue day. It was a very calm place. We booked a tour and a very glad we did and then had a bit of lunch and then walked and wondered some more. You could feel the ages. Fab!

Go with a guide. The history of ancient Rome is fascinating especially when you have a guide to talk you through it all and answer any question you have. Just imagining how the Romans used this area is so fascinating

Book a tour.... Great place, but book a tour otherwise you will have little/ no idea what you are looking at! Took a tour here which was included in a colluseum tour and would highly recommend doing so.
Allow plenty of time. We were here on a walking tour so did not get to see it all but if going independently, make sure you allow enough time to take everything in. Great views and very peaceful.

Worth a look. I love old things. Palatine Hill is a must do if you go to Rome. BUT a guide would be helpful. I'm afraid we didn't use one and we spent half our time lost & when we knew where we were, there wasn't a lot of signed information to educate us about what we were looking at. But it is visually appealing and relatively inexpensive.

Wonderful site. One of our favorite spots in Rome, walking along the ruins from the Collosium - awesome experience. A visitor should not miss this beautiful area. As throughout Rome, beware of pick-pockets and thieves, they seem to be everywhere.

Beautiful - especially is nice weather. I appreciated it much more than colosseum (same entry ticket, even though you don't need to do both in the same day, it's valid for 1 entry in each place, for 2 consecutive days (10 EUR) ). When I visited Rome it was sunny and nice, and the walk through the Foro is stunning, nice, green, beautiful. I am not too into history so skipped the museum, but heard it's Worth it in case you're into history. I would recommend to NOT underestimate the Forum (palatine hills) - it really IS Worth it to take time to walk around here, also - nice views from the top of the hill.
Ancient Rome. Another must see in Rome. History, history, history. We took a guided tour and once again amazed by the history of the area.

Definitely go to museum first. I walked through in 45 minutes and I skipped the museum, which should offer some video simulations of the area. That would add another dimension to the whole experience. Without that and with knowing only a little about the place the experience is just partial. So take your time and get some knowledge or guide before hand. You have a great view of Forum Romano from the hill itself.

must see. such a beautiful visit to be-able to walk in the footsteps of roman emperors a place full of history true a lot of it is in ruins but to see and imaging what it looked like in them times is awesome you need a good guide book to help as there are not many information boards to tell you whats what
Wow. Some of the best views of the coloseum with great photo ops. Walk under the citrus trees in quaint gardens & look down upon the forum. Its a walk around the hill with many steps.
so much to see. This place never seems to end , there is so much to see here you could easy spend best part of the day here, linked with the forum and the Colosseum so much history .

Beautiful and deserted in the early am. Go early. With the sun just rising it isn t too hot (there is little shade) and it is more comfortable wandering around the ruins. Invest in a good guidebook or app, otherwise the ruins are quite hard to understand. The palatine museum is good too.

Great views and walk in the footsteps of Augustus. as part of the entry to the colosseum also includes entry to the forum and palatine hill. I have never been to the museum before and liked the way you had to walk aroundD the stonework inside. A good sample of statues and other frescos. This gives gigot views over the forum and tYou can see all the site from above

top top!. to be seen!great view on forum, colysseum and townand many romain monuments!Take a ticket to vsist livia house before going (after, it's impossible!) when you buy ticket for forumfresques très belles

A must go attaction. The Palatine hill, the roman forum and the colosseum are part of ancient Rome and you can visit them all in one day. Go early (9am) and buy the ticket at the Palatine Hill/Roman forum, because the lines are shorter there. The say the tickets are good for two days, but make no mistake, you can use them only one time at each attraction. You can spend 2 hours at the colosseum and certainly 3 to 4 hours at the Palatine, so plan your day to go first to one of them, have lunch and go to the other. This is because you will walk a lot and get tired, so it is good to rest while eating a nice meal. The best restaurants around are at Cavour street.

Favourite part of our trip. Absolutely loved visiting palatine hill, it was my favourite part of our vacation. We had our 19 month old with us and it was the only place we visited where she could walk the whole thing. Such a beautiful spot. Only 12 euro for entry to colosseum, palatine hill and roman forum which is fantastic value. Definitely recommend bringing a packed lunch as you could get hours here and beautiful scenery to sit down with a picnic, especially in good weather.

Fantastic. I wasn't planning on going here but the admission was included in the coliseum admittance. It is fantastic, it is a very large area filled with ruins. If you take the stairs all of the way up there is a great view of the city. There are also scattered benches where you can sit and just enjoy the park area. We spent about 2 hours here and completely enjoyed it.

Take a Lunch. The Palentine Hill is part of the Roman Forun experience. It is a great place to sit and picnic while you just take in the sites. Bring a backpack or a bag of easy to peal fruit or snacks and a bottle of water. If you buy fruit from a vender in the morning, BEFORE you leave the stand, lookin the bag and see what you have. Othewise, you might find yourself and your famil starving, ready for a picnic and discover you have been carrying a bag of potatos all day ....

Wear comfortable shoes!. If you have purchased a ticket to the colosseum then chances are this will include free entry into this attraction. Well worth checking out and you will be in history overload. Allow a couple of hours to expire the ruins but a great opportunity to take photos as the view is fantastic.

Jack and Jill going up Palatine Hill. After paying a visit to the Colosseum and the Roman Forum, went onto Palatine Hill. The place is vast lots to see and enjoyable walking around so make sure you take ur comfy shoes or walking boots.

Beautiful. I think this was our favourite part of our trip to Rome, I didn't know what to expect as the colosseum is the main attraction but Palatine Hill was stunning, take the tour, it's worth every penny, we chose Romaround Tours, our American tour guide was very informative, friendly, chatty and made the facts come alive for us

Beautiful!. Palatine Hill is a beautiful place full of lots of different quirky things! You can see the old buildings and the arches. You also can walk up to the top of the hill and have a great view of the Forum and the Colosseum.
Amazing views. Great place to take photos and take in a bird's eye perspective of the forum and and other ancient sites! Be prepared for a little bit of trek but well worth it.

My Favourite of the 3 sites. . Out of the 3 neighbouring sites (others being the Forum and the Colosseum) Palatine Hill was the one I enjoyed the most. It may not have the same visual impact of the other two, but it has a much more relaxed atmosphere. You don't have to wait in a big line to get in, and the people around you seem calmer. Once in it is a large site that was green and cool when I visited (Feb 2015) but in the Summer I would be sure to bring some sun protection and water. There are fountains to fill bottles. Another point to note is that it is a hilly area and had a fair few stairs. Still the lack of rush means you can take your time to work your way up there. Plenty of signage in Italian and English offering information about what you are seeing. Highly recommended - even if you race through (would be a shame though) it allows you to skip the lines at the other venues.
Great views. This is a great view of forum and colleseum . It is a unique view of the ruins. There is a cost. But it is a must see.
My favourite place in Rome!. Amazing! A real surprise, so glad we went. Full of history and great for the children to be in the middle of all that history.
Full of Roman History. Great place to see a lot of Roman History. Some areas under restoration but does not create much of a problem. Found the site to be a little less crowded than many others.

Walk on a bit to get away from the crowds. There will always be lots of people walking through the main part of the Forum between the Colosseum and the Capitoline museum, but this area is a little quieter and will provide you with some lovely views and the chance to see some of the old stadium areas and Casa Olivia which is the house that has been uncovered. There are some lovely gardens with orange trees and it is a real oasis away from the crowds.
History at your feet. Impressive, you are walking in Roman history, yes it's a lot of ruins but very impressive. Wear decent forward as very uneven under foot.

bring a picnic!. You can access the Palatine Hill from the forum or come in through its own entrance, which always seems the least crowded on the combined entrance ticket for the Colosseum, Forum and Palatine. The remains of the imperial palaces and buildings are amazing and give a real taste of the Empire at its height. It never gets as busy as the forum and can be a peaceful spot to bring a picnic and enjoy views of ancient and modern Rome
Nice views. Visited this as part of the Forum. Nice views from the top and a nice little gardens with orange trees which smelt lovely on the sunny day we were there.

Palatine Hill. Palantine Hill is a part of the area which has Colosseum and Roman Forum. Its worth a visit if someone is interested in history since Rome started here. It also given good views of the Roman Forum from the top.
Great view of the city!. This is a great spot to come for a nice view of the city and to enjoy the sun on a nice day. Would definitely recommend!

Magnificent Remains of Imperial Splendor. The Palatine Hill was the home base for Roman Emperors. Numerous palaces have significant remains that cannot fail to impress. Although a lot of the site is roped off to prevent the throngs of people from causing erosion and damage to the ancient buildings, you still get a wondrous impression of the grandeur of ancient Imperial Rome.
fantastic. Fantastic place to visit and have a good walk around on a sunny feb day! Lots and lots to see including the views of the city.go there!

Rome Grandeur. We were not even aware of this landmark before our guide took us around to see it...what a sight!! It is utterly impressive on size alone, but the way it is laid out and constructed is simply awesome. To us it is such an accomplishment for the time; a tribute to the grandeur of Rome.

The top!. This is a place you absolutely have to see if you visit Rome! For its historical significance of course, it is pointless to try to explain this is a few words, but even if you are not so much into history you will just be struck by the magnificence of the environment. You can stroll freely in a wide park (go there in nice weather of course) and get magnificent glimpses of the past. Before you go, try to read something about Ancient Rome and the monuments you will see. It will fill your soul besides your eyes. Plan some time for the visit, this is not a quick monument to see, but the experience will last forever!
The View!. Oh the view of Rome, unbelievable! Must see for everyone.It a big walk,, but that's Rome, a wholllle bunch of walking

A walk in ancient times.. If you want to walk the same streets as the ancient Romans and stand where the armies of Rome held triumphal processions or the senate it's elections then this is the place for you. We had a fantastic day here.The museum on the hill is a must to help put all of the ruins into some chronological order, the interactive video [Italian] helps you understand the different phases and gives you an idea of what it looked like in its heyday. HOWEVER go prepared, once inside there's nowhere for coffee or to eat and only a few places to sit in this vast complex of the acient world

Wonderful place. We had a free guided tour of Palatine Hill that we got with the skip the que tour for the Colosseum and so glad that we did. She knew a lot about the area which helped to bring it all back to life. Afterwards we had plenty of time to wander around and also to relax and people watch. A chance to explore and step back in time as well as to relax.
A wonderful surprise!. A great place to wonder around and savour Ancient Rome. Wonderful views across the city and lots of quite places to sit and ponder, eat a picnic lunch and relax.
Well worth a trip. Like most places in Rome it is worth taking time to visit. You really do get a sense on what Rome was like in its Hey day
Go on a sunny day. I love this site, and go several times each time when I am in Rome. My kids have loved it since they were very young, as well. Interesting...all the history right before your eyes.

Awesome. . I wasn't really looking forward to visiting here but so glad I did. The view over the forum is amazing and it's an excellent photo opportunity for the colosseum. Worth getting the ticket that lets you into palatine hill, forum and colosseum. But do the colosseum last.

A Must See. Make sure you allocate a day to see and walk the Hill. The history that surrounds you is mesmerising. There is so much to see with so many stories behind each scene that you should really book into a tour or get a private guide. Well worth the effort and cost. Take food and drink as there is none to buy on the Hill.

Transported Back to Ancient Times. I was totally transfixed here. THe quantity of ancient ruins is amazing. I could truly imagine what it was like during those times and I marveled at how much remains of the various temples and buildings.
Worth a wait. Decided to do this first (before Colosseum) and enjoyed a stroll around the ancient heart of Rome. Not too busy and plenty to explore.
Lots to see. Very interesting , lots to take in , however well worth the visit . Take some food with you and at least a drink bottle . Wear practical shoes lots of walking ,

Must See - Entrance Included With Colosseum Ticket. This is part of the Roman Forum and a must see when you're in Rome.The ticket gets you into the Roman Forum and Palatine Hill too, valid for two days. HOWEVER, there is one entrance per attraction and the Roman Forum and Palatine Hill is together. I would suggest doing Colosseum one day and the other two the next. We did the Colosseum and then went to the Roman forum in one day, we went to go back and do Palatine the next day and we weren't allowed back in, which was really annoying.The views are stunning from the top of the hill. Set aside at least a day for the Forum and Palatine Hill - see the Colosseum on another day.
Fantastic. An absolute must see. Wear sensible shoes. Visit the church in the grounds that is just brilliant. I fell in love with this place and could have spent hours looking at all the ruins.

Interesting story - must visit after the colloseum!. Must get a tour guide for this as the story is so interesting!The Colosseum ticket includes Palatine Hill and the roman forum.I think we were there for about 2 hours including the roman forum but you could easily be there longer is you have time.
Lovely. This was a lovely part of history to visit and we were lucky enough to have a visit to the palatine hill included with out tour guide for the day, well worth a visit.

Brilliant. Visited this while in the city on a cruise. We had 5hrs to do whatever we wanted and i dragged the missus to this. She was not sold at first but once we were in the groove she loved it & so did i. Amazing to see the ruins & learn more about the place. I would suggest some reading up about the area first. We were walking around the ruins for hours but you can make it as short as you wish.Cost: €12 adult (included Roman Forum, Palatine Hill & Colloseum).
Walking in the past. Be sure to go with a guide, either private or public, otherwise you miss a lot. Also best to go early and miss the crowds.

Seat of the Roman Emperors. What a huge place and what stories it has to tell. Set a few hours aside to visit as there is so much to see. The museum there contains many treasures that are extremely interesting. Do not miss!

We Could Have Spent the Entire Day Here. We were fortunate to have a tour booked with the Walks of Italy, so we got to see the area with an unlimited amount of knowledge to answer all of our questions and add in things we would have never thought to ask. Walks of Italy used a book, Rome Reconstructed, which showed the current site an a page that was placed on to to see what the site is thought to originally have looked like. We purchased a copy of this book at the Vatican bookstore and it was well worth the investment for our tour of the Palatine Hill. Make sure to take a moment to view the new sites being excavated from the viewing area, although a little distance it is neat to see the new discoveries. Also, make the walk up to the garden area, there is a beautiful view of the entire area from that overlook.
Fantastic!. Amazing views, had a ticket with a tour guide for here and the colosseum, very good value to see such a brilliant part of history!
Wow. I have never seen anything like this before it is stunning. For a building that was built between 70 ad &80 ad it is truly magnificent. The size of it is unbelievable. A must see.
The living history. One of the most mysterious places in the Eternal City. Loved it so much! Everyone should see it who visit Rome.

Heritage. Couple this with the visit to Colosseum and using the Roma Pass you can actually get access without standing in the queue for long. If you are planning to buy ticket then go for the combination ticket which includes the colosseum, forum and hill. Do not even think about buying it from the site because you will end up standing in a never ending queue. These ruins, ruins the fun without much information but with a guide or audio tour, you would better see the beauty of the place and appreciate this open area tour. Come fully prepared to spend your time climbing and walking.
Good views. Interesting how the wealthy could afford such huge areas to build their houses also on higher grounds compared to others in Rome in that era, also just a short walk from other sights.

A day's worth of seeing. Set aside at least half a day to walk around and see all the amazing structures, all the spots that it spans and take in the atmosphere. It is astounding what the objects represent. And on a warm sunny day it is just amazing... It is one of the few experiences that would be fun for little ones too

massively impressive in its vast size!. Our guide pointed out various landmarks to encourage us to imagine how huge the buildings would have been with the columns & walls complete. The guide's book of an artists impression of what we were looking at & how it would have been, helped fill in the gaps!

Peaceful, roomier part of the Roman ruins. The Palatine Hill is part of the complex that includes the forum and the colosseum, and you can buy a ticket that covers all three. The ticket office for Palatine has the shortest queues. It is a nice peaceful place, more like a garden than an architectural site, although there are plenty of Roman ruins about too. It's more spacious than the forum and colosseum and feels quite restful.
History... . Wonderfull place, full of history. You can spend here whole day just walk around. Mandarines trees up on the hill, museum entry. Great way to spend day.
Beautiful. Really beautiful ruins, takes a good few hours to walk all the way round properly. We spent the morning here then the afternoon in the collesium with the dual ticke, well worth it.

Can't believe it was built so many years ago. Incredible and beautiful place! The views from Palatine Hill are breathtaking! To see all those constructions that were built 2000-3000 years ago was really incredible! They survived so much!
old rome. some interesting things to look at. a good way to spend some time. combine with other sites near by.

Take your time and walk all around it. Without paying a fee you can view it from afar and also on high and can take heaps of good photos. But viewing without paying the fee makes you wonder what its all about, so if you do have time and want to learn more about Roman life, go in and check it out. Worth it. There are also guides hanging around that will tell you about life gone by. There was a Uni student keen to earn a few dollars and we went with her. Not sure it was legal, but we had a fascinating insight into it all.

Amazing. We had a guide, and I'm glad we did because otherwise I'd have had no idea what we were looking at. Learned a lot, gained some serious perspective and soaked up some major historical pointers. Just tremendous, no words can really do it justice - but a lot of excavation and work is being done so loads of places were cordoned off and unreachable. Still , worth the trip. MIND THE STAIRS. Those Romans loved hills and stairs; benches, not so much. Needed my inhaler a few times!
Walking through history. Amazing place to visit. I went alone with a map but I think I would have preferred an organised tour. There is so much history in one place, I found it fascinating
wow. Impressive and magnificent place. The great ruins at the beginning is just astonishing, the detail in every place is a proof of the Romans power.
near colosseum. very good walk in the day and in the night going to the colosseum.....full of people and good for taking pictures....
Epic. We rented the audio guides and they were helpful to know what the different sections were. The ruins are a treasure!
True history. This place is amazing and has a special place in my heart. A must have for Italy. You can bring some subs and eat them while imagining the history around you
Ruins,ruins,ruins. We came here after visiting the colleseum as we bought a combined ticket. It is worth a visit . You can imagine it bustling with people.
Beatifull. We enjoyed the walk. Visit the place after Colosseum. A old historical place, many people around and it is really nice.
must see. It is very impressive place to see. everywhere is sorrounded by ruins and historical buildings. you feel the history in the streets in Rome. I think most important part of the city.
Ancient scent. I liked the possibility to walk the ways our ancients walked and see the remains, the history, the rise and fall of great empire.

You could almost hear the bustling of times gone by. It didn't take much imagination to imagine this area in it's heyday. The layers of history in Rome are entrancing and we enjoyed walking this area for a whole afternoon. Not crowded at all as it's a very large area.

Amazing place to visit ,see and experience. This is one of the great things you can see and do in Rome, pictures and film don't do it justice it is a must see , just be mindful of the pickpockets they are everywhere.

do I really need to write?. i mean, come on, it's, alongside with athens' acropolis, the pinnacle of history, civilization and culture.
Plus you can stroll there for free. Not like in the UK where you pay for everything.
Great historical place. Great historical a d important plcace. Its Important reservation your tickets, the long line and use the visitor guide its interesting

The Top of Palatine Hill. We went on the first Sunday of the month so it was free. To be honest if you go to the top of Palatine Hill you can get some great shots/views of the Forum and the Colosseum with out having to walk round them! It is fantastic. Although I like History some times once you have seen one ruin they merge into one.On top of the Hill you can see the whole effect of all of the Forum and Colosseum. So for those of us who do not want to spend hours wandering around it is a great short cut to see it all.
Spend as much time here as you can. Just to be able to walk through the forum are and Palatine hill the same way the Romans did over 2000 years ago is quite the feeling.
great from the outside, slightly dissapointed inside!. outside looks spectacular, after an hour or more queing to get in and paying, within 20 minutes we had seen it all
Historical spot to meander around. This whole area is lovely to amble about in soaking up the history. You can easily spend an hour or two enjoying the beautiful old ruins
Busy busy busy. Make sure you have a Roma pass in order to walk to the front of the queue. Lots of blocked off areas and scaffolding at present.
The greatness. You will smell the blood and sweet,the glory everywhere ,the cages and titles at each location ,make sure to go early
don't miss. ancient rome at its best, one of the must see attractions that is centrally located. absolutley awe enspiring.

Take an extra tour!. The basic ticket is 9 euros but you can pay more for some of the tours available. I was at the underground / 3rd floor tour and LOVED IT! You have the opportunity to visit spaces closed to the general public and get a better idea of what the colosseum was in its glorious days. The 3rd floor offers and amazing view of the colosseum and its surroundings!Even if you don`t wanna spend more, don't miss the opportunity of visiting this amazing place. Some historical information is made available inside the colosseum so you can understand better its use and history.

Lots to see. There's lots to see and you could spend a good few hours here taking in all the history! I did have my guide book with me and without that it would of been difficult as there wasn't much information about to read and what information there was, was in Italian. Also some of the areas where closed the main one which would of been nice was the Casa di Augusto - the house where Romulas and Remus were meant to have lived.
Astounding. Really a must see place. We got in using our Roma passes which are definitely worth it. It has an incredible atmosphere

Magnificent. Guided tour was very good. It was a Sunday so it was free to all. We had purchased a Roma Pass and it meant we skipped the main queue (this was the only occasion the pass proved really useful) The toilets were in a porta-cabin with no seat, and had long queues.

walking thorugh thousands of years of history. it is well organized and easily accessible . very well maintained . It is helpful to have a guide o purchase a guide that compares the current view to the ones at the Roman times

I could spend the whole afternoon. take a sunny but not too warm afternoon and go there.... bring maybe a snack or so...and a blanket, and you can even sit below the threes for hours and look at this amazing roman ruins! i find them fascinating! my favourite museum from Rome!

Can we have a bit more guidance please. I found the famous Antique Roman sites almost un-enoyable due to the simple reason of not having enough English signs and descriptions. The ones in place are almost all damaged and/or completely faded. Considering the amount of tourists visiting Rome I find it difficult to believe that the city could not afford to signpost the public sites a lot better - and in English, which language ( albeit sadly ) seems to have overtaken Latin in the past couple of millennia...
Quintessential Rome! You haven't been to Rome until you've been here!. Sure, it was a touch touristy but the history was almost palpable. Do yourself a favour and buy a Roma Pass. Worth every cent!

Older than your parents,kids!. The history was able to be better imagined once these sights were seen in real life. This is where the lions were, this is where the emperor sat, this is the crowd seating like other stadiums and this is where the christians were left to entertain the masses. Nothing changed much in a couple of thousand years, has it?

Palatine Hill. Palatine hill is remaining ruins of the emperers house. It is infront of the Colosseum. you can get very good view of the colosseum from this hill. entry tickets are combined of colosseum and palatine hills.

Humbling. So I kept thinking, if the Romans built things BC that are still standing, why do I need to reside my house? The history and the amazing architecture are something to behold and should not be missed. I'd suggest a good tour guide tho so you know all of what you are looking at.
The best. We took a tour. I would recommend a tour as you don't have to wait in line. The guides know much more than you can learn from a guide book or audio set. Plus you are able,to ask questions
History. Loved this place. Had a great private tour through the Forum and the Colosseum. Loved the history and the feel of the place. The Italians love their city and you get caught up in this hype.
Wow. it boggles the mind to see what the ancients did without the modern equipment we have today. It really put things in perspective for me.

amazing history but don't bother with the audio guide!. So glad we visited this amazing piece of history. Would be even better if they could reenact/have some people dressed in costume. The audio guide was a waste of money as there are plaques in English with all the info you need. Luckily we didn't have to queue for too long. Watch out for the guys dressed as gladiators on the way out, will charge you £10 each for a crappy photo!

Amazing a must see place in Roma. I was looking forward to it before I was going to holiday there but when you get there it's twice as big and you can just see forever and for the money 12 euros is nothing from what you get to see :-) just to let you know don't go on a tour guide we paid extra and had to ditch her in 5min becuase she made it thought the grate 25min after she was ment too,
Impressive. Unfortunately they are working on this but still interesting. There is a museum in the forum which is small and not that interesting. €12 covers both sites

Nice if you have time after the Forum. This, like the Roman Forum, is an interesting site, with a lot of architectural and historical aspects to view. As with the Forum, it would be wise to hire a guide or buy a good book in advance if you want to get the most from a visit. Personally, I found it less inspiring that the Forum and spent less time here, but it is certainly worth visiting for a more complete appreciation of the ancient area and some great views.
Sense of history. You get a new sense of size and scale of the ancient world. Pictures do not it justice! Worth getting the behind the scenes tour!

Palatine Hill. We visited Palatine Hill on a trip to Rome last Spring. We were quite surprised that the office could not provide guide maps. I would strongly suggest to anyone visiting to have a knowledgeable guide. Another alternative would be to study the history of Palatine hill and provide your own guide map. Without a doubt this is an extremely historic site. It cannot be fully appreciated by appearance alone. Compared to other Roman antiquities and sites, Palatine Hill's archeological research appears to be in its formative stage.

A must see. The view from the Palatine Hill is absolutely breathtaking! It is a must see! The main entrance across from the Colosseum is always busy so I would recommend going around the right side of the forum and going through the small and very quiet entrance. Pre-booking tickets is always a good idea as the line is too long. I would recommend a private tour as well.
Wonderful history. Its a great look into the past. Its amazing to see that buildings that are thousands of years old are still standing. One piece of advice - wear comfortable shoes!
History.. Makes the hairs stand up on the back of your neck! Absolutely stunning! Like going back in time! Do not miss it!

Old Roman town. Its an old roman town gives you glimpse of roman civilization.There are only ruins which are left out however it indicates the capability of our ancestors , they have built huge structures without the support of modern technologies.Must say this places takes you back hundreds of years and make you feel how this worlds looks earlier.
Amazing History. it was amazing experience to be there. a must visit place. but take care from the direct sun in the summer, you must have water for the dehydration.
Good value for money. A good day of sight seeing. Not too busy in January but would definitely recommend pre buying tickets at busier times.

glorious. an amazing place in rome and known for a reason!!!it makes you feel like living at that time where it was full of crowds!!!the ticket is 12euros which i think is overpriced but noone should miss it!!

a view point. This is just a view point and nothing much to talk about.Nothing more than a historic attraction.There were some construction or renovation work going on so some part of this historical area is covered.
Wonderful. Absolutely amazing, didn't realise how big it was and how much info there was to go with it would definitely recommend booking a tour guide, will be back again for sure!

Not to be missed. Perfect January day, got to the Forum early (9.30 - 10am) and it was very quiet - ideal for taking photos of each ruin. Obviously some reconstruction of pillars etc but original triumphant Arches & gave a small peek at how wonderful it must have been 2000 yrs ago. Info on boards near points of interest if you don't hire an audio guide. Afterwards, went up the Palatine Hill - beautiful with oranges on the trees. More extensive than you probably think and we had no time left to visit the onsite museum. N.b. although books refer to Livia's House, this was not open to the public and unable to see its mosaics. Colosseum visited previous day and commented on separately.

Lots of walking - map it out!. Worth your time - priceless history - but takes forever to walk around it. Plan before you go!!! We walk a lot but even this was hard for us. Decide what is most important to you.

The best of Rome. fantastic loved these sites. Make sure you allow at least half a day, probably more if you have the time, to see everything. Your entry ticket of 12 euros is valid for two days for all three sites but you can only enter the sites once during those two days so plan ahead.
Walked and Walked and loved it. Our family walked around these ruins for hours! It was so interesting. We had an audio guide to help explain what we were looking at. We loved it!
Step into Rome. Every history lesson you have every taken about Rome is right there in front of you. However, go early or the que to go in will diminish the enjoyment.
History with beauty and tranquility. This place is historically charming and so magnificently beautiful. Its amazing. Its an empowering place

A must see. This area is located right beside the Colosseum, we actually didn't know to go to it but what a nice surprise when we left the Colosseum to find this. This area and the Colosseum are included in the same ticket price. The area is quite big and took us a while to explore it all. We really loved our time here. It seems like an entire ancient city left behind. I would definitely recommend going to see this and spend some time here.

Guided Tour. We visited is today. We took a full guided tour over three hours. It was an extrodinary experience to have the history explained as we walked looking at all the different parts. It is almost incomprehensible to comprehend the enormity of the history until it under your feet.

Amazing. Everytime I come to Rome I visit this are and never tire of looking at the amazing buildings and outdoor spectacles that the Romans built. Although not taking photos anymore because the ones in published books are so good, I treasure the opportunity to still be able to marvel at them.

In ancient Rome. These ruins show us elements of life for the wealthy in ancient Rome. Although in many cases only foundations or remnants remain, we still get a sense of a public space (the forum) and religious worship, and on Palatine Hill we see how the Emperors lived. There is also a small museum.New palace rooms are now open for viewing, showing wall frescoes. One must pay extra for them, and it is easiest to sign up online, since the entrance to the HiIl and the ticket kiosk to the rooms must be bought in different places.

The guided tour we bought just outside was worth it. Extremely interesting but without someone telling you what you see its just a lot of stones and you miss half. We were a bit reluctant buying the guided tour just outside but they in fact did a great job and we skipped the lines that even in January were like 30 minutes.....

fabulous. We visited following our trip to the colosseum.Be aware (save yourselves a long wait) - there are two queues before you enter - one to buy your tickets and one to get in. We queued in a long line to buy our tickets only to get to the kiosk and discover that the tickets for the colosseum also cover Palatine Hill and the Roman Forum! A lot of other people did the same.Leave yourself plenty of time as there is so much to see. You can easily spend a good half day here - and more.

Loved it - so much to see. I wish we had been able to go back a second day - but it was amazing - need a couple extra bathrooms in the area - not all areas and bathrooms are wheel chair accessible - you can see it in 1 to 2 hours - but if you want to read about the history and really explore it - take 2 to 3 hours - it's bigger than it looks at first glance

Umbelivable. this place is just unbelievable.you can use the same ticket from coliseum and in my opinion in much beautiful than coliseum.the problem is that you have many stairs, so be prepared to go up and down many times.

Amazing!!. Absolutely amazing!! We got the Roma pass which was a great buy, we bypassed the huge que and then we was able to book a guided tour once we got in where there was no que! The open top busses were a great way to get here aswell. It dropped us off right outside.

Rome'n around the Forum. The relics of the Forum/Palatine Hill are adjacent to the Collesium and you can buy entry to both on one ticket but it has to be used within consecutive days.It's a fantastic and easy walk that you can do at your own pace but wear comfy shoes. I would allow at least 2 hours and be sure to check the closing time before you start your trip planning so that you allow enough time.Only downside is there isn't as much written information as one would like. Even an audio tour would have been good.But all in all a worthwhile experience
Wonderful sight. Breathtakingly! I really like it when I was riding around it I saw all the beauty. Looks amazing at the very evening because it's highlighted
Palantine Hill. Absolutely wonderful place to visit when in Rome. The architecture is mind blowing!! The Arch of Titus was one of my favorites. Can be kind of tricky to figure out where the exit is.

excellent. great value for all three attractions. not a massive queue (only about 15 minutes ) just wandered around reading the boards which explained all about what you were looking at.No need to book in Jan. and no need for guide (as long as you can read ! ) I really was blown away by this and certainly not disappointed after all the hype.
Call ahead for times. When we arrived at 3pm it was closed due to school field trips. Check ahead for special events that might have it close early.

One Package !. If you visit Colloseum , normally most of the tour include this two as well, for first timer to Rome, you Must get this 3 in 1 tour together , easily walkable and fun full of history and interesing statue of Roman Emperor
A Guided Tour. Got a guided tour. €9 each but worth it. Only 3 on the tour. Got so much more out of the visit with a tour and get to see places that are exclusively for guided visitors

Walking through histy. Walking there, sitting there in the sun, watching the beauty of that place, imagining what it was like before, finding out about history...it just feels special. I spent three hours there and I would still go back!

Don't miss it!. There are great views of Circus Maximus and the Roman Forum from Palatine Hill. The area is still undergoing archaeological research which will probably continue for many years to come. Take your walking shoes and enjoy!

The Best of Ancient Rome. It's incredible that you can be walking on the streets of Rome and then all of a sudden you're in Ancient Rome and looking at the Roman Forum. The architecture put in place so long ago is amazing. Be prepared to do some walking so you can truly get a good feel of Ancient Rome.

An important piece of history. An important piece of history that shouldn't be missed on your trip to Rome. Be prepared to do a lot of walking but it's worth it to see structures that were put in place almost 2,000 years ago. Street vendors are everywhere. Just ignore them and instead soak in the sights of Ancient Rome.
worth the visit. Rich in history, will take about 3 hours to do this tour properly. Should be done in good weather i.e. no rain as most of the tour is outdoors

Walked in a little bit of history. Amazing place. Lots to see and lots of walking but worth it to walk the same places they have for so many years. It amazing how well the place is still standing after all that time.

Must see. This is an awesome place to go to when in Rome. You get to walk around and see the ruins, the old castle, the Forum, take a walk on the hill and a view of the Colosseum. Plus you can get a combined ticket for the Forum, Palatine Hill and the Colosseum which works out better. The queues here are not as long but my advice is to buy online in advance. Bring your walking shoes for this one.

WOW. Both attractions were amazing. The Roman Forum was my favourite. It messes with your mind how is it still so real and not a film set. The way it is all over the place and you just keep walking from one piece of history to another. So glad I saw this one from the old bucket list.
Great!!. My wife and I didn't get a chance to visit Palatine Hill, but the site itself from afar is very impressive.
non christian. Somewhere in Rome without churches. Lovely. Strolling around the streets and imagining is lovely. Watch out for pocket pinches.

Very educational tour with Walks of Italy. If you love history this is a wonderful tour. Our guide, Fabrizio had a full 3 hours of information for us. There is a lot of climbing, stairs, hills so consider that when you make your plans.

You could spend a whole day here. There is so much to see. Even a day wouldn't be enough to appreciate all of it. It is hard to believe that this place is in the middle of the modern city. I loved Rome!
Visited in January 2015. There is so much history here that without paying for an official guided tour you will not get the most out of your visit & it will all go over your head.

Bloody huge. We used this as a landmark as we walked around Rome. It is enormous. Different areas are more or less restored and it's possible to get a feeling of how it may have looked over millennia. We didn't pay to go inside, we didn't fancy gawping at places where slaves, prisoners and animals were tortured, but it was possible to get a sense of what an alien and shocking building this would have been to people coming to Rome from a Bronze Age home outside of Italy.It took 10 years to build. Amazing.

Breathtaking. Such a fantastic way to see the heart of ancient Rome. It's as if you've gone back centuries, everything is so well preserved. I wouldn't go to Rome without visiting here, such a wonderful place :DMake sure you take good walking shoes!
The Grandeur. If you can please try to tour Palatine towards the end of the day. It was very quiet and quite fantastic to walk the grounds without encountering throngs of tourists.

Fantastic. The sheer size of this site is unbelievable. So many ruins available to explore are simply amazing. Easy access to see either before or after seeing the Colosseum and they both go for the same ticket. Just check the place of the entrance first, or you'll walk quite a lot. But you'll do loads of walking anyway and the rocks are sharp and slippery so sensible footwear is a must.
Great for exploring.. Walking tour is recommended so you learn about the area and can really take it all in. One of the highlights of Rome for sure.
endless. Need to spend a full day here, we did a few hours and only saw half. Beautiful place, architecture was incredible as you would expect in Rome

Tour. Book a private small group tour. We went through a local company to see the underground, central floor and had access to the 3rd level also. Our guide Rachel was amazing and knowledgable. There company name is http://www.livitaly.com/en/tours/colosseum-ancient-rome-small-group-tour
AMAZING. This is really a city to enjoy the art all over.Its a shame the state of degradation in some places and the prices...
Wow, Wow, Wow!. Must see during any visit to Roma! It's as though it's a film set but take a moment to realise how real it is and the history it contains. Magnificent!

It's Always about The People... Can you imagine the last thoughts of the people and animals that fought or were sacrificed and died in the Colosseum all for entertainment? Just walk across the street to The Forum and visit the cremation sight of Julius Caesar. It's unpretentious under a small tin roof. Is there anything worse than betrayal? "Et tu Brute?" While the edifices are all must sees, your imagination can only begin to envision the fabric of ancient Roman society as you retrace their walk in these historic areas.

To avoid standing in a queue to the Colosseum it's better start visiting from Palatine Hill. There is one ticket to Roman Forum and Palatine Hill as well as to Colosseum. So it's better start visiting from Palatine Hill and buy ticket at the entrance on Via di S. Gregorio. When we were there only 5 people were in the queue to 3 cash desks. At the same time the queue to cash desk in Colosseum was terrible long.Palatine Hill is quite huge area with lots of the remains of old buildings. To understand these ruins its good start your visit from the museum. You can watch there a video that shows how the hill was changing, who was the owner, what he built and in which place. After watching that movie walk through the Palatine Hill is completely different. No guidebook will explain so clearly the history of the hill as it is shown with use of animations in the movie.From the viewing terrace on the Palatine Hill is a beautiful view on the Roman Forum, the Colosseum and Rome. Palatine Hill and the Roman Forum is one area. After visiting the hill you should walk down to the Roman Forum. These ruins are making a much larger impression than on the Palatine. Definitely it's a place that you must see in Rome.After visiting Palatine Hill and Roman Forum you need to exit this area and you can go to the Colosseum. Ticket is valid two days so you can go to Colosseum on the next day if you want. Having already ticket you don't need to wait in the queue to cash desk in Colosseum, you can go straight to the entrance gates (there is no queue).

Abundance of Roman History. During my walking tour, we were amazed by the amount of Roman History around the Forum and the Palatine Hill. An incredible location filled with so much history. Worth the visit.

Incredible history. Guided tour was well worth it and call to pre book tickets to avoid very long queues!!! We thoroughly enjoyed our visit which fascinated me and normally I am not a history lover. Watch out for beggars and people trying to sell you tickets outside.
Canadian. Amazing you need most of the day to truly see this historic site and surrounding area which is just as good!
Awesome. My third visit. A brilliant place. Tiring walking around if you do it all in a day. Can get very crowded. Better to visit early in the morning.

Worth the wait. I've wanted to see this site for at least a decade and I can say I was definitely not disappointed! I would recommend taking the journey starting at the Palentine hill entry point. After meandering through the ruins of the ancient palace which will astound the senses with its vast size; you will eventually come across one of the most impressive vistas of Rome! Make sure to give yourself at least an hour or two for each site. Will be revisiting one day with hopes of securing tickets to a guided tour of the colosseums lower and upper levels.
walk in the steps of the ceasars. this is so magical you can feel the history with every step it is all around you no matter what the weather

An all day visit. Beautiful place, value for money and so very well preserved. We are avid travelers and spent a good 4 hours in the area but i can imagine it would take all day in the summer period due to the heat. Take a drink. Not the best for wheelchairs as there is a lot of cobbled areas.

Looking History in the Face. It is difficult to put into words, to be so close to such ancient remains. This is a must-do while in Rome. It can get very touristy, so try to get in early to avoid crowds and lines. Some structures are not blocked off and you can actually touch them. Can you imagine how many hands have touched these stones over the past thousands of years? Don't miss it!

Not to be missed. Hours worth of fun and history. Make sure you plan for a good few hours. Amazing how grand and huge these buildings were. It's a shame we don't have as much love and artistry for our current buildings.

The History of Modern Civilization. If you visit Rome, this is a must see! The heart of western Civilization can be seen here as several temples (Saturn, Vespa) still stand as well as the foundations of the Agora and the Senate. So much of Roman history occurred here from the victory marches by various Caesars to the Senate area where Julius Caesar was murdered. This amazing site provides a unique insight into Roman life two Millennia ago; however, make sure you have a tour guide who can give you the historic background and tales of ancient days past.

Amazing. One day was not nearly enough time to spend exploring these sights, so plan on at least two days and you will still be left wanting. We did not buy the queue hopping ticket but we realized one way to "skip" the line is to go to Palatine Hill first and buy your combination ticket there.

Worth a visit, but bring your imagination. There are not so many places in the world to see so much history in one place. This is a must do in Rome, but it is in ruins. It can be tough to tell what you are looking at and it is meaningless without a little historical background. The sights are not particularly well marked though, and the rather expensive audio guide is tough to follow. You need to visit the Forum, but a guided tour, a guidebook, or downloading a podcast to walk you through the sites is also a must.

A history buff's dream!. I spent hours here and drove my husband to distraction. The only thing I disliked about it was the queue to get in, as I would not pay for a Roma pass when I wasn't going to be around long enough to make it worthwhile.

Magical!!!!. This is the most unique thing I have seen in Italy so far, don't miss this it is spectacular just to think there were people walking 2000 years ago on these streets and living is just mesmerizing. No way to describe it unless you see it in person.

Not sure. OK the history was worth reading about. But just a pile of ruins and at the end of a long and tiring day had gone past the interested phase. Worth a look but still surrounded by vendors trying to sell you tat and harass you constantly.
historic place. take the audio guide to appreciate the history behind. went once in the evening to see the lighting and again the morning to go around. don;t miss the lighting.

A Walking History. Be prepared to walk, alot, as the hill and grounds are an exciting place to explore. Filled with history and old architecture. There are small areas tucked away that you will have to go off the main routes to find.I loved the solitude and the ambience of gardens and old structures. Definitely worth a visit after seeing the colosseum.
LOVED! LOVED! LOVED!. These landmarks were beautiful! We went in early October and had sunny skies, 80 degree weather and zero humidity. It was all breathtaking! Could not have been any nicer!

Get a tour and book in advance!. If you are visiting Rome for the first time and you don't know much about the history get a tour and book in advance! the queues are huge and in the heat and with children I can imagine get quite uncomfortable! Must do if you are visiting Rome!

A must Visit for first timer. No Way you"ll skip this if this is your first trip to Rome, for all age, it's just too Huge and popular to miss. Highly recommended take the tour and learn from the tour guide all the history of killing animal and beast that happen here " Worth it !
Excellent historic monument. We visited them in one day, but it's better to do it in two days because it's a vast area and the combined ticket allows it

Give Yourself Time, to discover Roman times!. The Roman Forum and Palantine Hill is extensive and highly rewarding.Here you will find the Hippodrome and be able to explore magnificent gardens, a palace and extensive ruins and archeological wonders of Ancient Rome.We began our exploration as part of a tour that also took in the Colosseum, but gave us virtually unlimited time at both attractions. We spent pretty much the rest of the afternoon, drinking in the wonders here, including a wonderful garden, with rose species dating back to Roman times!Around every turn is something new to see and you will not be disappointed!

guided or unguided worth the hike. On an earlier trip to Rome we took the guided tour which was being conducted by an American graduate student studying history. Very informative. Not a lot to see in terms of ruins on the hill. An important site as the home of Rome's ruling class.

Looks incredible. Looking at this marvelous piece of history is awe inspirering. I truly wish we get to go back and walk among this ancient site. ( we saw this on a tour that wasn't even going to let us go to the over look! Terrible!)

Ancient history in flesh and bones!. These monuments of world heritage are impressive and unique by all means. A must visit. It is always overcrowded but there is plenty of space even to take a break. I strongly advise taking a tour guide at least the first time you visit these monuments.

Awesome. Simply great ruins, and an excellent site. Bit rough and un-even so some solid footwear would assist your enjoyment. Best have a good walk round and take in the views from various angles and elevations. Ideal to take in the Hill and Colosseum all in one (dry) day. Best viewed from the terrace on the Hill or the lower rooms of the Musei Capitoline.

Superb Vistas. Very large, rambling site with some impressive ruins of pretty large scale structures. Be nice in the summer months for lunch up here. Great view over the Forum and worth the climb. Need a couple of hours to do it justice. Ideal to take in the Forum and Colosseum all in one (dry) day.

Wow. We only just made it before closing time and it was the last place we visited for the day and honestly I feel as though we didn't give ourselves enough time to explore this beautiful area full of ancient ruins. it was a little hard to decide where to go. I would have like to have an actual tour of the area so they could have explained what things were.

History. It's all history brilliant you've all read about it or seen it on tv but here you can walk through the history of time. Very informative parts explaining how and when it all became. It's a shame about funding drying out to carry on with the excavations well worth a visit all done with the Omnia card.
Everything you ever imagined. Even though there were a lot of tourists because it covers so much ground it wasn't crowded. best to get one of the 'queue skipping' tickets (many to choose from)

Amazing place x too much people. Amazing place to visit but not in december or january. It was very packed. We really wanted to stay longer, but there was too much people there, which can ruin your plans of enjoying it. We will have to come back another time.
roman ruins. Be sure to have a rome pass or the archeology pass in hand to walk right in. The archeology pass is a relative bargain, pick one up at the palazzo altemps which is not busy.

Amazing!. No trip to Rome would be complete without a visit to the Flavian Amphitheater. This was a big hit with the kids as they were impressed with the architecture and the engineering. Who doesn't love a story about a gladiator? We'll worth the time and cost.

The most romantic, beautiful, perfect day. My boyfriend and I have never been anywhere so perfect in our entire lives. The beauty and majesty of these sites are just overwhelming. There are orange trees growing on Palatine Hill and if you wish, you can pick one up and enjoy a juicy Italian orange! The smell of citrus in the crisp air as the sun shone down upon t

Amazing. You must visit if your going to Rome! It has some much history and is pure amazing! What a wonderful historic place! Fascinating! It's extremely busy so if your intending on doing a tour either book in advance or get there early before the rush of tourists, it's so worth visiting. If you visit Rome but don't go here your seriously missing out and not having the full experience! Awesome and so big!

Great experience!. Not only great on the photos from holidays but an interesting experience as well... Made me think of all the blood that was spilled there... Great piece of history! A must see in Rome.

Be Sure to Allow a Whole Afternoon!. The private, guided tour of the Forum and Palatine Hill was lengthy and worth every hour! Historical overload of the best kind!! Uneven walking in places so wear shoes with treads.

Wonderful view of ancient Rome. An excellent visit and a must one for any tourist in Rome. Entry pass is free for those having a Roma Pass. Make sure you take a round through the entire colloseum and also visit their souvenir shop

Very interesting and impressive. I booked a tour through Real Rome Tours and I am very glad I did. After going to Pompeii I realized how hard it can be to visit ruins and fully grasp what its former glory looked like. Our tour guide took us around with one of though books that shows a rendering of what sight looked like before. Really interesting.

Not to be Missed. skip the ticket queue at colosseum and buy ticket from Palatine Hill which also allows you to get into colosseum
be prepared with good walking shoes as its mostly comberstones

Can't thank enough this still exists!. We are blessed that these monuments still exist and that we can see them. I am grateful I could see them for myself and have my children touch and see the ancient history as well. Forum is magnificent and we were simply humbled by its significance.

Wow. Completely taken back from this building. Regret we did not do a tour as you really don't know the full scale of the happenings walking through it your self. If your part of the eu bring your passports you get in for €7.50
great and magnificently. The greatness of the ancient city of attractions - the breath of the great Roman Empire. I liked everything.

Absolutely stunning. Well all I can say is that you need a day to do this! We spent half the day in Palatine Hill and there was so much that we didn't do because there was just so much to see! This is a definite must do if you like you ruins and your history! What I'd do to go back!

Not to be missed. I went in December, right before Christmas. The lines to get in we're not bad, and the experience to see this piece of history was not to be missed. The Forum is definitely worth strolling through. Take your time because there is a lot to see. Great picture opportunities.

A trip into roman history. An excellent place to visit if you want to see a glimpse from the the grate Roman Empire. The best way is to have a guided tour...a specialist will always tell you interesting things about the places around.
Rome's History. Wear comfortable walking shoes and just explore, don't worry about getting lost because you'll eventually recognize something familiar and get back on track

A Walk Through History. We walked as Caesar had and could easily imagine the triumphant returns through glorious arches, the Vestal Virgins, and so much more. Spent hours there and would gladly return for another visit. Don't miss it.

A beautiful walk. Expect to walk in Rome. This is a nice walk surrounded by an awe inspiring view in every direction. The cost was great. No line at Palatine hill (get your tickets here and finish at the Colosseum). Great price.

Anazing. This is a place I've wanted to visit since I was a child n it was more beautiful and amazing than what I could have ever imagined! It is interesting and factual for all the family! The steps inside are a killer but so worth the climb! Beautiful beautiful place ❤️

Only had a day, spent it well at these sights. I only had a day to spend seeing some sights. Chose this tour since it is so undeniably Rome. You get a real sense of the power and prestige of Ancient Rome when you visit this area. Truly awe inspiring.

ANCIENT HISTORY. If you are into history this place will amaze you... Every step you take, every rock you touch, every breath you take is surrounded by a sense of history like no other place in the world...

A must-do. Don't miss seeing this...this is what one thinks of when one thinks of Rome. We had a great experience with Walks in Italy Tours. An organized tour really helps to point out things that you might otherwise miss.

Great attraction. Buy tickets in advance if you want to skip the line at http://www.coopculture.it/en/ticket_office.cfm It's definitely worth not standing in line for an hour.
We visited in December but I can only imagine they get longer in the summer.
Reserve 2-3h for this, it's a great place to walk around and soak in the atmosphere of what used to be here.

A huge hidden treasure. If you are interested in history then definitely visit this site. It is very reasonably priced and children under 18 are free. It is a huge site once you are inside much bigger than what you can see from the outside. If you take your time, it could easily take several hours to see everything. There are information boards around the site which tell you about the buildings but you could probably do with a guide book if you want all the details.
Bello. Beautiful even at night! 24-7 this place should be visited by the world! I would mosdef coming here again!

Interesting place. The Roman Forum and the Palatine Hill are side by side with the Colosseum and you can enter it with your Colosseum ticket. You can spend quite a lot of time wandering the area, exploring the ancient sites. Take your time and be careful not to miss something because the place is quite big. You will be really carried back in the ancient times.

It is better than the Colosseum!. Ok, I know what you are thinking, but it is quite true, there are more 'stories' associated with the residences of Palatine Hill than with the Colosseum. There is a little museum up there that is not to be missed. Also a tip: buy your ticket for the Colosseum/PalatineHill/Forum here and use it at all three attractions.
Must See in Rome!. Totally amazing to see these historic sites. You just wonder how it must have looked like 2000 years ago

Didn't know it existed, now I want to go back. Buying your ticket to the Colosseum also gets you entry here, so don't throw your ticket away after leaving the Colosseum. Walking the old streets and visiting the ruins was amazing. The views are brilliant and there is so much Roman history in one spot, it is a must visit item on your agenda.

A Must See. No need to book tickets if you dont mind c.50 mins of queuing. We were there at a busy time and on a glorious day and was actually quite good fun in the queue meeting all the other travelers and turning down the tour guides! The square is bustling and make sure you have water (or buy some!) if it is a hot day. Other than that just drink in the atmosphere and enjoy the exhibits. Inside is smaller than you'll imagine having seen Gladiator, but is impressive all the same. There are plenty of exhibits for the history buff's and plenty of selfie spots for those who want to! Palantine Hill is an added extra and worth a wander for a few euros.

Great iconic structures and great value. Myself and my partner spent a whole day just taking in these areas have to offer, the fact you get all 3 areas for 12 Euros is fantastic. We went mid morning and only took about 20-25mins to get into the Colosseum and spent a good 1hr 30mins walking around enjoying what it had to offer.Palatine Hill and the Roman Forum together is actually surprising vast and again spent a long time looking at everything! best thing to do though is start on Palatine Hill first so you can look over the Forum then continue down through it as we did it a little backwards! but overall its a fantastic day out! ( quick note if the queue is really bad at the colosseum go and buy it from the forum entrance and go back and skip the queue at the Colosseum )

A must see!. I did not hire a tour but used the signs and my guidebook to explore this amazing site. As noted by others, it is HUGE -- you could easily spend the day, particularly if you combine it with the Coloseum and Circus Maximus. The ruins are well marked and explained. This would be very difficult with limited mobility and if it is hot, definitely bring a hat and plenty of water, as much of it is in open air. To see such ancient buildings in such a setting is a once in a lifetime experience. While you could take the whole day, you should not skip it if you only have an hour or two. You can still see beautiful sights.

So much knowledge; so much history!. I'm only 2/3 way through my visit, meaning that I only visited the Palatine Hill and the Roman Forum, and I'm already eager to give a review. (Will be finishing up the Colosseum tomorrow!)It took us 2.5 hours just to see the first two, and we learnt so much about the early history of the Roman empire and the establishment of the city Rome. Since the sights were mostly built 2,000 years ago, there are only ruins - it is indeed a pity. However, they tried their best to provide you with information on and description of how the sight once looked like on their introduction bulletins. If you'd like audio guide with more detailed explanation is also available.
Amazing views!. Just walking past all the old ruins is amazing looking at the scale of what used to be here is great, very relaxing to walk and look around great day out!
Huge and splendorous !. The Anfitheatrum Flavium, ancient building! You can see the the scene of memorable battles on land and even naval, with or without large predators. Amazing!

Great Tour. Took the Greenline tour to these sights and I highly recommend it. The guide was knowledgeable,interesting, polite and even humorous.It takes about 4 hours but I think it is the best way to learn about the sites and make sure you see everything. The tour itself costs 55 Euros but includes entrance fees for the sites.
Fantastic!. This whole area was at the end of the road where our rented apartment was, and it was like walking into a film set. Just beautiful.
Not to be missed. These are some of the "must sees" of a first or second visit to Rome. Be sure to have good walking shoes and a good guide book. Excellent for history lovers!

A must see when in Rome !. A amazing place to visit. Aparently where Rome had it's foundation as a city with a beautiful walk thru the gardens and breathtaking views of Rome city and it's attractions from the top of the hill.Make sure you get a map of the place when you buy the tickets because there are only few signs to direct you and you have 29 places to see between the entrance and the exit.Wear comfy shoes , it took us about 3 1/2 hours to visit and we walked on uneven terrain, took stairs,etc. The restrooms are at the entrance and close to the exit, no bars,etc.You will be happy to have visited this amazing place filled with history ! :-)

Breath taking!. Absolutely loved it. Would highly recommend buying tickets ahead of time though as the lines can be a bit long. Especially if the third ring and underground are open and you'd like to view them
2nd Time and still as amazing!. Get queue skip with the Roma Pass - or wait until about 4pm and go then and the queues arent so big :)
Amazing. A must-do in Rome. Worth the queue - it moves pretty fast and you can pre-book via the internet. Get the audio tour!
Fantastic. This whole tour was amazing, you don't appreciate it until you are there. We booked a guided tour so you get to see you the best bits and the right history information.

Big complex, so be sure to consult a map and not miss anything. The Colosseum and Roman Forum/Palatine Hill are side by side, both literally and in terms of must-see attractions. However, be warned that the site is quite large, and somehow we were able to miss an entire section! Still can't believe we managed to do that, lol.

Timeless. This is a must see in ones lifetime, you cannot believe this is 2000 years old and so perfect, it explains many things of our modern society. You must visit if you love architecture, history and life in general.

I wish I had more time to expend there.... Everything was awesome! We bought the Roma Pass, that gave us free pass to the public transport of Rome, including 2 free entries at some tourist places, so we went to the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. Doesn't have to explain how awesome it was to see this things. For me, the Roman Forum was best, because we could see the beginning of Rome, where the city was founded and the great seeing from there to the Circus Maximus.

Beautiful at Night. We didn't take the tour, but walking on the grounds outside both in the day and especially at night create a real sense of history. The lighting at night casts beautiful shadows in the archways. It's obviously a great location for photos.
Amazing!. So much to see and take in. It requires a guide or prereading of tour book. you will need to a guide book to understand all you see.
Start at Palatine Hill. This was recommended by our hotel as there are no lines and crowds. It's very peaceful up there and the view of the Forum amid all ruins is incredible.

This was amazing. Enjoyed this experience so much! It was so great to see all these places but I think for history and a true feel you need to do this on a tour plus you can skip the lines (the lines get so big its actually ridiculous) I think otherwise you wouldnt understand what you were looking at or get the full appreciation. Reguardless it is all amazing places and a great site definitely a must.

As good as it gets. Wonderful Roman ruins in the centre of Rome. 1ticket gets you in to all 3 sights. Dont rush these sights. Take your lunch into the Forum and watch the world go by. Great history and good photo opportunities.
